messages.content: What is the purpose of the Random Network Distillation algorithm in reinforcement learning?

The Random Network Distillation algorithm encourages exploration by training another neural network to approximate the output of a randomly initialized target network, using the discrepancy in predictions to explore new stateaction spaces.

phi argminphi mathbbEs,a,s sim D left left hatfphis fthetas right right Conservative QLearning in offline reinforcement learning aims to prevent policy value overestimation by learning a lowerbound Qfunction, reducing those for unseen stateaction pairs.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about cloud, titled 'Cost Mismanagement in AWS'.

messages.content: What happened when you attempted to advance pay AWS on June 4?
On June 4, I attempted to advance pay AWS. However, there was a wire transfer fee of 25 dollars. I deposited 50 dollars into my AWS account.
What steps did you take to try to make your blog accessible in a different language?
I attempted to make my blog accessible in Chinese by calling the AWS translation API.
What issue did the user encounter when using the translation API in their cloud-based application?
The translation API was very good, but I kept batch processing my entire blog each time, thinking it was cheap.
How many words did you have to process multiple times due to formatting issues with the Chinese content on your blog?
It turns out my blog has around 100,000 words, and I processed it about 10 times due to minor formatting issues in Chinese.
What charges were incurred due to not properly shutting down a V100 GPU instance in the cloud?
This resulted in a 100 dollars charge to my account. I didnt shut down my V100 GPU after using it, costing around 70 dollars.

default. average returns being more stable batch has less variance after initially reaching 200. similar in performance. poor variance compared to other values.
What does the advantage estimate become when not accounting for future rewards?
0.99 experiences a significant drop towards the end. suggesting that not accounting for future rewards is less effective. The advantage estimate becomes the same as the TD Temporal Difference error.

variance, indicating that overemphasizing longterm rewards can lead to unstable learning.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about security, titled 'End to End Secure File Sharing System'.

messages.content: What are the key components used to ensure end-to-end security in the file sharing system?

Enc keys are deterministicArgon2, username and password, Sign with private key and store public sign key in keystore UUID is deterministc Argon2, username and password Since encryption protects the confidentiality, the attacker doesnt know the privatesignkey.
What is the purpose of the File Struct containing a startNode and pointers to the endNode in the context of the secure file sharing system?
If datastore is changed, the attacker wont be able to generate a valid signature File Struct contains a startNode and pointers to the endNode.
How is file data stored in the end-to-end secure file sharing system?
File data is stored in a linked list of many UUIDs, each encrypted and MAC with different keys.
What is the risk of storing the file metadata in the owner's user struct?
Anyone knowing the file struct will be able to see the file data. Filename is stored in owners user struct only.
How does the system handle the case where a user already has a file stored in the system?

Node with data in it UUID value new Node with data in it UUID value Basically we dont change the keys or file UUID if user already has the file in store file Go to file UUID, then traverse the Node linked list, decrypt the file data on each node and return the whole file new Node with data in it endnode, and encrypt file UUID value UUID, username to the ownerfile struct user privatekey the invitationfile UUID, EncKey, DecKey, store in the new UUID new UUID Add the new filename and UUID to the end of the sharedfile list UUIDchange file location other shared users could access the file except for the owner the invitation 0.08 Penalty The client should not leak the length of filenames.
Why should the 0.08 Penalty Append not scale with the number of files a user has or the length of a user's username?
0.08 Penalty Append should NOT scale with the number of files a user has. 0.08 Penalty Append should NOT scale with the length of a users username.
What happens when a user tries to accept an invitation using a filename that has already been used by a file they previously created or received?
0.01 Penalty Call AcceptInvitation using a used filename used by a file we created. 0.01 Penalty Call AcceptInvitation using a used filename used by a file we previously recieved.
What is the penalty and effect of accepting an invitation to a different file instead of the original file when sharing files securely?
0.01 Penalty Call AcceptInvitation after swapping invitation with another for a different file. instead of the original filename and username, which reduces the bandwidth.
How does the system store file information to ensure security and deterministic access?

Datastore, instead store it in deterministic position by username and filenamehash and encrypt using the publickey UserFileInfoInvitationPointerInvitationFile Struct UserFileInfoInvitationUUIDList I got a good score but there was mistakes nevertheless.
Why were you frustrated and did not want to write your code again after discovering the bugs?
I was frustrated and didnt want to write my code again after discovering the bugs because I feared that there might be more bugs.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about linux, titled 'Booting Ubuntu 22.04'.

messages.content: What operating system did you install on your laptop, and how was the installation process?
Windows is heavy, slow, and hard to clean up. Installing Ubuntu 22.04 on my own laptop took me a lot of time. This article describes this process.
What is the download link and size of the Ubuntu 22.04 server image?
Here is the link ubuntu.comdownloadserver It is 1.8 GB large.
How do you create a bootable USB drive to install Ubuntu 22.04 on a computer?

Download it and move it to a usb, you can use rufus on windows or balenaetcher on linux, whatever Keep clicking f2 and f12 or whatever or Then you will enter a page like this In my case the KingstonDataTraveler 2.0 is the USB, so disable the other HDD device, then save and exit, then you will enter a menu like this isnt my own picture but it is similar enough Just go step by step, remember to connect the wifi in the process because it is hard for me to connect to wifi in scratch in the terminal.
What is the typical process for installing the Ubuntu 22.04 system?
Mainly just click ok, The time of installing the system varies, and sometimes takes quite a long time.
What should the user do after removing the USB and booting the PC again when installing Ubuntu 22.04?
Then remove the usb and boot the pc again, you shall enter ubuntu 22.04. When first booting into ubuntu, it may be a terminal without gui. You cant even use the mouse.
What steps should one take to set up a desktop environment on Ubuntu 22.04, address networking issues, manage passwords, and customize the desktop appearance?

I choose lightdm but anything is fine sudo apt install lightdm sudo apt install ubuntudesktop reboot Then it will boot into a desktop You get a beautiful computer No wifi Wifi adapter not found start job is running for wait for network to be configured Solution go to recovery mode Go to root and change the document 00installerconfig.yaml to this, then you wont have any problems Forgetting passwords Go to recovery mode and Then you can change the password and boot normally Since the desktop icon is ugly, go to ubuntu software and search extensions, then you can disable the desktop icons from extensions.
What can you do if the dock in Ubuntu 22.04 is unattractive?
Since the dock is ugly, you can also disable the dock.
What is the recommended way to enable cursor movement while typing in Ubuntu 22.04?
Since by default you cant move the cursor when typing, do gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.peripherals.touchpad disablewhiletyping false QQ has a linux version, and it is very easy to use.
Does WeChat work on a computer?
However, WeChat doesnt.electronic WeChat doesnt work I dont usually use WeChat on computer but it is just interesting to see how it works.
What software can be used to run Windows applications on a Linux server, and what are some of the challenges with using it?
You can use wine to do exe files on linux servers. But wine is hard to configure, and the newest version cant load. Some other version of WeChat worked, though.
What cloud platform can you use to create a virtual machine instance in just 5 minutes?
This is WeChat 2.6.7 Create a google cloud server You can also create a vm on google cloud in 5 minutes, just create a new vm instance.
What is the process for installing Ubuntu 22.04 on a cloud server after downloading the ISO image?
Then connect it via cloud run in cloud shell Installing ubuntu cost a lot of time but it is fun to use, and worth the time.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about security, titled 'How to Block a Website'.

messages.content: What is a browser extension that can help block websites?
There is blocksite chrome extension which helps you block websites.
What are some efficient ways to block harmful websites without relying on browser extensions?

But it is inefficient because 1 Guest Mode no extension 2 I can easily use another browser like, firefox, opera, palemoon, slim, links2, etc By changing the etchosts file one can easily block harmful websites by then adding 1 example.com Then in the same directory using sudo chattr i filename Now sudo cannot delete the file directly but sudo can chattr i then delete the file.
How can you block a domain using a system service?
Add a file in usrlocalbin make it executable by Then add a systemctl service add a timer to the same directory Then start the service You can use firewall to block a domaim.
What is the purpose of using ufw in relation to the firewall?
Ufw is like a frontend to iptables and ip6tables, so I am not using the firewall.
What is the first step to take when trying to block a website?
First dig the domain Also if there are domains with cnames ipv6 comes to another domain instead of ip address then continue digging.
How can you block a website using iptables and ensure the rules persist after rebooting?

Then drop the ip address in the iptables and ip6tables blocks example.com However, they are not persistent, so after rebooting rule losts, so run sudo aptget install iptablespersistent Then store the rule You can also use tcpdump to block websites, also this is unconventional Add a script that everytime a website is visited just shutdown the computer.
How difficult is it to effectively block harmful and explicit websites?
However, the amount of harmful and gore and explicit websites are far beyond ones controlthere are like millions so it cannot be blocked. Nevertheless blocking websites is very fun.
How can the root user of a computer bypass website blocking methods?
Also, there is no way to completely block a website to the root of the computer since the root can do anything.
How can a user prevent a website from being accessible, even if the website owner tries to circumvent the blocking?
User can almost never control the roots behavioreven root cannot set rules for root.
What is a potential issue with using a systemd service to shut down a computer, and how can it be recovered?

The only exception is like you start a systemd service to shutdown when the computer starts, which can still be recovered by booting into a recovery mode or use a live CDUSB, mount your systems root partition, and then remove or disable the problematic service.
How can you ensure that a program continues running in the background, even if the user tries to shut it down?
I previously thought like you can start 2 programs in the background like one ensuring the other is run, so you can never shut these down.
What is a potential drawback of using certain methods to block a website?
However, the root can just kill both of them. So at the end of the day just embrace the variety of Internet and accept the harmful instances.
How can you prevent someone from accessing a website if they are determined to reach it?
There is no blocking away from them if your heart pursues.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about berkeley, titled 'How I Applied to the Exchange Program at UC Berkeley'.

messages.content: What was your initial mindset when you applied to the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
When I applied, I wasnt very serious I just wanted to take a chance. I started the form on Oct 7th.
What were your thoughts on whether to participate in an exchange program at the time you were writing your statement of purpose for UC Berkeley?
At that time, I was still hesitating about whether to go to an exchange program or not. I would like to, but I need to do many things anyway.
What prompted you to apply to the Berkeley exchange program on October 26th?
On Oct 26th, I had nothing to do, and my neighborhood was locked down. Thus, I applied to the Berkeley exchange program.
What made you realize you wanted to go to another environment for a reasonable time during your exchange program?
Also, UCIs ASAP exchange program I realized I wanted to go to another environment for a reasonable time.

Why did you feel that your experience at the exchange program at UC Berkeley did not help you realize your goals and left you undecided about your future, and what were your thoughts on the lockdowns?
Being here didnt help me realize my goals, and I was undecided about my future. Furthermore, Im not too fond of lockdowns.
Where did you want to go again after remembering your happy times in 6th and 7th grade?
I remembered my happy times in 6th and 7th grade in Boston and California. I wanted to go again. 1.
When is the deadline to apply for the Berkeley Global Access program for the spring semester?
Applying to Berkeley Global Access Go to Berkeley Global Access The deadline is Nov 1st for the spring semester, so dont worry.
What are the steps to apply for the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
Just sign up for a student account and apply. Follow four steps and wait to be admittedrejected. Write 8001000 words describing your experiences and why you stand out.
What are the key financial considerations for a student applying to the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
English scores Not very high standard Prepare about 25k dollars for one semester. You can apply for two semesters. I didnt apply for summer sessions. 2.
What are the next steps after applying to the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
After Applying Thats about all. There are many articles about the exchange semester in Berkeley if you search on Google.
What is unique about your academic background compared to other applicants to the UC Berkeley exchange program?
Some of these students arent from prestigious universities and arent studying STEM subjects. Somehow I just got admitted. You will receive a congratulatory letter and enroll. 3.
Where can international students at UC Berkeley find information and assistance for the exchange program application process?
Enrolling and Adjusting Details You can ask questions in the Berkeley ISS International Student Service or BGA. You can easily find the email addresses if you search on Google.
What should you keep in mind about the name you use when applying to the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
Notice that your preferred name may be different from your actual name.
How can you change your registered name on your profile if you applied using a preferred name?
If you registered using your preferred name, email them, and they will change it for you somehow, you cant change it in the profile.
What is your experience with the responsiveness and customer service of the exchange program at UC Berkeley?
The emails are replied to very quickly, and the attitudes are good. They always say, thank you for reaching out, or something like that.
What should you do to ensure your I-20 and F1 visa application is processed?
It is ok to write emails to bother them. Then they will process your I20 4. Visa Application Fill out a form and apply for an F1 visa.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about berkeley, titled 'Finding My Identity'.

messages.content: What has been on your mind lately regarding your experiences at USTC and your personal growth?
I have such controversial thoughts these days. I think that I adapted pretty well to USTC. I dont know why I am thinking that.
What is your current perspective on your situation at USTC?
What I think is that, basically, I think I know what to do at USTC. I mean, I even think I am pretty well off there.
What was your experience like during the COVID-19 pandemic, and how did it impact your plans or daily life?
I dont even think there would be a problem if it wasnt for the covid restrictions and mass testing. The only thing would be that I was kinda bored.
How did you feel about your life and identity for the past five years before realizing the need for change?
But that doesnt matter cause I had been feeling bored for half a decade. I think I got used to that kind of life and identity now.
Where would you be right now if you were back at USTC?
If I am back in USTC right now, I would be living in my house on the 32nd floor and preparing for my exams.
What would you consider doing if you realized you needed to change your original academic path?
Then I would try coding and doing cool stuff about computer science. I mean, I dont even see a problem there, strangely. I know exactly what to do in China.
What has changed for you at USTC that has allowed you to feel more certain about your path forward?
I know exactly what to do at USTC. I found my identity. I can follow the path down the road. I dont need to think that much.
What are your plans for achieving your goals, and how do you feel about potentially attending a different Chinese university with a more balanced gender ratio?
I will achieve my goals. I dont know what to do if I am in another Chinese university, like those universities with equal gender ratios. I seriously dont.
What do you and your peers think about the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC)?
But we like USTC, and we dont talk about them.
What did you feel like when you were criticizing USTC, before experiencing the unfriendly world outside?
I mean, back then, when I was saying USTC sucks, I didnt even know what it feels like outside in this unfriendly world.
What has been your experience with the social aspects of life at USTC?
USTC isnt friendly in some aspects, but there is a way to solve these problems and get along with life, right? I dont know.
What are your thoughts about reflecting on your current situation in the future?
I will probably see this post, like, one year later and see what I would be thinking. But I am here, and there is no going back.
What are the main activities you engage in on a regular basis?
1 Studying CS courses 2 Doing school work 3 Running and hiking 4 Optional Expanding my own blog and doing fiction and film reviews Thats it.
How did you feel about your ability to explore the outside world during your middle school years?
I would be fine in my undergrad years Back then, in middle school, when I desperately wanted to know the outside world, I couldnt.
What changes did you have to make in order to adapt to your new learning environment at USTC?
I learned to adapt to the learning environment and everything. The bridge is crossed, so stand and watch it burn. Weve passed the Point of no return.
What was your perception of your situation back at USTC?
What I would be doing back in USTC is seemed well off. I build this fantasy in my imagination, and it is wrong. I need to find a new community here.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about linux, titled 'Setting Up Raspberry Pi OS'.

messages.content: How can one streamline the process of setting up and configuring Raspberry Pi OS?
Setting up and configuring Raspberry Pi OS can be a streamlined process by using chroot on a different machine.
How can you set up a Raspberry Pi SD card on a laptop without directly accessing the Raspberry Pi during the initial setup?
This guide will walk through the steps to prepare your Raspberry Pi SD card on a laptop, eliminating the need for direct access to the Raspberry Pi during the initial setup.
What will be the end result of following this guide on setting up Raspberry Pi OS?
By the end of this guide, youll have a fully configured Raspberry Pi OS with network settings, a working SSH connection, and optional proxy configurations also for users in Mainland China.
Why do you prefer chrooting over using a desktop environment on the Raspberry Pi?
Chrooting is a very easy way to configure an sdcard, and I just dont like the idea of a desktop environment on Raspbery Pi, which complicates things.
What are some limitations and necessary steps when chrooting the SD card on a laptop for setting up a Raspberry Pi OS?

Chroot is very powerful, and there are certain limitationsfor example, not able to sudo or start a systemd service inside chroot This is necessary for chrooting the sdcard on my laptop sudo apt install qemuuserstatic Before configuring the Raspberry Pi, we need to copy some essential files to the target file system.
Why is chrooting necessary when using a Raspberry Pi with an ARM processor to run an x86 operating system?
This allows for chrootingsince the laptop is usually x86 and the rasp pi is usually arm, and we need the resolve conf to have network connection.
What files are required to be copied to the Chroot environment when setting up Raspberry Pi OS?
These files include qemuaarch64static and resolv.conf. Mounting the file systems and entering the Chroot environment allows us to perform configuration operations in the target system.

What steps should be taken to access device, process, and system information in the Chroot environment, and how can the default software sources be changed to local mirrors to speed up package downloads?
Mount the dev proc sys directories to access devices, processes, and system information in the Chroot environment. To speed up package downloads, change the default software sources to local mirrors.
What should you do after completing the configuration and chrooting into the environment?
After completing the configuration, unmount the previously mounted file systems. After chrooting, I can run commands now. I add the wifi service to automatically connect to Berkeley Eduroam.
How can I connect to my Raspberry Pi over SSH when I'm unable to determine the correct IP address using nmap?

So I add a service etcsystemdsystemconnectwifi.service Where the connect wifi scriptadd the appropriate wifi I need to get the ip address for ssh, because when I tried using nmap to find the ip to ssh into it returned dozens of addresses and I couldnt find the appropriate one.
What steps did you take to perform a sanity check on your Raspberry Pi's Wi-Fi connection?

To make a sanity check to see if Rasp Pi is connected to wifi, I added another service, I post the ip address online every minute I used webhook, and the script Then configure the password of user pi.
How did you ensure that you could ssh into the network from the same network after setting up the Raspberry Pi OS?
After setting up the network to start default at boot, I could ssh into it from the same network.
What command should you run to connect to the Raspberry Pi and what is the purpose of using Clash on the device?
ssh pi10.40.88.225 This is only needed in Mainland China to bypass the firewall. Download the Clash executable file and transfer it to the Raspberry Pi.
What is the process for setting up and running the Clash proxy client on a Raspberry Pi running Raspberry Pi OS?
Clash is a multiplatform proxy client. Download the Arm64 Linux Version, then use SCP to transfer it to the Raspberry Pi. To start Clash, run the following command.
How can we initiate the Clash proxy and switch between different proxies using the Clash API?
This will initiate Clash using the specified configuration file. To switch between different proxies, we will utilize the Clash API.
How can you list the available proxy servers from the configuration file using a script?
Follow these steps First, create a script to list the available proxy servers from the configuration file. This script will extract the server names using awk.
How can you switch the proxy server used by the Clash software on a Raspberry Pi running Raspberry Pi OS?

After listing the servers, you can switch the proxy server by making an API call to the Clash serverassuming port 9090 Save this as a file setproxy.sh then do source setproxy.sh using bash setproxy.sh doesnt work I can move mp3 files into the Rasp Pi OS then use cvlc, then listen with a earphone for example I can adjust volumes with alsamixer

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about journal, titled 'Reflections at the Start of 2024'.

messages.content: What cloud service did you ultimately choose for your personal computing needs, and why did you prefer it over other options?
I considered various cloud services before ultimately settling on Linode for its simplicity and familiarity. AWS felt overwhelmingly complex by comparison.
What changes have you made to your computing infrastructure in the past year?
Ive transitioned from Ubuntu instances in Fremont to smaller, Nanode Archlinux configurations in Osaka.
What piqued your interest in visiting Osaka, Japan despite never having been there before?
The allure of Osakas beauty piqued my interest, despite never having visited Japana trip I aspire to make one day.
Why did you choose to invest in Linode's object storage over more mainstream options like Dropbox?
I invested in Linodes object storage, even though its pricier than mainstream options like Dropbox Linodes 1 TB is 20 compared to Dropboxs 2 TB for 10.
What appealed to you about Linode's open-source nature, despite the cost?
Despite the cost, the opensource nature of Linode appealed to me.
How do you manage your files and access the internet in China?
To manage my files, I set up a filebrowser frontend and a backend with s3fs, which offers an experience akin to Dropbox. Navigating the internet in China necessitates a VPN.
What services did you initially try before settling on Nexitally?
Initially, I experimented with various services on my iPhone and laptop but settled on Nexitally after dissatisfaction with the speed and performance of others.
What is the importance of having a reliable VPN, especially when using software in China?
A reliable VPN is critical for comfortable browsing and communication. Ive found much of the software in China frustratingly inadequate.
What is the main issue with the Chinese Telecom App that you have encountered?
The Chinese Telecom App, for example, is a source of constant irritation. Theres a notable lack of quality, opensource options that allow for customization.
What experience with a driving car app did you find to be nauseating?
Even a driving car app has proven to be a nauseating experience.
Why are you reluctantly learning to drive at your parents' insistence during the winter holidays at home?
Though reluctant, Im learning to drive at my parents insistence, spending much of the winter holidays at home for lessons.
What dental procedure have you recently begun, and how has it impacted your appreciation for solitude?

In addition, Ive begun the process to correct my crooked teeth, which includes the painful procedure of wisdom tooth extraction. Ive grown to appreciate solitude, especially away from parental supervision.
What has your experience of living independently in the U.S. been like?
My year in the U.S. has led me to a comfortable level of independence, where I find less need for the familial home.
What has become the primary focus of your parents' involvement in your life?
My parents main role has become more about ensuring my adherence to a routine than companionship.
What has driven you to eliminate unnecessary possessions, save for a few cherished items like small graduation photo books?
My inclination towards minimalism has grown, driving me to eliminate unnecessary possessions, save for a few cherished items like small graduation photo books.
How has your dedication to Arch Linux and its philosophy evolved over time?

Concurrently, my dedication to Arch Linux and its philosophy has deepened. As years pass, Im reminded of the importance of engaging in meaningful activities, though procrastination remains a tempting diversion.
What is the ongoing challenge you have been facing in your personal life?
The ongoing challenge is to focus on productivity and selfimprovement amidst the distractions. Ive abstained from gaming for over two and a half months, a difficult and often tempting journey.
How is your progress in overcoming a persistent urge to relapse, despite reaching a milestone often cited as a turning point?
Despite nearing the 90day milestone often cited as a turning point, the struggle persists, and I continue to work towards overcoming the urge to relapse.

messages.content: What have you been working on for your new website over the past 2 weeks?
I am testing out the functions and trying to deploy the backend. Today I am creating the web which I have been doing for like 2 weeks.
What is your current progress on building a web application, and what challenges are you facing?
I am a slow learner but I was very curious about web application. Fortunately, I am building one right now. I am still trying to deploy the app. 1.

In ArchLinux the traditional nginx user, http user isnt created. One can create any user based on the needs. 6.

As much as I love ArchLinux, most of the packages are community maintained and on a rolling release, meaning I have to maintain the setup script activelyor else it wont work, but most likely it wont have any problems.

I am far from utilzing the cpus, as the average usage is around 3 percent for my website.

I want to migrate to Hertzner because I think I probably like Helsinki and it offers bigger storage options with much cheaper pricing, and resources can be a little more utilized 8.

Misconfiguration of nginx can cause react website to render incorrectlyit still works but the react frontend buttons changed into clickboxes and got bundled together, kinda weird 9.

Explicitly rewrite the api route in nginx rewrite api. 1 break 10.

Dont request too many certs from certbot, there is a limit and my website got down for 2 days because of requesting too many certs 11.

Automated scripts makes vps much easier to control, on the downsides that they need some debugging

So variety is an app in gnome software which can change your background. The pictures are good, and you can adjust how long the desktop will change.

I kind of think that the scenery in the lower latitudes are mediocre.

People left their tokens in their code, not in env file, which I think is bad practice and very insecure. But anyways this is just for fun and not serious.

The service is in systemctl and it starts every 5 mins, so like every 5 mins the wallpaper will change, but only when there is internet connection will the 20 wallpaper images change.

I used bash script because it looks cool. Python kind of works the same.

Search for the oldest image and delete them delete until there are less than 20 images Keep the count in an index file, so I can increase it every time the thing runs.

Then after getting the count then sorting the images we get the corresponding index.

After that set the gnome dektop background, then increase the currentindex to make it different next time, and store the currentindex in the index file. Create folder and then choose a random search term.

Add 20 to the search term to replace the blank spaceor it wont work in the pixabay API Check if theres Internet, if there is no internet, then dont do anything.
How do you fetch and download the full HD image from Pixabay to use as a wallpaper?
Then if there is internet, we go to pixabay, and fetch the fullhdurl, then download the image, naming it using timestamps.
What do you need to specify for each entry of the API when customizing wallpapers for Gnome?
You need to specify each entry of the api Recently I felt kind of frustrated with almost everything, and northern Europe seems appealing to me.
What is your perspective on the complexity of life and your ability to understand its deeper meaning?
I dont know what is the meaning of life, and I cannot figure out so many things. Everything just became more and more complex.

Anyways, downloading and changing wallpapers is very fun, but I believe I will soon change back to the classic JellyFish.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about california, titled 'Visiting Concord'.

messages.content: Where did you venture to today, as opposed to the famed Concord near Boston that you had visited in the summer of 2016?
Today, I ventured to Concord. Not the famed Concord near Boston, where Id been in the summer of 2016, but the one situated north of the Bay Area.
What was the experience like upon exiting the Bart Station in Concord, California?
Upon exiting the Bart Station, I was greeted by a radiant sunny day. The vibrant ambiance of Clayton Road beckoned.
What distinctive features of the streets and homes did you notice while visiting Concord?
Distinctive black road signs adorned the streets, complemented by picturesque homes that exuded charm and classic elegance.
What led you to Galindo Street, where you indulged in a delightful meal at a restaurant simply named Ramen?
My appetite led me to Galindo Street, where I indulged in a delightful meal at a restaurant simply named Ramen.
Where did you head to after your lunch?
Postlunch, I contemplated my next destination and eventually meandered towards the Amusement Park. The main roads teemed with vehicles, in stark contrast to the serene lanes nearby.
What caught your attention during your visit to the amusement park?
Though the park itself seemed underpopulated with just one other visitor, a parade of geese caught my attention.
What was the sight that reminded you of a geese school and was truly enchanting?
Their synchronized movement was so impeccable it reminded me of a geese school. The sight was truly enchanting.
What direction did you travel along Port Chicago Highway?
With curiosity still at its peak, I embarked on a northward journey up Port Chicago Hwy.
What happened to the path after Panoramic Road?
The path grew challenging postPanoramic Road, with the absence of pavements and speeding cars zooming past.
What prompted you to quicken your pace towards the more developed side of the road during your visit to the California Delta Highway?
A somewhat unsettling encounter with a peculiar individual near the California Delta Highway quickened my pace, urging me towards the more developed side of the road.
What landscape feature was observed adjacent to the California Delta Highway?
Adjacent to the California Delta Highway lay an expansive golf course, a verdant expanse dotted with ponds and trees.
What did you observe about the area that dampened your spirits despite its evident beauty?
Its beauty was evident, but the No Public Access sign dampened my spirits. The potential of this space being a public park crossed my mind.
Where did you go in search of a different perspective while visiting Concord?
Seeking another view, I made my way towards the Reservoir via Bates Avenue. However, the journey was less than pleasant.
What did the narrator observe while traveling through the industrial area of Concord?
Industrial structures loomed large, pavements were in disrepair, and the constant roar of vehicles was almost deafening.
What was the experience like when visiting the Reservoir during the hike?
The onemile trek felt laborious, but the sight of the Reservoir, with its deep blue waters and distant mountain vistas, offered solace. Unfortunately, it too was closed to the public.
Where did you find yourself feeling weary and disoriented, prompting you to decide it was time to retreat?
Finding myself amidst the stark environment of the industrial park, feeling weary and slightly disoriented, I decided it was time to retreat.
What unusual encounter prompted your decision to return to the Bart Station?
An unusual barefoot individual crossed my path, reinforcing my decision. Not in the mood for further exploration, I summoned a Lyft to whisk me back to the Bart Station.
What did you notice about the experience of visiting the industrial park in Concord?
While Concords downtown area radiates charm, the industrial park isnt conducive to leisurely walks. Future visits might benefit from better planning to truly appreciate the citys beauty.
What mode of transportation would allow for better exploration and focus on the scenic locales of Concord?
Perhaps having a car would facilitate better exploration, ensuring focus on Concords scenic locales.

It is live. Building a website and playing with html is interesting but wastes lots of time.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about linux, titled 'Configuring Terminal Emulator'.

messages.content: What shortcomings does the default GNOME terminal emulator, gnometerminal, have when it comes to copy-pasting functionality?
The default terminal emulator in GNOME, gnometerminal, leaves a lot to be desired when it comes to intuitive copypasting.
What are your thoughts on the cumbersome process of selecting text and copying it using the mouse and keyboard shortcuts in the terminal emulator?
The necessity of using the mouse to select text, followed by ctrlshiftc to copy, feels cumbersome. Moreover, navigating through it isnt as smooth as one would hope.
What terminal emulators did you explore during your journey to find the perfect fit for your needs?
My journey took me through various terminals byobu, xterm, and kitty, each having their unique perks but none fitting the bill perfectly.
When did you first start exploring the capabilities of Vim, and what made you revert to using gedit for most of your tasks?
I delved into Vim about a year ago but found myself gravitating back to gedit for most tasks, perhaps not having tapped into Vims true potential back then.
What terminal text editor have you found to be particularly efficient for editing extensive files?
However, Ive since recognized the unparalleled efficiency of Vim, especially for editing extensive text files in the terminal.
What feature of the terminal emulator makes it highly efficient for users who prefer to minimize mouse usage?
Its vast array of shortcuts and keyboard bindings facilitates an almost mousefree experience.
What was your initial approach to imparting vi-like behavior in the Gnome terminal?
Initially, I tried set o vi in the gnome terminal to impart vi behavior, but it wasnt seamless.
What challenges did you encounter with the classic jk commands and command navigation in Vim?

The classic jk commands, which would typically navigate lines in Vim, fetched previous commands instead. Plus, unrestricted navigation through past commands was a challenge, and visual mode was lackluster.
How did the terminal mode in Neovim compare to the terminal mode in Vim?
This led me to explore the terminal mode in Vim, which I found a bit cluttered. In contrast, the terminal mode in Neovim stood out, boasting a seamless experience.
What is the default mode of the terminal emulator that allows for easy switching between insert and visual modes, improving terminal navigation significantly?
It defaults to normal mode, allowing easy toggling between insert and visual modes, enhancing terminal navigation considerably.
What noteworthy tweak was made to the keybinding for switching to normal mode in the terminal?
A noteworthy tweak was adjusting the keybinding to switch to normal mode in the terminal. The ubiquitous esc key, though tempting, can conflict with other terminal processes.
How did you remap the caps key systemwide?
I remapped the caps key systemwide to f13 using xmodmap .Xmodmap in the bashrc.
What did you add to your Neovim configuration file .config/nvim/init.vim to achieve two primary goals?

In my Neovim configuration .confignviminit.vim, I added This setup achieves two primary goals linking yanking and pasting in Neovim directly to the clipboard and utilizing the caps key as a trigger for normal mode, making the workflow more fluid.
What enhancement was made to the gnometerminal to launch with Neovim's terminal mode by default?
Optimizing the gnometerminal to launch with Neovims terminal mode by default was another enhancement.
What was your next focus after ensuring smooth navigation in the terminal?
Achieved with After ensuring smooth navigation in the terminal, my next focus was on file editors within Neovims terminal.
What issues did you encounter when using Vim within the terminal, and how did Neovim compare in this context?
I noticed Vim had bugs when used inside the terminal, seemingly due to conflicts with Neovim. However, Neovim itself was bugfree in this context.
How can you switch between normal mode and terminal mode in the Neovim file editor?
I could use the esc key to enter normal mode in the file editor, and the caps key for Neovims terminal mode.
What Neovim feature is particularly useful for managing multiple terminal sessions or files simultaneously?
Neovims sp command comes in handy for window splits, complemented by the ctrlw w navigation shortcut. This feature is a boon for simultaneously handling multiple terminal sessions or files.
What terminal commands can be used to retrieve specific parts of the previous command?
Commands like !0 and !1 after python example.py retrieve python and example.py respectively, while ! ! fetches the entire previous command. Such conveniences bolster efficiency in the terminal.
How has redirecting terminal history and adding an alias to bashrc been beneficial for managing and accessing logs?
Easily redirecting terminal history with history Downloadshistory has been beneficial. Additionally, the alias added to bashrc, streamlines the process of viewing logs, making it a cinch.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about california, titled 'Visiting Fremont'.

messages.content: Why did you decide to visit Fremont over the weekend?
I am kind of bored these days so I went to Fremont in the weekend. Just out of curiosity.
Why did you want to visit Fremont?
Also, I heard that Fremont is really rich, so I wanted to there and see for myself.
Where did you start your journey before taking the BART train for around 30 minutes?
I walked to North Berkeley Bart station where I usually run to that station at night, then took the Bart for like 30 minutes.
What is the main feature of Fremont Central Park?
There is a beautiful park in the center, and a lake in the middle called Lake Elizabeth. The park is lovely, and many people are like walking around the park.
What parks are available around the Berkeley area?
I realize there are no good parks around Berkeley, except for maybe Strawberry Creek Park, which is like smaller than the forest area in the university.
What did you do when you visited Fremont Central Park?
I went in and got a map of the park. Occasionally there are people speaking Chinese, but also some looking like hispanic. There are no homeless people in the park.
What did you notice about the landscape in Fremont Central Park?
There is a series of hills across the park, and those are all yellow, which is kind of ugly.
What kinds of activities did you find in Fremont Central Park that you were not interested in?
There are so called many activities in the central park, but I am not interested in any of them.
What was the state of the roads outside the park?
After going out of the park there were no people on the roads, like no one at all, but there were many cars.
What was the weather like and where did you walk around in the late afternoon while visiting Fremont?
I was wearing long sleeves and long pants, and it became so hot in the late afternoon. I walked around Mission Valley, so called rich neighbourhood.
What is it like to walk around Fremont, California?
Basically it is quiet and you do not see a lot of people on the streets so food and restroom are hard to find.
How did you decide to travel around Fremont?
I figured since most people go out driving it wont be a problem. However, there are many cars on the roads, like Paseo Padre Road.
What was it like trying to cross the roads in Fremont?
It is hard to cross the roads because there is almost no pedestrians at all, and I had to press the button to actually cross.
What was your impression of the scenery in Fremont Central Park?
There are many tall trees in the middle of the road, and overall it is nicer than Berkeley, but not all that good.
Where did you walk around and then go to after that?
I mean, you can see such neighbourhoods almost everywhere. I walked around the neighbourhood, then went to Mission Community Park.
What was your experience with the terrain and transportation in Fremont compared to Berkeley?

It is overall not hilly compared to Berkeley, but traveling is extremely hard without a car, and in the end I walked many miles back to the Bart Station, and there is a long distance between different Bart stations.
How much water did you carry and what happened to it while visiting Fremont?
I carried 1.5 L water and drank all the water, since there are no grocery stores to refill.
Where did you find a very cheap and nice restaurant for around $15, similar to the prices in Berkeley?
There are, however, many restaurants out of the Bart Station, and I managed to find a very cheap and nice restaurant, and dinner cost me around 15 dollars, which is like the same price as Berkeley.
How did you feel when you returned to the Bart after exploring Fremont?
On going back to the Bart I felt a little cold, since it was getting dark.
What was your experience like after walking long distances in Fremont?
I was sore and tired from walking, and there wasnt much to do and see anyways.
How does Fremont compare to Berkeley as a place to visit?
Overall Fremont is better than Berkeley, since it is cleaner and there are no homeless people. However, getting around is definitely harder.
What did you think of the scenery at Fremont Central Park?
The scenery is medium, and those yellow hills are really ugly behind the park. Overall it should be like 8 or 9 out of 10.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about embedded, titled 'Pololu Robot and Lingua Franca'.

messages.content: What does this post describe?
This post describes my journey with Pololu Robot and Lingua Franca language.
Why are you taking embedded systems this semester?

So this semester I am taking embedded systems because I had been practically declined from all other classes I am interested in and OS is too much work, and they use Pololu Robot and Lingua Franca, thats why I am learning them.
What hardware and software components are used in the class to control and execute programs on the Pololu Robot RP2040 3pi?
The class uses Pololu Robot RP2040 3pi, and I need to connect a wire to the robot and run programs on my computer to make it execute stuff.

I bought the robot for 200 dollars since I was very curious, and didnt want to work not only in the labs but also work at home.

Lingua Franca is a little like React Nodejs to be honest, and when I first started with React I was very bad I still wasnt really good at it, like it have all those reactors and trigggers to make the program work.
What programming language are you particularly bad at?
But mostly is just C Program, which I am also very bad at.
What obstacles and bugs did you face at the start of the course that made you weary and sad?
As a result, I faced obstacles and bugs at the start of the course, making me weary and sad indeed.
Why did you think you were too stupid and not working hard enough?
But mostly it was because I am too stupid, and also I wasnt working hard enough.
What are the capabilities and limitations of ChatGPT compared to more widely used programming languages?
Lingua Franca is a new and not so widelyused language, so ChatGPT have limited abilitiesunlike C or Python or Javascript, but it is still very good in generating code.
What is the main difference between using GPTs and manually debugging with printf statements in Lingua Franca?
The only difference is that you have to manually debug with GPTs generation. So basically I had a really hard time making the printf statements in Lingua Francas work.
What went wrong with the Pololu robot project?
At the end it turned out everything was fine except that the manuel want clear and the TA had limited experience.
What steps did you need to take to get the robot to work, and what issue did you encounter with the connection?

So basically connect and make it bootsel mode RP1RP2 appearing in the media and run The problem was I couldnt find the ttyACM when connected, and it was because I hadnt used picotool to load the program into the robot.
How long did it take the TA to figure out the issue?
And it took so long for TA to figure it out. But anyways it went fine. First import the library.
What should you do to order events in a predictable manner within the model, independent of the actual passage of real-world time?
Then, use a New Display and set the line0 Logical Time In LF, logical time is used to order events in a predictable manner within the model, independent of the actual passage of realworld time.
When is physical time used in the Lingua Franca model?
Physical Time Physical time in LF is used when the the model needs to interact with the physical world or external components that operate in realtime.
What can cause problems if the right type is not specified, like ld vs lld?
Also, their types are different, and not specifying the right type, like ld vs lld can cause problems.
What is an example of code that demonstrates how to pass input from one reactor to another and output the sum?

This is an example of correctly printing out An example code to demonstrate the difference prints out We can get input basically from the output of another reactor, and then specifying the output to input, for example, below is a code that passes x and y to the Destination reactor, then outputs the sum.
What can we do to pass the input to a function or method in Lingua Franca?
Write s.x d.x to pass it. So input is usually not mutable, but we can set it.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about linux, titled 'Grub Bootloader and Exploring LFS'.

messages.content: What is the role of the Grub bootloader in the system?
So grub is basically a bootloader to start the system. The point here is Ive been using grub for almost a year now without a deep understanding.
How does the Grub bootloader start the system?
Grub boots the system by using grub shell. Grub starts from EFI system partition.
What configuration file specifies the boot entries and timeout settings that are displayed when the computer first starts?
There is a configuration file bootgrubgrub.cfg that specifies the entry I see when the computer first starts. There is also timeout, default entry.
How can I generate the Grub configuration file on Ubuntu and Arch Linux?
My grub config looks like this Run sudo updategrub on Ubuntu, or sudo grubmkconfig o bootgrubgrub.cfg on Arch, that shall generate the grub file.
What tool did you use to manually configure the partitions?
Also osprober is interesting tool to detect the partitions. But I just manually configured everything.
What should you do if there are issues with the Grub bootloader?
If grub goes wrong, boot from a live usb, go to the partition, then change the files in bootgrub directory, then it shall work right.
What can you do if there are errors with the Grub bootloader?
Alternatively, I can boot from grub shell. This partition stores linux kernel.
Why is it important to backup the grub.cfg file?
I get It is always a good idea to backup the grub.cfg since without grubif you dont have alternative bootloaders.
What can you do if the entries in the Grub configuration are not needed and you can boot directly from the Grub shell?
The entries in grub is not needed and I can just boot from grub shell. I can run Also kernels sometimes have the same name, e.g.
What are the different kernel file names used across different Linux distributions?
vmlinuzlts, vmlinuzvirt, they are different from one distro to the other.
What problems can arise when using different Linux distributions that point to the same kernel?
Pointing different distrosI tried Alpine and Arch pointing to the same kernel will have many bugs, for example, the touchpad wont respond, the wifi wont load.
Where can you place the kernel when using the Grub bootloader?
I can put the kernel either in boot partition or the ext4 partition.
What did you try after experimenting with a few Linux distributions?
So basically after trying out a few distributions I wanted to try something else, and there is Linux From Scratch.
What is the process of setting up a Linux environment in a separate disk partition, and how did you follow the handbook with the help of ChatGPT?
It is basically building a linux environment in a separate disk partition. There is a handbook, and I followed the handbook closely with ChatGPT explaining some stuff.
What was the process of installing packages like in the Linux From Scratch (LFS) project?
It is just a lot of copy pasting code from the handbook to execute in terminal. The first parts are very straightforward, and installing packages took a long time.
What happened when you tried to boot the system after installing the kernel?
After installing the kernel, the system doesnt boot. So I pointed the kernel to Arch Linuxmy host systems kernel and it booted, but with some errors and warnings.
What issue are you facing when trying to set up a network interface on your Linux system?
It can not find wireless interface and only returned lo when I run ip link There are many packages depending on each other so installing something is really hard.
What was your experience with installing the Gnome Desktop and the challenges you faced?
For example, the Gnome Desktop have a million dependencies, and after a while I run out of patience trying to install them, so I thought no gui good enough.
What is the importance of a properly configured kernel when considering the use of a graphical user interface (GUI) in a Linux system?
Without the kernel properly configured, I dont think there is much point in gui anyways, and you dont need a gui for computer to function.
What is the challenge when building packages without a package manager?
Without package manager, I need to manually build every package.
What is the primary reason you thought it would be better to use the LFS book to build packages rather than building them yourself?
LFS book specifies how to build many packages and I thought I would run into many more bugs if I am to build them myself.
What Linux distributions would you still use after exploring LFS (Linux From Scratch)?
So after all, I would still use Arch Linuxand a little Ubuntu, and LFS is just a fun project, and hopefully I did understand something more about the system.
What is your opinion on the LFS (Linux From Scratch) community and your experience with it?
I am very grateful for LFS community, and registered my name in their website, and I appreciate and would stick to open source.

messages.content: What are some of the notable features and experiences of the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
Riverside promenade is a great place for walking and to get a splendid view. One can always find shelter and water on the way.
How can one travel along the Huangpu River in Puxi?
There are two sides of Huangpu River, so there are two routes to go.
Where did you use to go walking when you lived in Zhongxing Road two years ago?
When I lived in Zhongxing Road two years ago I always went walking on the Puxi side of the route.
How far was your home from the Garden Bridge on Suzhou Creek?
My home was about 3 to 4 kilometers from the Garden Bridge on Suzhou Creek, but it often took me an hour to get there.
Why is the Puxi side of the Riverside Promenade crowded with many motorcycles?
The reason is that Puxi is crowded and there are so many motorcycles around.
What was a challenge you faced when navigating the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
There are too many small roads and I always had to wait for the light to turn green.
Where had you been when you lived in your previous home?
When I lived in my previous home I had been to almost everywhere around.
What was the extent of your familiarity with the local streets around your home in the Puxi area?
There is not a street I did not know in a distance less than 5 kilometers from my home.

I found, among those dirty streets, that the riverside Promenade is the best place to go for walking. On the weekends I would go walking south of Garden Bridge.

Sometimes it is crowded there, especially when there is a festival. So many people were there that I couldnt find a seat to enjoy the view.

But that is about the only place crowded. Walk southwards and gradually it becomes quieter. Go further south, about 4 kilometers and there are few people in sight.
What would you see when arriving at the end of your southward journey along the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
Then I would see Nanpu Bridge. As I was always tired when arriving at Nanpu Bridge, I would take line 4 home.

Sometimes on Sunday afternoon, I went to cram classes in Xueersi. The place is on Dalian Road.
What time would you start your walk on the Riverside Promenade in Puxi if the promenade opens at 3 pm?
Since it starts at 3 pm I would go out at 10 in the morning and have a walk. First I would walk to Garden Bridge. Then I would turn northward.
What section of the Riverside Promenade in Puxi is currently under construction and not visible from the path?
If you walk northward of Garden Bridge there is half a kilometer where you cannot see Huangpu River since the route along the river is under construction.
What is the description of a hotel you would typically stop at along the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
There is a hotel along the way which is very expensive and beautiful, where I usually took a rest inside.
What did you encounter after walking half a kilometer along the riverside promenade in Puxi?
Then after walking half a kilometer I came to a park. Near the park is a subway station International Cruise Terminal, line 12. The park is very beautiful.
What was happening inside the building that you did not take interest in?
People are playing some game involving jumping and swinging inside, but that I took no interest in.
What can be seen on the glasses at the International Cruise Terminal along the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
There are those glasses, on which you can see the history of the International Cruise Terminal, including some famous people.
What did you see through the transparent glass while on the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
The glass is transparent and I saw the tallest buildings in Pudong through them.
What did you see reflected in the building behind you while exploring the Riverside Promenade in Puxi at night?
At night I also saw the building behind me reflected, and it looks like its in the air in Pudong. Anyway, that is really funny.
Where did you come to after walking further northward or maybe to the east along the Huangpu River?
Walking further northward or maybe to the east along Huangpu River, I came to the Qinhuangdao ferry. I walked out to the intersection of Dalian Road and Yangshupu Road.
Where did you go after taking Line 4 of the subway?
Line 4 is there and I went the rest of the way to Xueersi by subway. Northward of Qinhuangdao Ferry is Yangpu District.
What was the condition of the Riverside Promenade in Puxi when you first visited?
When I first went there it was under construction and very deserted.
When did you find it good to walk along the river after the road was finished?
But after a year, when I was in ninth grade, I found it good to walk after the road along the river was finished.
What types of people visit the Riverside Promenade in Puxi, and what do they typically do there?
Old people come here to see the history of the industry of Shanghai. Young people go there for fashion, as there are some clothing shops.
What types of amenities and activities can visitors find along the riverside promenade in Puxi?
There are lots of childrens playgrounds and slides, swings. Little children jumped all over laughing with their parents, who escort them there.
Why did you come to the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
I came here because I needed to take a rest from studying and I was just too bored.
What dining options are available along the Riverside Promenade in Puxi?
There are many places to eat like Burger King, Macdonald on the way. Walk another 6 kilometers and you come to Fuxing Island. The place is separated by a river.
What is the defining feature of the location mentioned in the answer?
That is why it is called an island. You can go there taking line 12.

messages.content: When did you visit Richmond?
So this Friday I went to visit Richmond.

There are homeless people everywhere and the roads are very dirty. There was nothing good about the place, and I dreaded that place instantly.
Where did you go after looking at the map?

It was a long walk, there were no people on the streets, and the street was very dirty. But after walking past a highway everything began to feel cleaner.
Where did you go after visiting Richmond?
Then I walked into the Marina Park. There are many geese in the park, and many boats in the harbor.

There are hundreds of geese, and their poops are everywhere on the road. I wonder how it feels to live in the toilet?

What happened to you later that day during your visit to Richmond or San Francisco?
I felt kind of dizzy later that day for no reason. This is a short post so I think thats it.
What is your overall impression of the city of Richmond, California?
In conclusion, Richmond is a dirty and ugly place, but the bay trails are definitely worth visiting.
Where are the best places for hiking around Richmond and North San Francisco?
I then realized that there are no parks around here, which is kind of sad, so the best place for hiking may be Bay Trails, which I went multiple times this year.
What did you do when you felt restless and found yourself not doing anything?
So today I was kind of restless and found myself not doing anything at all, so I went to visit North San Francisco.
How did you get to the shoreline from your previous location?
I went on the Bart and then got off at Embarcadero. So I walked to the shoreline.
What is the difference in crowdedness between San Francisco and Berkeley?
There are many tall buildings in San Francisco is much more crowded than Berkeley.
What did the buildings and roads in the area remind you of compared to the Huangpu River and Bay?

The buildings reminded me of the skyscrapers beside Huangpu River, but of course, Huangpu River is much smaller than the Bay, The roads are like really wide, and many people are selling different food, smelling good in the air.

Mostly I saw sausages and fruits, but I suppose they kind of lacked hygiene. I could see across the Bay to Treasure Island, and Golden Gate Bridge.

The streets are dirty, and there are many homeless people lying all around.
What did you observe along the shoreline during your visit to Richmond or North San Francisco?
There are many cruises and many large boats parked along the shoreline which I suppose is for a tour for the people.
How did the city you visited compare to Anchorage?
It kind of reminded me of Anchorage, but Anchorage is much cleaner much less crowded, and less windy.
What was the reason you wanted to visit Alaska again?
I already wanted to visit Alaska again, but it takes a lot of money. Then I walked along for a while, and on my left was a small hill.
What did you encounter as you continued walking in the area?
I kept walking and there was an entertainment park, filled with many small restaurants alongside.

What was the transition like as you walked from the shoreline into the city?
Walking from the shoreline the streets became very dirty and very small. There are tall buildings alongside and it was very hilly.
What happened when you were exploring San Francisco's Chinatown?
I walked around and kind of lost direction on Columbus Avenue, going one way and then going the other way. I walked into Chinatown, and it was very dirty.
What were the elderly people doing when you visited Richmond?
There is a group of like 30 elders sitting around and playing poker or something, which reminds me of those senior people back in China, and they look kind of alike.
How did the residents of this crowded city feel about living here?
I wonder how they felt living here, in this crowded city.
What did you think about the seniors wanting to return to their hometown?

Some people told me seniors wanted to go back to their hometown, like falling leaves returning to the root, and I thought that they might be lonely and nostalgic or something, but anyway, I didnt bother to think more.

Then I thought I probably would want to live in a less crowded place and quieter place when I got like 70 years old, but thats not my business now anyways.

There are a bunch of Chinese restaurants in Chinatown, but most are closed. Then there are some other services. But there are also many homeless people who look Asian. Then I walked to Market Street.

It was only my third time in San Francisco last time I was watching Mean Girls musical, and the time before my parents car broke down in Ocean Beach, and it felt quite queer since I have already been here like forever.
Where did you go to look for a clothing store while visiting Richmond or North San Francisco?
Anyway I went to look for a clothing store. Market Street is full of smells of smoke and drugs, I think.

Anyways, there are a bunch of homeless people there, but the shopping mall was good. Then I went on the Bart at Powell Street and went home.

San Francisco is crowded and a little dirty compared to Berkeley. It is also very hilly. Shanghai is much better since it is cleaner and there wasnt homeless people.
What are your thoughts on living in San Francisco compared to visiting?
But visiting seems interesting. San Francisco wouldnt be my top choice for living, though.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about security, titled 'Web Scraping, Security, and Ethical Considerations'.

messages.content: What is the purpose and legal considerations of the information provided in this blog post?
Reminder This blog post is for educational purposes only. All information provided should be used ethically and legally. Misuse of these techniques can result in serious legal consequences.
What ethical concerns should be considered when using technology for security-related tasks?
Being able to do something is not a justification to do so. Please dont do this. Technology is for ensuring your freedom, not for harming others.
What should web scraping tools be used for, and what are some potential issues to consider?
These tools should only be used for legal purposes. Neglecting copyright is a serious issue Video content can often be a target for scraping.
What are some examples of how video sites may obscure the source of the content they serve?
For example, some video sites use HTML tags like video srcblob Even though blob URLs obscure the source, they often load m3u8 or ts files.
What is the structure and purpose of an m3u8 file in the context of video streaming?
An m3u8 file usually consists of many segments of video files they are combined together. It is possible to do so using an HLS sniffer.
What can Selenium be used to do, and what should users be aware of when using certain tools?
Selenium can also be used to capture the performance logs and extract URLs. Please always comply to terms and dont use steamlink for unlawful purposes.
What should be considered when exploring the Dark Web?
Warning Be cautious about the Dark Web as it contains disturbing content. It is not advised to visit the Dark Web, nor use Tor for unethical purposes.
When should one use Tor crawling?
Only use tor crawling when anonymity is a priority and when you adhere to platforms rules. In Selenium, specifically Ethical Reminder This is illegal and unethical.
What is the recommended approach to ensure web security and protect against unauthorized access attempts?
Do not engage in bruteforcing. Instead, focus on strengthening your defenses. Always use secure passwords by utilizing KeePassoffline password manager to generate high entropy passwords.
What is a great way to stop attackers from gaining access if a weak website leaked the password with a weak hash?
Simple security practice makes you the harder target. It is a great way to stop attackers from gaining accessif a weak website leaked the password with a weak hash.
What security measures are recommended when designing a web server to protect against unauthorized access?
It is advised when designing a web server use a difficult captcha when users log in, and utilize Cloudflare for protection.
What security measures can individual developers use to protect against DDOS attacks and brute-force password attempts?

Cloudflares Captcha is excellent for individual developers to protext DDOS. Attackers might use multiple IPs to attempt bruteforcing passwords by sending numerous requests with selenium sendkeys, like buttondriver.findelement and button.click.
What types of websites are typically more vulnerable to targeted attacks?
Small websites with weak security are usually more targeted. Always safeguard cloud machines with public ipv4 as they are the targets of many random attacks.
What concerning security issue did you observe on your Linode machine?
On my Linode machine I could see people trying sshd passwords. Dont delete the root password or use a weak root password!
What are some security risks associated with downloading executable files, and how can users mitigate these risks?
Some malicious programs gain access espeically on Windows exes to the network! It is important to download from secure sourceslike official ArchLinux packages and inspecting the PKGBUILD.
What type of malicious activity can attackers use to participate in distributed denial-of-service (DDOS) attacks on a network?
Some malicious programs may gain access to the network to participate in DDOS. I tried this experiment with my Linode.
How can you gain remote access to a Linode machine?
I can gain remote access to my Linode machine by using ncat.
What steps did you take to gain access to your laptop by executing a bash script remotely?
On the Linode machine nohup ncat attackers IP port e binbash On my laptop listen, after this I gain access to execute bash script on my laptop.
What should be considered when accessing or scraping email content?
Only do this in a controlled environment and adheres to laws! Respect the privacy of emails.
How might attackers inundate a victim's inbox and avoid their emails being marked as spam?
Potential Threats Attackers might flood a victims email by subscribing to mailing listsdesigned not to go to spam, causing an inundated inbox.
What are some important considerations when scraping or crawling websites?
It is important to follow the rules and use official APIs when crawling the website. Not everything feasible is legal and justified.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about california, titled 'Visiting Ocean Beach'.

messages.content: What was the mood you were in during your visit to Ocean Beach today?
Today I visited Ocean Beach. I was in a very bad mood and distorted these days.
What did you find yourself frequently thinking about while you were unable to focus on your work?
I couldnt get any work done and think about living in remote settings like in Northern Europe or Alaska or New Zealand daily.
Where did you go for your dinner in the Mission district?
I hopped on a Bart and went to Mission district. It is very crowded there with homeless people everywhere. I looked around and bought a burrito for my dinner.
How did you get back to your starting point after walking around the area?
Then I walked around, and it was a steep hill up the road. I took the bus.
What happened when you tried to take a picture of the sunset on the bus?
I could see the sun setting and it was very beautiful, but when I took out my phone to take a picture the bus moved, and the buildings blocked the sun. I never saw the sun again.
What realization did you have about the passage of time during your exchange program at UC Berkeley?
Then I thought like how days pass, and they never go back, and suddenly this year is ending, and so is my exchange program in UC Berkeley.
What were you feeling and experiencing during the bus ride to Ocean Beach?
I felt very very empty inside, and felt my incapability to handle things these days. The bus took forever and went down and up a lot of hills.
Where did you sit and what were you doing while on the bus?
I sit in the most remote corner and played with my phone, watching lots of people getting up and down the bus.
What time did you arrive at Ocean Beach?
Then I arrived in Ocean Beach, and it was already dawn. I could mildly see the some golden clouds in the end of the horizon.
When was the last time you went to Ocean Beach, and who did you go with?
Last time I went here was in January, and I went here with my parents. But unfortunately the car broke down, and it was very very sad.
What happened that caused you to not go anywhere that day?
It was also raining hard that day, and we ended up going nowhere. Then I thought maybe I missed my parents now.
How did you feel about the passage of time since arriving at Ocean Beach?
Then I thought how fast time had passed since January, and I felt voided and eaten up by this.
What did you do after arriving at Ocean Beach?
So I went out and walked down the beach, and started walking down the beach trails. There were few people scattered along the beach trails.
What did you observe while walking along the beach trails?
There were also some dogs, running freely around. I started running, until I was out of breath, then I started running again.
What is one of the benefits of running along the beach trails at Ocean Beach?
The beach is such a good place for running, as fresh air filled my lungs all the time in the vast open.
What was the atmosphere like as you walked along the beach trails at night?
Then I kept walking, and the sky became dimmer. There was hardly any lights in the distance. I felt isolated from the world and it was very good feeling.
What was it like walking along the beach trails at Ocean Beach?
The city seemed remote, and after a while I saw no people. I seemed to be walking all alone surrounded by the sea.
How often have you seen the ocean since arriving in this area?
I havent seen the ocean much since coming here, instead, I think this is only the second time since January that I seen the ocean.
What did you see from the location you were visiting in Berkeley?
I could only see the Bay in Berkeley. I felt very melancholy.
How far did you walk along the beach trails before turning back?
I went about 1 mile when it really became dark, and I couldnt even see the beach clearly, so I turned back. I was even a little afraid.
What was the environment like when you explored the beach at night?
Night here is so different from daytime. There was no roads leading out of the beach so I had to climb the slippery sand.
What did you find when going around at night in the area?
I quickly found a place to climb out and walked to Upper Great Highway. Going around at night is always not interesting here.
Where did you go some days ago around 7 pm, and what was the experience like at night?
I went to Lafayette some days ago at around 7 pm and there wasnt anything to see at night. It is the same with West San Francisco.
What were your initial thoughts about the size and lighting of San Francisco compared to Shanghai at night?
I hadnt thought San Francisco would be this big and thought it would be well lit like Shanghai at night. I was wrong.
Where did you try to buy water as you felt thirsty and seemed to be going nowhere?
I seemed to be going nowhere, and I felt very thirsty, so I tried to bu some water. I walked past Sunset Boulevard.
What did you do after leaving Ocean Beach at night?
Then I bought some water and juice, and took the Lyft back home.
How long does it typically take to travel from Berkeley to San Francisco's Ocean Beach?
San Francisco beach is very beautiful, but it isnt very accessible from Berkeley, as it took me 2 hours to go there.
What would be a better location for the beach compared to the current one?
If the beach is behind the school like UCSD, that would be much better.
What were you feeling during your time at Ocean Beach?
I felt very much empty inside these days, and felt no interest other than tinkering around with Gnome.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about middle-school, titled 'December of 2019'.

messages.content: What was the weather like in December of 2019, and what other events took place during that time?
December of 2019 There was no snow that winter. With December came the highschool entering test and math competitions.
Why did you decide to go to an International school?
I decided to go to an International school since my parents want me to go to an American university and learn more.
What was the name of the middle school you applied to in December of 2019?
I applied to Shanghai World Foreign Language Middle School. The test was arranged as follows This is the schedule of the test.
How did the math test go for you in December of 2019?
The math test was very easy and in the end, there were only 2 problems I didnt work out.
How did the English test and your composition writing go on that busy day in December?
The English test was hard and I didnt write the composition well. In the evening, I felt tired and went out for a walk.
What school did you take an application test for in December?
In 12.1 I came to Shanghai Pinghe Bilingual School to take their application test. They only have math and English tests.
How did the tests go for you in December?
The math test is very easy and I soon worked out all the problems and checked it again. The English test was very strange.
What was your experience with the entrance tests you participated in?
Of all the entrance tests Ive participated in, I never saw a test like that.
What was the breakdown of points for the cloze test you took during the busy December test period?
The cloze has a total worth of 16 points, while its total is only 28 points. I spent my time wisely and did the test.
What did you do after taking two tests in December of 2019?
After two tests I went for a walk along a small river, it was really relaxing.
Why were you asked to enter the second part of the school entrance exam?
Because of me doing well in the tests, I was asked to enter the second part of the entrance exam. The second part was to be interviewed by two teachers.
What activities did you participate in during your school's December events?
On 12.11 I went to WFLS. They asked me to introduce myself in Chinese and English and ask questions to the others.
What was the time and setting when the teacher asked the students to introduce themselves?
