It was 300 in the afternoon and I was sitting in a room with 3 girls and 2 boysincluding me. The teacher Stand up and introduce yourself.
What happened when the group was prompted to introduce themselves?
If youre ready, please raise your hand. One by one, the others stood up and introduced themselves.
What were the characteristics of the students who raised their hands during the activity?
A boy is good at walking long distances, a girl good at singing, English, and always helping community. I was the fourth to raise my hand.
What did you tell the interviewers about your skills and abilities during the school entrance tests?
I described my math skills and English ability. I also said I can run really fast and can run 1km in 327. They seemed impressed.
What did the others say about themselves during that time period?
The others never said about their math skills. They only said about their TOELF points and social activities. Then I went home feeling anxious and excited.
What year and month did you participate in a math competition held by Shanghai math school?
In 12,14 I went to join a math competition held by Shanghai math school.
How did you feel about the school entrance tests you had to take in December of 2019?
It was easy and I had done so many similar tests at school in fact, one day doing at least two of them.
What were your results in the test and what did you do in the afternoon?
I did well in that test and got second prizeI was first in second prize. In the afternoon I went to Pinghe school.
Where is Pinghe located?
Pinghe is located in Green City in Pudong district. What beautiful places! The street is lined with trees on both sides and you can see foreigners and big houses everywhere.
What did you find to be a refreshing escape from the intense academic environment at school?
It is one of the most beautiful places in Shanghai and an international community, Such an escape from the pressured, competing environment at school!
What did you do while waiting to be called for an event at your school?
I went inside the school, and, since I was to be called an hour later, I sat down in their cafeteria and read Ordinary World.
What did you tell the foreign teacher during the school interview?
Then I was called, I went inside and to be interviewed by a foreign teacher. I said I liked math, and number theory best.
What did he ask you about the nature of number theory?
He asked me if I would like to explain whether number theory is invented or is being discovered.
What did you say about how numbers and theories were invented and then discovered?
I said man invent numbers and then the theories and hidden there for them to discover.
What was your experience during the school interviews you had in December 2019?
I was then called up to the third floor and was interviewed by two female teachers. Looking back, I was really dissatisfied.
What did the teacher ask you for at the start of the busy December?
Firstly the teacher asked me for my basic information. important than huge amounts of time spent. I think sufficient sleep brings me more energy to focus in the daytime. him.
What did you do if you were not successful in your endeavors during that busy time in December 2019?
If not successful I will call my parents and teachers and listen to their advice. strange! My brain froze at that time and I didnt know how to explain myself.
What was the amateur math school like, compared to a regular middle school like Shibei?
Amateur math school isnt a school like Shibei middle school. No. The teachers didnt seem impressed at all.
What did you want to say to her about your math abilities?
I wanted to say, you dont know my ability in math, and she was like thinking Im not so good.
What was the outcome of the math competition that involved participants from Shanghai?
But those three hundred participants are among the best in Shanghai and I got second prize. Pinghe school hasnt got one on the list.
What did you feel confident you could achieve in mathematics at your school?
I feel confident I can be number one in mathematics in your school. It was a drawing of two robbers stealing artwork from a gallery.
What did you initially think your parents were preparing for when they were making unusual arrangements?
Except at that time, I didnt really understand. I thought they were preparing for a gallery or something.
What note did the author make about their ability to understand visual materials at first glance?
Note of author rereading this material at 2023 I am very bad at understanding visual stuff at first glance.
What metaphor did you use to describe your thought process during the busy school activities in December?
My brain is like a neural network that needs a lot of training to think out of the box.
What did the thieves do instead of stealing the artworks in the painting?

I usually intepret everything my own way, either I am born with it or doing repetitive difficult math tests in middle school made me do that It showed two thieves, instead of stealing the artworks, took the label away.
What did the drawing in your school interview attempt to convey, and how did you feel you performed in the interview?
This drawing was supposed to tell us we need material objects more than things from the surface. I failed this interview.
What were the three reasons you failed to gain admission to WFLS?
However, WFLS admitted me There are three reasons for my failure. 1. The teacher wasnt satisfied for my styles. 2. I am really not good at explaining things. 3.
What is your ability to interpret the meaning of images?
I am not good at identifying what pictures are going to tell.
What was your reaction to not getting into your preferred school, Garden City?
Actually Garden City is always my favorite place so failing it was kind of sad for me, even though it didnt matter since I wasnt going to that school anyways.
What was happening in December after the two tests were completed?
After these two tests, December was drawing to an end.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about web-dev, titled 'MERN Stack Conclusion'.

messages.content: What is the recommended approach to build a full-stack web application using the MERN stack?
Create a web application with frontend and backend and using libraries and functions to connect between them.
What technologies and tools do you typically use when developing a web application using the MERN stack?

Frontend Html, CSS, Javascript, Jquery, React, UI Github Page Backend Axios, Express, MongodbMongoose, Linux It is easy to create a webpage with github pagesgoogle sitewix, but github page is static and I dont like Wix.
Why is the MERN stack a popular choice for web development?
Because many online tutorials use mern stack and it is mainly based on Javascript.
How would you describe the process of creating a web page design using HTML and CSS?
It is kind of like writing in Microsoft Word with Html and CSS, anyways, just add bunch of tags and styles and you can get a good web page design.
What is your perspective on designing websites as a minimalist?
As a minimalist, I am not a big fan of designing anyways.
What is the relationship between HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in web development?
Html and CSS for javascript is kind of like EasyX in C Language or Tkinter in Python, which you can use to create better applications. Javascript makes the webpage alive.
What are some examples of dynamic functionality that can be added to a web page using JavaScript?

For example, you can change classes with Javascript with Or add a function after button clicking by specifying button onclicksomefunction Also you can add event listenerclicking or keyboard or hand movement, alerts, set interval for functions, for example like this page You can also add forms and input, and dynamically change the input.
What are some of the capabilities of JavaScript in relation to web development?
Also Javascript can modify cookies, and adjust site settings according to the cookies. React is Javascript Library.
What is the key benefit of using components in React development?

By using the components, and you can define a kind of component and use it again and again, like customized Button Start React by typing npx createmyapp appname then naviagate to index.js and change it.
How do you start the development server for your MERN stack website, and what changes did you make to the default project structure?
By running npm start, you can see the website on localhost3000 Also, I didnt use the app.js file, and I deleted all the logos and not useful stuffs.
What is the recommended approach for creating the HTML elements in a MERN stack project?
First code the elements you want on a separate js file, and they should return HTML files. For example, , then render it on a path.
What is the difference between BrowseRouter and HashRouter in the context of website routing?
Maybe you want to render aboutme on aboutme Use BrowseRouter or HashRouter not much difference between the two for me except HashRouter has on the URL, to construct all path of the website.
What are some examples of how to implement dynamic pages and components in a MERN stack web application?

For example, if there is 3 subpages on a websiteaboutme, contact, blog, then code like You can also build pages like a blog, where the page may change and be added, build it like Then basically add the array with in the middle of routes Build a personal component by adding props in the function, for example, building a button function then export then Button. This reduce many lines of duplicate code.
What can you do to add a personalized button with a title and text to your web application?
You can then add the personalized button with title and text Button text title Of course coding everything is too much, and there are lots of UI libraries, like ReactBootstrap.
How can you use the components provided in the library?
Install the library from npm, then you can use the components by changing it a little bit.
What is an example of a component in ReactBootstrap that can be used in a web application?
For example, a navbar in ReactBootstrap Then return the navbar and export to index js. There are also many other components in ReactBootstrap like Button or Breadcrumbs.
What are the main reasons you use the libraries in your web development projects?
The main reason I use the libraries are I dont want to code css. Use axios to communicate with the backend.
What is an example of a sample code for a GET request when the request is in JSON format?
For example This is a sample code of get request. Also, since the request is JSON, it is useful to JSON.stringify the request, or refer to it by index.
What is your primary goal when interacting with the server?
I am only interested in getting the data from the server.
What is the best practice for handling errors in a GET request in a MERN stack application?
There may be lots of error in the get request, so it is best to add .catcherrorconsole.logerror A Post request looks like This is used to make a post request, which will later put data into database.
What can you use to communicate with the other port on localhost after launching the backend?
So after launching the backend you can use the axios to communicate with the other port on localhost.
What are the benefits of using constructed tags compared to building them from scratch in web development?
As you can see, it is much easier with the constructed tags than to build one on my own, and also you can change by specifying style css, then exporting it.
What steps would you recommend to set up the basic structure of a web application using the MERN stack?

Basically create a header, a footer, render the pages with header and footer separatelyso you can see it on every page, then on every page either it is static html, or you can perform get requests on other websitesbackend localhost and add it on the page.
What is the role of the backend in a social media application?
Why need the backend? Because like in a social media page there is constantly changing data.
What is your opinion on whether a backend is necessary for a personal homepage?
I personlly dont think you need a backend for a personal homepage, but anyways, I just want to see how it works.
What steps did you take to connect your application to a MongoDB database?
I used Mongodb in the application, and by signing up on mongodb and clicking connect, and it will create default database add a uri in the code and connect it by replacing the username and password.
What is the purpose of the Mongoose library in a MERN stack application?
Mongoose is the javascript library to interact with Mongodb server from the code. The first thing is to define schemas.
What is an example of the steps to set up a model in a MERN stack application?
For example defines a user, then make a mongoose Model, and then you can export the file to the main node file.
What is the purpose of using Express in the MERN stack application?
Use express to interact between visiting the webpage and the database.
What are some of the key steps involved in setting up a MERN stack application?

defines a post method, then we create a new schema and add to the server In Get requests we can use find or sort methods You can store the data as JSON and send to the database, and also view and change the database by logging in mongodb and browse collections.
What technologies did you use to interact with the backend, connect it to the database, and make the site live?
Use axios to interact with the backend and mongoose to connect the backend with the database, and then the site is live.
How can you test the code and debug your MERN stack application?
Download a post API to test the code to debug. By sending a get request or post request to the url, then checking the database.
What is the benefit of adding CORS to a web application with a frontend and backend on different ports in the localhost?
After adding cors to the code you can easily create a web application with frontend and backend on different ports in the localhost.
How can you access the website on the network?
At this point you should be able to access the website on the network by typing in the computer ip address and the ports.
What are the advantages of deploying a web application on a cloud server rather than running it solely on a local computer?

For example, if it is hosted on localhost3000, then go to 3000 to see the website However, you cant run everything on your own computer because it depends on Internet connection and your computer may shut off, so by buying a Linux on the cloud and runnning the server on the cloud server, you can then deploy the web application.
What was the most time-consuming part of building the MERN stack project?
This seems easy, but it is the most timeconsuming thing of all, and took me many hours in sleepless nights to finish.
What are the general steps to deploy a MERN stack application to a server?
Buy a server in Linodeor AWS or whatever, then ssh into the server with shell, then install the node and npm, then git clone the repository, then run it.
What issues did you encounter when trying to run Node.js on the cloud server, and what motivated your preference for a GUI over the command line?

There are several problems 1 The sudo default installed node is v12, which is really old, and some applications require more than v12 2 There may be bugs in the environment, and debugging is hard with command line Basically, I just couldnt run the nodejs in the cloud server, and as a noob I want to have a GUI in the cloud server, which makes it look better than the command line.
What challenges did you face when trying to install the desktop environment on your Linux system?
But GUI is very hard to install, and although in my own computer I installed lightdm and ubuntudesktop easily. When I tried to install xfce, there are some driver problems.
What issues did you encounter when trying to connect to the VNC server, and how did you resolve the connection problem?
Then I tried tigervncstandaloneserver, and tried connecting using Remmina and VNC viewer, and it always refuse to connect. But when connecting with ssh L 5901127.0.0.15901 userexample.com it works.
What issue did you encounter when trying to deploy your MERN stack application, and how did you resolve it?
Then I finally managed to add a vnc hostname and connect to the server with VNC viewer by adding another Linode, and then there was no browser.
What issues did you encounter when trying to install different web browsers on your system, and how did you resolve them?

Then I installed firefox with snap but keyboard doesnt work in firefox I dont know why, then I tried to install googlechrome but it wouldnt openbecause I need to change the xhost display settings with root and then open it as user, then I installed Palemoon and it worked fine.
What happened when you tried to install different versions of Node.js on your system?
I tried to install node v18 and it failed, and then I installed node v20 and it succeeded.
Why did the website not connect when using the Chrome VPN extension to access the China firewall, even though it worked fine when connecting to other countries?

Then I deployed the code to the server but it wouldnt connect when I used the chrome vpn extension to connect to Chinafirewall, although it works fine when connecting to other countries like Russia and Netherlands.
What are some of the key things one needs to learn when developing a web application?
There are many things to learn in Web Application, but most of them are very simple.
What is the main reason you spend many days debugging your MERN stack projects?
I spend many days debugging because of lack of experience and hope to code better in the future.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about cloud, titled 'Self Hosting Options'.

messages.content: What has recently sparked your interest in self-hosting various websites and online platforms?
Recently, the idea of selfhosting fascinates me. This is because I find I can selfhost pretty much all websites easily, including forums, video platforms, blogs.
What is the main factor to consider when self-hosting small cloud instances?
The only thing is the cost, which, actually isnt that much if hosting small instances.
How much does it cost to purchase 1 TB of object storage on Cloudflare R2 in a single month?
For example, purchasing 1 TB of object storage is only 15 dollars one month on Cloudflare R2.
What are the cloud storage pricing options for 1 TB of object storage between Akamai Linode and AWS S3?
Akamai Linode offers this at 20 dollars a month for 1 TB object storage. AWS offers similar pricing around 10 dollars to 20 dollars it has so many S3 models.
What are some of the pricing options and considerations for cloud storage services compared to self-hosting?
Notably, Dropbox even has a cheaper price of 9.99 a month for 2 TB. There are also cheaper object storages out there, except their performance and stability are not known.
What are some of the drawbacks or issues you've experienced with using Dropbox as a cloud storage solution?

But Dropbox is proprietary, and I have no idea whats going on, and Dropbox points my files to other files in the cloud with the same Hash values, and Dropbox GUI can sometimes be unresponsive, which is annoying.
Which cloud storage service performs better and fully utilizes network speed compared to other options?
Actually, performance speaking from my experience, Dropbox performs much better and is fully utilizing the network speed.
What is your experience with using tools like rclone and s3fs for cloud storage providers like Akamai, Linode, or AWS?
However, using various tools like rclone and s3fs for like Akamai Linode or AWS is slower. Actually, I think it is because I am not fully utilizing these tools, though.
What was your experience with the Windows operating system when you were a child?
When I was a child, I didnt really know and think about such things, with evil Windows OS making everything foreign and mysterious for me.
What made you succumb to the websites you didn't know much about?
I didnt know what was going on in those websites, and that made me succumb to them.
What should one learn to avoid overrelying on others?
But overrelying is not a good practice, and I shall learn to be independent and strong.
What do you dislike about the services provided by some major tech companies?
That is what I dislike about Chinese tech companies, and also some Google and Microsoft services.
What concerns do you have about the services and features offered by cloud providers?
They do create awesome available services, only for the individual to be used at the cost of losing ones own mind and freedom in the digital Internet.
What is the main challenge with self-hosting a website?
But selfhosting has a main challenge, which is probably people wont notice the website.
Why do people seem so attached to popular social media platforms like Twitter, Instagram, and Bilibili and WeChat in China?
I dont know why, but people seem awfully glued to popular platforms like Twitter, Instagram, and Bilibili and WeChat in China.
What is your opinion on the use of manipulative, proprietary, and buggy applications in cloud-based solutions?
The sort of overreliance on manipulating, proprietary, and buggy apps makes me feel uncomfortable.
What drives the urge to self-host an application, even if it means the app may be ignored before it's dead?
It is this discomfort that drives the urge to go selfhost, yet it is also this situation that an awesome app will probably be ignored before its dead.
Why do you think your website has so few unique visitors and comments so far?
My website has few unique visitors and few comments so far. I dont know why people are so reluctant to leave comments anonymously, though. Perhaps its because the total visitor is too small.
Why do people, especially Chinese people, tend to stick to one thing they are familiar with throughout their lives?
It runs in the human mindthat they want to stick to one thing, the thing they are familiar with, all their lives, especially Chinese people.
Why do many people choose inconvenient and subpar platforms while constantly complaining about them instead of switching to better alternatives?
Many people choose inconvenient and trash platforms themselves, while complaining about it constantly without the urge to switch.
What is your opinion on the large number of people engaging in this particular activity?
The number of people doing this is too large, in fact, I find this behavior quite hard to comprehend.
What is the analogy used to describe the common behavior of complaining about a cheap but functional setup while being unwilling to invest in a better solution?
It is like having luxurious goods, and a lowend bed, and always complaining how bad the bed is while not willing to change.
What are some alternatives to self-hosting that allow anyone to easily set up a platform these days?
There are better platforms out there, and anyone nowadays can host one by buying cheap cloud storage.
How much would it cost to host a small forum for discussion on a cloud platform?
I think like Linode Nanode 5 dollars a month is pretty much enough to host a small forum for discussion or something related.
What is your experience with hosting a forum like Discourse, as a beginner in computer science?

Dont say how much expertise it takes because, as a bottom student in the department of computer science, I am picking it up from raw only after less than half a year. Hosting a forum like Discourse shouldnt be that hard.
What is the key advantage of self-hosting options compared to proprietary and fixed platforms?
The main thing here is customization, and by customizing everything to suit my own needs, it is definitely better than the proprietary and fixed, not flexible platforms.
What are some examples of Invidious instances, and how do they work in relation to YouTube videos?
There are loads of instances out there, and the one I use most frequently is yewtu.be. Invidious doesnt store videos on its own servers it traffics the YouTube videos.
What is a quick way to set up a forum using a mature hosting service like Discourse?
Simply using the MERN stack to write a forum wont take that long, at most in 1 week. There are also mature hosting services like Discourse forums.
What are the pros and cons of writing your own self-hosting solution versus using prebuilt apps?
Anyways, they have their pros and cons. Writing one myself is better tailored to my preferences, while using the prebuilt apps is easier and saves less hassle.
What alternative to Twitter has emerged recently that is similar to it?
Also, there is Mastodon, which is like a Twitter alternative. Nitter stopped functioning, so that probably died. But there are lots of other small forums good for a niche community.
How many video hosting platforms are currently available online, including those for adult content?
There are lots of video hosting platforms out there, thousands of millions, judging by the large amounts of adult websites.
What are some mature hosting platforms for self-hosting video content that require users to log in by default?
Using Peertube or MediaCMS or YouPHPTube are some mature hosting platforms, but they require login to post videos by default.
What are the main considerations you would have when hosting your own web application using the MERN stack and object storage?
Anyways, raw coding is quite easy with the MERN stack and object storage. Mainly when hosting, I would want to maintain the confidentiality and integrity of the users data.
What are the steps to configure CloudFront from an S3 bucket, including adding the S3 domain and default page?

But if it is like a public platform, this isnt really that important since anyone can access the information url lobe.jimchen.melobe.jimchen.me url chat.jimchen.me url public.jimchen.me Configure Cloudfront from S3 bucket and add S3 domain and default page.
What self-hosting options and their respective URLs are you referring to?

url vault.jimchen.me url status.jimchen.me url immich.jimchen.me url portainer.jimchen.me url grafana.jimchen.me url prometheus.jimchen.me url stash.jimchen.me url rclone.jimchen.me url tube.jimchen.me

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about shanghai, titled 'Riverside Promenade in Pudong'.

messages.content: What was your typical mode of transportation when you didn't want to walk 4 kilometers to the Garden Bridge?
When I didnt want to 4 kilometers to Garden Bridge, I usually went on line 8 to the China Art Museum. It is seven stops from my previous home.
What part of the riverside promenade route did you walk along and how would you describe that section?
I walked along the Pudong Part of the route. The Pudong part is more beautiful and better constructed. There are airconditioned little houses facing the river to rest every kilometer.
Where is Lupu Bridge located in relation to the China Art Museum?
Southward of China Art Museum is Lupu Bridge. Many parks are connected together. On sunny days many children with their parents go have a picnic there.
What did you observe about the number of people on the Riverside Promenade in Pudong during different times of day?
I didnt find any teenager like me, though. On rainy days or at night there ate fewer people. I walked along, only occasionally seeing cyclers or joggers passing me.
What is Qiantan park like?
Qiantan park is good, there are little ponds and many tall trees.
What is the experience of looking out from the Riverside Promenade in Pudong at night?
I can always see far on my way left, and during the night it feels like looking into the world at a distance.
What emotional state did you experience as you continued your journey along the riverside promenade in Pudong?
I felt as if I am separated and alone. Continue going to the south and I came across the Chuanyang River.
What geographic feature did you encounter that indicated you had reached Sanlin?
The small river is straight and runs straight to the sea. Then I knew I came to Sanlin.
Where can I take line 8 to get back home from?
Go across the bridge, and there is Oriental Sports Center, where I could take line 8 back home.
What is the atmosphere like at Qiantan at night?
It is far lonelier at Qiantan, where there isnt a person in sight. When I went there at night, the whole world was quiet and peaceful.
Where did you go by yourself and how far was the Xupu Bridge from the Oriental Sports Center?
I went there by myself and kept looking at Puxi to see how much distance I had covered. Xupu Bridge is 5 kilometers from Oriental Sports Center. After that is Manlizui green space.
What is the advice regarding stopping at Xupu Bridge in the Pudong area of Shanghai?
Dont try to stop at Xupu Bridge without calling a taxi beforehand, or you get to walk a long way before finding the subway station.
What is the situation with the road in the area?
Problem is, the road is under the highway and many trucks, motorcycles roam past.
What was the condition of the pavement that required you to walk in the middle of the road during your visit?
Some parts of the pavement were under construction so when I was there I needed to walk in the middle of the road. Sometimes there are people arguing there.
What was your experience like at the Xupu Bridge area?
The place is really barren and I had a bad time there. It is even better turning back than walking out at Xupu Bridge.
What adventure did you have when you traveled to Xidu station to see the Huangpu River two years ago?
One summer day two years ago I was eager for an adventure, and I got on line 5 and traveled to Xidu station to see Huangpu River there. That experience wasnt pleasant.
What did you see along the Huangpu River instead of the expected riverside promenade?
What I saw, instead of Huangpu River, are many factories and villages on both sides of the river and there are no paths along the river to walk comfortably.
What can visitors see between Nanpu Bridge and Qichangzhan Ferry on the Pudong side?
On the Pudong side, there is a lot to see between Nanpu Bridge and Qichangzhan Ferry.
What is the path taken by the river around the Lujiazui Area in Pudong, Shanghai?
The river travels around the Lujiazui Area, and you may find yourself circling around the tallest towers in Pudong if you walk Northward from Nanpu Bridge.
What is the distinctive architectural feature of the structure near Nanpu Bridge on the Pudong side?
The place is shaped like a mouth. There is a tower near Nanpu Bridge on the Puxi side that shows you the temperature.
What could you see on your balcony in your previous home that was about 8 kilometers away from your home?
It is tall and I could even see it on my balcony in my previous home. It is about 8 kilometers from my previous home to the temperature building.
What are some of the notable features along the Riverside Promenade in Pudong, Shanghai?
There are many tall buildings on the way, including Citigroup and Shangrila Hotel. There are sculptures of different kinds of animals.
What other sculpture can be found along the Riverside Promenade in Pudong?
There is also another sculpture showing many little men walking on a plank and trying to balance themselves. On the left side, there are boating clubs.
What are some of the key features along the Pudong route of the Shanghai Riverside Promenade?
There are many expensive restaurants along the way. The Pudong side of the route ends at Yangpu Bridge. Walking in the daytime is really fine.
What can one do to enjoy the scenery more closely along the Riverside Promenade in Pudong?
You can see the beautiful scenery more closely. It is always joyous to walk in the sunshine.
What are some advantages of walking along the Riverside Promenade in Pudong at night compared to during the day?
It is also safer for you wont get lost or trip over something too dark to see. But night has its own charms.
What is the quote about the effect of nighttime on the senses, as mentioned in an opera?
Andrew Webber said, nighttime sharpens, heightens each sensation. Though this is a song in an opera, it is proved.
What is the experience of walking along the river at night in this area?
When you walk along the river at night, everything is more still.
What makes observing the surroundings more challenging during the daytime?
In the daytime there are many things to observe, there are just too much light and sound, filling your ears and eyes.
What is the nighttime atmosphere like along the riverside promenade in Pudong?
In the night there are no more lights than distant street lamps, no more sound to hear, and ones ears gave way to a lot of different, interesting sounds.
What else is there to discover along the river in this area?
There is much more to be discovered along the river. I used to have a hard time walking around Zhongxing Road.
What was it like being out in the Riverside Promenade area of Pudong at night?
It was so hard to be alone, there are people everywhere. The street is full of motorcycles even at 10 or 11 pm.
Where do you live and what is it like in the area at night?
Now I live in Zhangjiang High Technology park, and I always walk to the suburban if I go wandering around. It was deserted even at 9 pm.
What is the transportation and business situation like in the area you are currently in?
There are few buses and taxis, and stores are shut down. It is so hard to get back.
Why would it be difficult to walk freely at night in this area?
I couldnt walk to wherever I want because there are chances I couldnt get back quickly. There are few lights and people in the streets at night.
What is one of your favorite hobbies that you enjoy doing for fun?
I like always like wandering around just for fun. It is one of my hobbies now.
What is the difference between pursuing an activity for fun and making it your occupation?
Sometimes I want to be like Strider, but there is a big difference between what you want to do for fun and your occupation.
What are the potential risks and downsides of walking along the riverside promenade in Pudong at night?
And anyway, walking in those deserted, dangerous place on a dark night is not pleasant and there are always chances for one to get injured anywhere along the way.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about literature, titled 'The Fellowship of the Ring Book Review'.

messages.content: What is the title and genre of the book series written by J.R.R. Tolkien that features magic and fantasy elements?
Lord of the Rings LOTR is a magic fantasy series written by J R R Tolkien.
How many books are in the Lord of the Rings series?
There are four books in this series, The Hobbit, The Fellowship of the Ring, The Two Towers, The Return of the King.
What was Sauron's main motivation for seeking to reclaim the ring he had lost?
The Dark Lord Sauron wanted to reclaim his lost power through the ring that he lost before.
Who started on a quest to destroy the ring of Sauron?
Frodo Baggins, a hobbit living in the Shire, started on his quest to destroy the ring of Sauron.
When was J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings published?
Compared with other famous magic fantasies, LOTR was written very early and was enjoyed by readers for many decades. It was published in the 1950s.
When were some of the most popular fantasy and science fiction book series written?
The Chronicles of Narnia was written about the same time. Most popular fantasy or science fiction series, such as Harry Potter or Twilight, were written in the past 30 years.
What made J.R.R. Tolkien's fantasy novel a classic work of literature?
This made Tolkiens fantasy a classic. The book is also better constructed and detailed. Where the story happens LOTR is set in middleearth and concerns no modern world of man.
What are some key differences between the settings and themes of classic fantasy literature and more modern fantasy book series?
Books that were written later concerned more of the modern world. Harry Potter and Twilight series are set in Britain and America.
What is the key difference between the Narnia series and the Lord of the Rings series in terms of the fictional worlds they depict?
This means they include the present human beings along with their magical world. Narnia series include a parallel world that has many entrances like a wardrobe.
What are the five main types of people or creatures that play an important role in The Lord of the Rings?
There are five kinds of people in LOTR that play an important role. Those people are symbolized by the members in the fellowship wizard, hobbit, elf, dwarf man.
What types of antagonists or villains are featured in the book, and how are they described?
The villains are orcs, trolls, or hidden creatures. The book gives readers a clear and deep description of the five armies. Their minds and spirits are shown throughout the book.
What is the main focus of the Harry Potter series?
Harry Potter is mainly about wizards and muggles, and though they are magical creatures, little is known about each of them and how they live.
What are the different kinds of people or creatures featured in the book The Fellowship of the Ring?
Twilight is about humans and vampires. The five kinds of creatures in LOTR all have characteristics of their own. The dwarves are stout, united, but arrogant.
What song from the movie The Fellowship of the Ring is the answer referring to?
The song I see fire in the movie is all about them. One line goes If this is to end in fore, then we should all burn together.
What do the dwarves in The Fellowship of the Ring call themselves and what are they proud of?
They call themselves Durins sons. They are very proud of their ancestors and the gold that they once possessed. Men are the strongest of all.
Who defeated Sauron and what is the relationship between Aragorn, Isildur, and Boromir?
Sauron was defeated by Isildur and armies of men. In the fellowship, Aragorn king and heir of Isildur and Boromir are the toughest.
What are some of the key differences between the nature and behaviors of men and elves in The Lord of the Rings?
But men constantly desire power and can not control themselves in many situations. Elves are wise, quick, and fair. They are described as casting a white light as they go.
What are the places like where the people or creatures in this work dwell?
Their places are beautiful, often making others forget the time and sorrows of the outer world as they dwell there.
What are the characteristics of the people in The Fellowship of the Ring?
Their people are wise and always thought about what is needed for the fellowship.
What are the key characteristics of hobbits as described in the book The Fellowship of the Ring?
Hobbits are probably the weakest of all, they like to live a merry life in their comfortable house, and most had not heard about the outer world in the Shire.
What does Gandalf the wizard say about Saruman's beliefs regarding the use of great power to hold evil in check?
Their lives are but little difference over the years. Yet Gandalf the wizard said Saruman believes it is only great power that can hold evil in check.
What do the hobbits demonstrate to be the most powerful in keeping the darkness at bay?
But I found it is the small everyday deeds of ordinary folk that keep the darkness at bay. Hobbits prove to have the strongest wills.
What did Aragorn say about the people or creatures that Bilbo Baggins gave the ring to?
Aragorn described them as made of sterner stuff. Bilbo Baggins gave out the ring he possessed for many years.
What happened to Frodo when he was injured while fighting the Black Riders?
Frodo wasnt dead when he was injured in a fight with the black riders. Evil things cant live among the hobbits.
What are the key characteristics and challenges of the different types of powerful beings in Middle-earth?
Wizards are the most powerful, but they have their own problems. Gandalf the grey knows many languages and histories of middle earth. Saruman the white surrendered to Sauron without fighting.
What do the different people or creatures in The Lord of the Rings represent in terms of power and its effects?
They are wise but are always seeking profits. LOTR is about power and its disastrous effect. The ring of Sauron symbolizes this power.
What is the effect of power on the characters in J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Fellowship of the Ring"?
Power made Sauron a dark lord, and power drove Boromir out of his mind when he longed for the ring. Seeking power, Isildur came to his death.
How is Sauron's character portrayed in the Lord of the Rings book compared to the ring's influence?
Sauron wasnt so evil without the ring. Power is described as dangerous in the book.
Why did Gandalf insist that Frodo take the ring to Mordor?
Gandalf insisted on Frodo taking the ring to Mordor, for it is with Frodo that the ring cant work out its evil effects.
Why was Galadriel, the elven queen, afraid to possess the ring in Lothlorien?
Galadriel, the elven queen, resisted the ring in Lothlorien for she feared to be evil just like Sauron. Why must the ring be destroyed?
What does the book say about the consequences of using the Ring to defeat the Dark Lord?
The book says that even if one can use the ring to defeat the dark lord, he would become a new dark lord, only worse.
What did Boromir want to do with the Ring when he returned to Minas Tirith?
Boromir wanted to use the ring in his own will when he returns to Minas Tirith, but he couldnt even control his own mind.
What makes the use of the Ring of Sauron so dangerous for those with strong will and power?
The ring bearer must have a strong will and be really powerful to use the ring, but those with strong will and power prove to be even more dangerous with the ring.
What is the power that can allow one to live long without showing signs of age and rule the world?
Yet with power, one can live long without showing signs of age, and rule the world.
What did Bilbo claim about the ring's origin, even though he had actually stolen it?
But the ring is also a thing of deception, as Bilbo claimed it was a present from Gollum and instead of his stealing it.
What happened to the characters or factions that sought power in this work?
Almost all that was seeking power failed and got destroyed in the end. Note that the book is published shortly after World War II.
What does the book indicate about the actions of men in the story?
When the book talks about men leading themselves to destruction, it is an indication of what was happening. There isnt much use of magic in LOTR.
What are the main differences in the use of magic and fighting between the Harry Potter and Lord of the Rings series?
In Harry Potter, every fight is about wands and spells. In LOTR fighting still involves much use of weapons and strength.
What is the primary focus of the book "The Fellowship of the Ring" compared to the use of magic by wizards and elves?
Wizards and elves use magic but they use it few times. The book is more concerned with power. The movie by Peter Jackson is really magnificent.
What is your opinion on the movie adaptation of The Fellowship of the Ring compared to the book?
It is carefully, made and every scene just attracts you. But the movie is not consistent with the book in many parts.
What important character from the book was left out of the movie adaptation of The Fellowship of the Ring?
The movie left out Tom Bombadil, an important character in the book. Tom and Goldberry live in their own lands.
What is the role of Tom Bombadil in The Fellowship of the Ring, and how does his land differ from the rest of Middle-earth?
Tom sings songs to bar out the evil and his land is free from dark forces. The ring has no power over him.
Who provided shelter for Frodo and the hobbits on their way to Bree when they were pursued by the black riders?
Tom provided shelter for Frodo and the hobbits on their way to Bree when they were pursued by the black riders.
What other minor changes were made in the movie adaptation of The Fellowship of the Ring compared to the book?
There are also many other minor changes in the movie. It is not Arwen that saved Frodo when he was injured from the black riders attack.
Who came for Frodo and helped him escape on a horse alone?
The elf who came for them was a man called Glorfindel. Frodo rode on the horse alone and escaped himself.
Who summoned the flood on the river to Rivendell, and what were their roles?
The flood on the river to Rivendell was summoned by Elrond, the elven king, and Mithrandir Gandalf.
What happened during the Council of Elrond in the book, according to the passage?
Gimli didnt strike the ring with his ax during the council of Elrond, and the council is long and many other things are talked about rather than who should go to Mordor with the ring.
How was the fellowship of the ring formed according to the book?
The fellowship was later selected instead of volunteered during the council. Gandalf and Saruman didnt duel when Saruman was found to have betrayed.
What changes were made in the movie adaptation of The Lord of the Rings that made the story more dramatic and appealing, but also more confusing compared to the book?
These changes made the movie more dramatic and appealing but make it confusing to read the book. LOTR is a masterpiece, speaking of magic fantasy.
What are the few things you dislike about The Lord of the Rings?
But there are a few things I dont like about it.
What is revealed about the ending of the first book of The Lord of the Rings trilogy?
Everyone who reads the book or watches the movie knows Frodo and Sam will defeat Sauron eventually before book 1 ends. The ending is so easily revealed.
What are the main criticisms you have about the plot and characters in The Fellowship of the Ring?
There are many adventures on the way but the villains are always defeated, making them repetitive. The important characters never die. The book is too long.
How long is the book The Fellowship of the Ring?
It contains 560 thousand words and nearly 2000 pages. But that is a big problem for other fantasy series.
How do the word counts of the Harry Potter and A Game of Thrones book series compare?
Harry Potter contains over a million words and A Game of Thrones is almost twice that number.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about phone, titled 'The Unsuccessful and Frustrating Journey of Exploring PinePhone'.

messages.content: Why did you decide to try the PinePhone after being unable to unlock your previous Android phone?
So I want to try linux on my phone, and last week I couldnt unlock the android phone, so I bought a PinePhone since it is quite cheap.
What operating system and desktop environment does the PinePhone use, and what issue does the user experience with the display?
The phone boots into Manjaro OS, and uses KDE Plasma. 1. GUI Problem Sometimes the screen become too small verticallywithout adjustments, and I couldnt see all of the display.
What issue did you encounter with the gedit text editor on the PinePhone?
For example gedit couldnt save files since the save button is out of screen. 2.
How did you connect to the wifi on your PinePhone if the wifi settings had a poor GUI?
Wifi Problem Since the wifi in settings has a pretty bad GUI, I couldnt connect to wifi through settings, but had to connect to wifi through command line. 3.
What kind of issues did you experience with apps on the PinePhone?
App Problem Many apps would suddenly shut down when I am using them, even like gnome settings. 4.
What happened after you ran the "sudo pacman -Syu" command on your PinePhone?
Boot Problem After I run sudo pacman Syu the phone wont boot, complaining about rtu. I couldnt boot into recovery mode by holding volume and power. 5.
What issue did you encounter with the microSD card you plugged into your new phone on the second day of owning it?
Microsd Read Problem At the afternoon of the second day I bought the phone, it wouldnt read the microsd I plugged in, saying card error, so I couldnt boot anything into the phone.
What keyboard issue did you encounter while using the terminal on the PinePhone?
6. Keyboard Problem In terminal I need ctrl, which isnt in the keyboard normally.
What happened to the ctrl key when you were using the terminal on the PinePhone?
When I first entered the terminal the ctrl key was there but then if I press anywhere else the ctrl key disappears and I had to enter terminal again.
What problems did you encounter while trying to use your PinePhone, and how did they impact your experience?
Each of those problems cost me a long time, and I do not know how to solve themfor real.
What happened when you tried to insert the SIM card into the PinePhone?
So I tried putting my sim card inside PinePhone but it wouldnt go in, so I slide it inside, and it couldnt come out.
What happened when you went to the repair store to get help setting up your PinePhone?
So I went to the Repair store, hoping they would try to set up PinePhone for me, but they said they didnt support the type of phone.
What happened when you took your PinePhone to the repair store?
Fortunately they got my sim card out, so i was thankful.
What steps did you take to try to resolve the issue of your PinePhone not booting after running an update the previous night?

Since the phone wouldnt boot after I run update last night, this morning I went to Albany to buy a microsd, and then boot a jumpdrive into the microsd, then write the Arch Linux image with Phosh into the PinePhone.
What was your experience with booting Arch Linux on the PinePhone?
Everything was good and the phone booted into Arch. I used Ubuntu mostly and I am not entirely familiar with Arch.
What did you do when you were unable to connect to the wifi on your PinePhone?
I went to the command line and tried some, and fortunately it worked. However, I couldnt connect to the wifi.
What issues did you encounter when trying to use the gnome setting on your PinePhone?
I tried the gnome setting but the gnome setting would quit every few seconds for no reason. So I tried connecting to wifi from command line.
What was the issue you faced when trying to connect your PinePhone to the Eduroam internet network and discover your phone's hotspot?
I tried nmtui but it didnt support the Berkeley Eduroam Internet. Also the wifi couldnt discover my phones hotspot.
What did you try to do when you were unable to use gedit?
Then I tried nmcli I had to manually type those commands myself and they lead to many errors. I couldnt even use gedit.
What happened when you tried to connect the PinePhone to the school's internet?
Anyways, after that at school the Arch PinePhone would connect to school Internet.
What was the issue you encountered when trying to use OpenSSH on your PinePhone?
The openssh didnt work on the phone no matter how hard I tried, the computer just couldnt detect the phone.
What did you try to do to enable root login on your computer to detect the phone on the same network?
I changed the ssh config and allowed root login etcsshsshdconfig but my computer couldnt detect the phone while on the same network.
What error message did you encounter while trying to update your PinePhone and install other things?
Then I tried updating the phone and installing other things but it would always return errorGPGmE error no data I tried But it didnt work.
What would happen if you tried to connect through Ngrok to your computer again?
It would encounter same error all over again. I thought if I could connect through Ngrok to my computer everything will be easy.
What happened when you tried to download something using wget on the PinePhone?
However, there wasnt any wget, and when I tried to It says the source couldnt be validated, and it couldnt be downloaded.
What was the final outcome of your attempts to explore and use the PinePhone?
So in the end it is practically the same like without Internet since I couldnt do anything except curl html elements on a specific website.
What issues did you encounter with Firefox on the PinePhone?
Firefox didnt work because it said profile didnt find, and there was the nasty GUI problem where all buttons got out of screen.
What happened when you tried to boot Ubuntu Touch from the microSD card on your phone?
So I tried to boot Ubuntu Touch into the Microsd card, but the phone wouldnt read the microsd card when it boots, and after about 50 seconds it would switch back to Arch.
What happened when you tried to use the jumpdrive on your laptop running Linux?
At this point the jumpdrive didnt work too. Laptop Linux are so fun for me but I seemed to have a little problem with mobile Linux.
What did you accomplish today while trying to explore and set up the PinePhone?
I am very sad I achieved almost nothing today, and spent all my time over this crappy little device.
What was your plan to try and get Ubuntu Touch working on the PinePhone after encountering issues with the system?

I could practically do nothing on the system now, so maybe I will try to buy another microsd card and try booting from there, and hopefully Ubuntu Touch will work out, since I am much more familiar with Ubuntu.
Should I keep using iOS instead of exploring other mobile operating systems like PinePhone?
Then I thought whether should I keep use IOS. And that is a very interesting question.
What would be your preference between using Linux distros or iOS if the PinePhone functions much worse than either Android or iOS?
To be honest if Linux distros works out fully good for me I would not use IOS, but again the PinePhone is cheap and functions much worseas I heard than either Android or IOS.
What are some of the most expensive Linux-based smartphones currently available on the market?
The pricer Linux phones are Librem 5 which is like 1000 dollars, almost as expensive as a new highcomputation laptoplike the system76 I just bought.
Why did you find it hilarious to buy a phone at such a high price?
I thought it hilarious to buy a phone with such a price.
What are the key advantages of Linux-based phones compared to more expensive and less customizable alternatives?
Then again, Linux are meant to be cheaper and more functional and more customizable, instead of expensive and hard to use.
What issues did you face while trying to use the PinePhone and get it to function properly?
Moreoever, the PinePhone ran into a million bugs, which I couldnt fix even in one whole day, and that is before it even have basic functions.
How does the functionality of the PinePhone compare to iOS?
Even if the PinePhone is fully set up it would still be not even half as good as IOS speaking of funtionality.
Why do you wish you could have more customization options on your iOS device?
If only IOS allow more customization I wouldnt even think of this in the first place. First the app store.
Why do you prefer to install apps yourself on your phone rather than through the app store?
Even though it has enough apps I still want to install apps myself instead of through app store. Second the desktop.
What did you try to do to customize the desktop on the PinePhone?
I want to customize it to run like gnome or lxde but it wouldnt let me customize the desktop.
Why is iOS considered frustrating compared to other mobile operating systems?
Third and most importantly, there is no command line in IOS, which like you cannot know anything about the phone, which is very sad.
What does it feel like to use the PinePhone?
It feels like living in someone elses house and the phone doesnt seem to belong to me 100.
What is your opinion on the different mobile operating systems, particularly your views on iOS and Windows compared to your preference for Linux?
It is not that I hate IOS or something, unlike Windows, which I hate so much. I am just a obsessed Linux fanatic.
Why can't you change your own personality?
Its not like I can do anything about my personality, if I could then I probably wouldnt be the one I am right now.
Why did you feel it was sad that you would still use iOS?
So yeah I thought I would still use IOS, which is kind of sad.
What was your initial expectation for the PinePhone compared to how it actually turned out?
The PinePhone didnt come as I had expected to be, although I think I should adjust my expectation for such a cheap phone anyways.
How could someone use the PinePhone as a virtual machine, even if they don't primarily use it as their main phone?

Even if I dont use PinePhone primarily I could still use it for fun occasionally, like connect my computer terminal to it and run some programs on PinePhonefor example, computer virus, since I dont care about it anyways. It seems a good virtual machine.
What phone do you use when you don't have demanding tasks, such as just making calls and sending messages?
I can also use it on some occasions if there isnt demanding tasks, like only calling and messaging, at least it has more functions than my Philip Senior Citizen Phone.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about ustc, titled 'Another Horrible SemesterHow to Cope Next'.

messages.content: What was your experience at the end of the semester?
I had a very very bad end of the semester. This is a very very sad post. I am very guilty and in selfdoubt right now.
What happened at the end of the previous semester that caused you to have your worst mental breakdown?
So what happened at the end of last semester was I had a complete mental breakdown, the worst I ever had.
Why did you hate school so much that semester?
It was expected, given that the semester had already seen strong resistance and unwillingness to study or do any work. Like I just hated school, thats it.
What happened at the start of June that you got addicted to?
I will tell you about June. At the start of June, I got addicted to AWS, it was so cool and comprehensive and the best thing I ever had.
What did you become addicted to during the semester that prevented you from doing anything else?
I got addicted to AWS and I couldnt do anything else.
What was your daily routine during the end of the semester when you were deeply immersed in building applications on AWS with Next.js?

Every night I would play something on AWSwith NEXTJS, and then it would become dawn, and I would go to sleep after eating breakfast, then when I woke up soon it would be night again, and I hurried to do some limited work before diving right back into my laptop.
What was an important feeling that you lacked during the previous semester?
The feeling of building something was very important to me, and something I lacked last semester.
What was your experience with accomplishing things and having autonomy during your studies?
I didnt have the practical feeling of accomplishing things, on the contrary, I was usually being fed materials like a pig, and did not have any autonomy to do anything I wanted.
How many web apps did you build starting in March, considering your new website?
Starting in March I built like at least 6 web apps, taking into account my New Website.
What did you decide to do after building AnonyTube?
After building AnonyTube I thought I would stop coding frontend and focus on school for a while.
What was June like for you in terms of your motivation and interests?
However, June saw a backslash of not wanting to do anything other than playing with cloud and frontend and web dev. Anyway, it was pretty sad.
Why did you build a markdown parser?
I built a markdown parser since Joplin doesnt support review, and NocoDB doesnt support documents, Notion doesnt support full markdown.
What database did you connect your backend to in order to organize and easily export and analyze your data?

I connected the backend to MongoDB, my favorite database ever, so that all my data is organized and easily exported and analyzed, and I only write in markdown and latex and some sane HTML for that matter It looks like this I had no idea how long it took to build a fully polished app.
What is your assessment of the current state of the app you've been working on?
Like, this app is still unpolished, but it already took enormous effort.
What are the key challenges you faced in finding the right software solutions for your needs?
The key takeaway here is that the opensource projects might not fully suit our needs, and the proprietary ones might also not suit our needs.
What task management tool did you build yourself using NextJS and MongoDB?
I disliked Google Tasks and built a NEXTJS task manager myself, also with MongoDB, my favorite database.
What was one of the challenges you faced when trying to build apps for your website?
I also tried i18n on my website but gave up on it since the blogs are dynamically rendered.
How many words did you write in total for all your blog posts, and what challenges did you face in translating or processing that content?
I wrote about 100k words total in all my blogs and translating that would not be a trivial task, and AWS translate is too badyou also have to parse the markdown lol.
What are some benefits of using Docker for building and deploying applications?
Like the website is just made in English and anyone can use Google Translate if they dont understand it. Docker is so fantastic, like literally, it can containerize everything.
What was your routine and study habits like during that difficult semester?

So like I was mostly staying up all night or having very very instable schedules and not preparing for the tests, only doing some homework with minimal time and fully engaged in AWS, MongoDB, Docker Hub, NEXTJS, etc.
What emotional impact did your heavy involvement in various activities have on you during the semester?
Engaging in stuff makes me feel numb, and the semester passed leaving me feeling empty and sad.
How did you manage to organize all of your information and data during a difficult semester?
But anyway I finally organized everything into my selfhosted MongoDB, like, literally everything with Access Controls, which seems to be very satisfying despite failing in many courses in my school.
What were the great issues you had with school?
Looking in retrospect, there are several great issues I had with school. Let me tell you what they are.
How do you think your current issues are impacting your ability to maintain a balanced life?
I dont think I can have a balanced life with these issues.
What are the typical commitments and expectations for students taking multiple courses in order to graduate?

After selecting multiple courses you are expected to have fulltime commitments to schoolwith little spare time for yourself, and given the large amounts of credits required for graduation you are expected to commit fully to school.
What is the recommended approach to managing time commitments in a university setting?
In a university setting I am expected not to put 80 or 90 percent of my time on school, instead, a more balanced approach would be better.
How do you plan to allocate your time during the next semester?
I can put onethird on school, onethird on selflearning, and onethird on chilling or socializing.
What caused you to become very rebellious this semester?

Instead, I was constantly overwhelmed by school, requiring me to put the full majority of time into itlike throughout the freshman and sophomore year, as a result, when I found out things are no better this semester, I became very rebellious.
What are your thoughts on the computer science curriculum at your school?
The school is teaching outdated knowledge in computer science. It is greatly irritating how much they are behindor subpar, since being behind is different.
What issues have you been facing with the computer science knowledge being taught at your school?
School is teaching me bad practices in computer science, and very wrong computer science knowledge.
What are some examples of poor course materials and instruction that you have experienced in your classes?
For example, in an embedded system course, the teacher doesnt know gitignore and zips all files into several GB source code to download, with no clear comments, only a huge book of 1000 pages.
What were some of the challenges you faced with your schoolwork that semester?
Furthermore, the teacher expected me to understand everything myselffrequently threatening me with low grades if I didnt figure everything out myself.
What was your experience with a classmate who lacked basic computer science knowledge and struggled to help you debug a program?

When I talked to him about command line and programming he shows a clear lack of the basics of computer science knowledge frequently running into bugs he cant solve when trying to help me to debug the crappy program, doesnt know any command line.
What was the focus of the teacher in the database course?
In a database course, however, the teacher emphasized too much on the front end and interfaces and ignored important database knowledge.
What were the main issues with the professor's teaching methods and course content in this computer science course?

The teacher constantly, with outdated knowledgenot teaching MongoDB, spark, or distributed database, focusing too much on how to build an interface, with the interface being VB and outdated frameworks, wrong knowledgeyou have to manually download the exe to update, correction you can just sudo apt update sudo apt upgrade or sudo packagemanager upgrade, whatever works, and ambiguous projects that the TA struggles to explain.
What issues did you encounter with the final project in your course, including the teacher's response and the limitations around course scheduling?

In the final project, the teacher said something very very ambiguousa teacher management system, when I asked the TA he was like Dont care, and One course can only be taught once a semester, and disregarded me, clearly ignoring the basic functionalities and utilities of the project.
What concerns did you raise about the robustness and security of the system, such as CSRF, captchas, and access control, and how did the TA respond?
When I asked about concerns about the systems robustness and security, like CSRF, captchas, and access control, the TA completely disregarded and showed no interest.
What can be greatly irritating for students when working on a project assigned by the teacher?
It is greatly irritating when all TAs cant explain something clearly in a project the teacher assigned.
What issues did you face with the TAs in another course you took?
In another course, TAs clearly show a lack of understanding of my working environmentsnot knowing about command lines and disregarding Linux.
What was your experience with the courses you took this semester?
Not one course was even engaging, and I got so tired. Ahh, imagine.
What was your overall impression of the relevance and value of the courses offered at your school?
Overall I felt like there wasnt much I could learn from the schools courses that is relevant, and learning feels a complete waste of time.
How does the lack of inclusion from TAs contribute to your feelings and resistance to learning this semester?
TAs lack of inclusion makes me feel isolated and rebellious, adding to my resistance to learning.
How many courses did you end up selecting for the semester, and why was that too much for you?
I selected 10 courses, way too much for me because I was pushed by the schools credit system.
What did you learn about Computer Science or anything useful during your time at USTC?
I learned pretty much nothing about Computer Science or anything useful in USTC, previously while dedicating significant time and effort to school.
Why did you feel that the knowledge from school was outdated and not worth studying?
And I wouldnt learn much with the very outdated knowledge, so I didnt study in school.
What was the problematic attitude towards school that ultimately caused harm?
Obviously, this attitude towards school was very problematic, and disregarding academics in the end only caused harm to ourselves. 1.
How can we manage our course load during a difficult semester?
Choose fewer courses Select a few courses that we can manage even if we hate all of them 2.
What is your advice for coping with the challenges you faced with your school courses this semester?
Make solid plans to selfpace learning the courses So like basically I still need to understand the courses as they are fundamentalseven though the schools teaching is just pure SHIT 3.
How can someone cope with the challenges faced during a difficult semester?
Have fewer distractions Anyways, keep on boycotting video games. The worst time had gone, and the goddamn semester had ended, from now on everything will get better.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about alaska, titled 'Do I Want to Live in Alaska?'.

messages.content: When was the memorable trip to Alaska that you went on?
This is a reflection on the trip on 2023.5.132023.5.22. It has been a little more than a year since I went to Alaska on that memorable trip.
When was the last time you stayed overnight on a trip?
Since that trip, however, I have not stayed overnight on any travels.
What were your thoughts on visiting Florida during the winter after hearing positive things about it while having lunch in Denali?
While I was even planning on going to Florida in the winter heard nice things about that when I was having lunch in Denali, I lost the urge later.
What happened after you visited Alaska that made other travel destinations seem less appealing to you?

Part of the reason might be I lost a lot of interest in traveling from going to Alaska because I fell so much in love with the winter landscapes that other places looked trivial and not that attractive.
What happened to the scenic trips you used to take?
Sometimes I went on trips to see scenic views, but they became no longer appealing.
What was the most striking and beautiful natural scenery you encountered during your travels?
Nothing I had ever seen in my life was as striking as the beautiful landscapes in Alaska, those winter glaciers and mountains and rural towns.
How much did you end up spending on your recent trip to Alaska?

I spent almost 4000 dollars alone on the trip, from skyhigh pricing of plane tickets to the minimum unoptimized living costsaround 150 dollars a day for 9 nights, plus doing all the regular activities, e.g., boat cruise, flightseeing, Alaska railway.
How much would a 10-day trip to Alaska cost compared to the price of a long-lasting, business-level laptop?
A decent trip to Alaska for around 10 days would cost about 4 times the pricing of a busineslevel, longlasting laptop.
Where did the money you're considering using for a trip to Alaska come from?
It is a large amount of money, and its from my parents, not mine.
Why have you been feeling guilty about using your parents' money for enjoyment, even though they have a lot of it?
Lately, I have been feeling guilty about bulk spending my parents money, like, even if they have so much, I cant justify using it for enjoyment.
What would you consider to be an unreasonable use of your money while living in Alaska?
I can use it to buy food, buy a phone, pay tuition, but go on a highcost trip? That sounds unreasonable.
What challenges have you been facing with your schoolwork that have caused you to cut back on traveling?
I have faced significant challenges in schoolwork these days, and I stopped having that vibrant vibe. I cut traveling to face schoolwork.
What people did you meet on your trip to Alaska?
So let us first reflect on the people I met on my trip.
Where do most tour guides in Alaska work the majority of the year?
The majority of tour guides said they worked in the lower 48 most time of the year and came to Alaska only in the summer for a job.
What is the demographic composition of the drivers hired for tourist purposes in Alaska?
Furthermore, all drivers hired for tourist purposes are white, while some local drivers have different ethnicities.
What have you noticed about the demographics and roles of the local people working in the tourism industry in Alaska?

purely personal experience Then there are working local people There is noticeably a huge proportion of young, attractive women usually around 20 working the jobs of welcoming guides or at front desks, which I reckon is intended to make things more welcoming.
What types of tour guides have been to most of the lower 48 states and work to entertain tourists for money?
Then there are the 2 ATV guides from Miami, who have been everywhere in the lower 48 states, but mainly work and entertain tourists for money.
What are some of the different types of tourism-related workers and services available in Alaska?
There is also commercial Jeep tour drivers, and talks a lot about the local history and entertain tourists, anyway, to earn money. Then there are those travelers.
What types of travelers are likely to be affluent middleaged or older and have accumulated wealth in their early ages elsewhere?
Well, some of them are affluent middleaged or older travelers who likely accumulated wealth in their early ages somewhere else.
What are the typical characteristics of the people you might encounter as a traveler in Alaska?
They likely work hard or have some reliable source of income. These people are mainly nice because they are travelersalthough they might be very nice in real life too.
What is the ethnic composition of Alaska's population?
When people are traveling they tend to be much more friendly and approachable. Alaska is predominantly white, with few blacks, Asians, or Latinos.
What effort is being made in Anchorage to foster inclusivity of Black people's heritage in Alaska?
In Anchorage museum I remembered there seeing on TV about Black Peoples heritage in Alaska, so there is an effort to foster inclusivity.
What is the impact of minor ethnicities compared to California, and how does the computer science industry in Alaska compare to other parts of the country?
But minor ethnicities have less impact than California. There are very few tech companies or computer science jobs in Alaska.
What is the current availability of cloud VPS services in Anchorage?
It is so hard to find a cloud VPS in Anchorage nowadays.
Why does Alaska lack the hype and prominence of the tech industry compared to the West Coast?
While the West Coast has so many top tech companies, from Socal to Silicon Valley to Oregon, Seattle, and even Vancouver, Alaska just doesnt have such hype.
How does the distance from Seattle to Anchorage compare to the distance from Southern California to Seattle in terms of Alaska's remoteness?
Alaska is so remote that the whole coastline from Socal to Seattle is around the same distance as the coastline from Seattle to Anchorage, just to get a general idea.
What other northern cities with similar latitudes to Anchorage have you heard good things about in the tech industry?
But I heard good things about Helsinki and Stockholm in tech, which are also around 60 degrees of Latitude like Anchorage.
What is the current state of the tech job market in Alaska?
There arent many tech jobs in Alaska today other than writing some frontend or database for small companies. Complete remote working seems way better.
What did you observe about the military presence and local families in Alaska?
Although I didnt personally experience it, there seemed to be a strong group of military people in Alaska, and a lot of local families seem to come from veterans.
What are your thoughts on the military culture and the likelihood of moving to Alaska in the next 20 years?
I dont like military. While not impossible, I see very few possibilities of moving to Alaska in at least the next 20 years.
What is the most realistic option for frequently visiting or living in Alaska long-term, given the various factors and considerations discussed?
The most we can hope for is frequent vacations or longterm stays in Alaska. Heres why.
What types of occupations are common among native Alaskans?
Most native Alaskans I met are either bluecollar workers or workers with very special specifications, like commercial pilots.
Why would working as a driver or tour guide be considered strange after years of academic training and expertise?
While not impossible, working as a driver or tour guide after decades of intensive academic training and expertise seems strange, failing to utilize my strength.
What type of tour guides are you not well-suited for in Alaska?
These tour guides dont require much tech knowledge beyond middle school and focus more on interaction and local familiarity, either field I dont have a strength at all.
What level of education is typically required to become a computer science teacher at a local high school?
Even a computer science teacher at a local high school doesnt need a PhD degree.
What are the main challenges you anticipate in finding stable, well-paying employment and affording the cost of living if you decide to move to Alaska long-term?
Thus getting a stable income and suitable job becomes very hard if I want to live there longterm. Whats more, the cost of living is no joke.
How does the homelessness situation in Alaska compare to that in California?
Homelessness in Alaska is better than in California, however, it is still a problem. I saw homeless camps in Cuddy Park.
What did you observe about the homeless population near the train station and the University of Alaska Anchorage?
I saw homeless people sleeping on the ground near the train station. I saw a homeless person camping near UAA.
What did you observe while visiting a nearby cottage?
I saw some homeless camps across the street at Robs cottage. I miss the laidback atmosphere.
What is the atmosphere like in Alaska compared to other places you have visited?
Like you go there and there isnt much hurry or tension in the air, but exposed to natural beauty.
What is one of the key benefits of living in Alaska compared to bustling and noisy cities?
Whats more, Alaska provides a very quiet environment, away from the bustling and noisy cities.
What was the prevalence of RVs in the residential areas of Fairbanks?
In Fairbanks, as I walked on the streets I saw there was an RV in front of almost every house.
What aspects of the Alaskan lifestyle do you find appealing for finding inner peace and reflection?
When I walk around I can find peace in my heart, and reflect quietly in my inner mind in the slowpaced lifestyle.
What are the downsides of living in a place that puts you under constant pressure and negatively impacts your mental health?
Living in constant pressure is no joke, it rips the fun away from me, putting me in anxiety and mental health problems. I feel a great sense of belonging there.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about journal, titled 'The Journey of Language Learning'.

messages.content: Why should someone learn a new language according to your perspective?
Theres no good reason to learn a new language anyway, like its not very useful and doesnt give me an instant dopamine rush or happiness. It wont make me more beautiful.
What led you to listen to a lot of Soviet songs in Chinese, but not develop any real interest in the language itself?
A few years ago I listened to a lot of Soviet songs in Chinese, but they did not arouse any interest in the language itself, since most people sing these songs, but in their Chinese language.
What was the source of the old Soviet songs that were translated into Chinese in the 1950s or 1960s?
There was this Soviet culture back in the 1950s or 1960s in China, so a lot of old Soviet songs got translated into Chinese.
What has recently increased your interest in Russia, specifically related to figure skating?
