I was lucky to find this post where a Russian developer released LineageOS for that model There are many unofficial releases for those communitydriven open source projects.
How did you find the process of implementing the ROM recovery using fastboot?
I found it surprisingly easy to implement. Source How to flash ROM 1. Install ROMs recovery using fastboot flash boot boot.img 2.
What steps are required to sideload updates in the Pixel recovery environment?
Boot into recovery In Pixel, adb sideload must be enabled in the apply update section. 3.
What steps should a user take to install the LineageOS firmware on their device using a downloaded ROM file?
On your PC with the downloaded ROM, type in the terminal adb sideload ROM.zip 4. Flash firmware A13 download from mega.nz 5.
What steps did you take to get LineageOS working on your device?
Wipe datafactory reset Like basically, after flashing that and wiping the data, I had a working LineageOS!
Why are there so many different phone manufacturers and phone brands?
I dont get why there are so many phone manufacturers and so many phone brands out there.
Why do phone manufacturers release so many new models every year?
Moreover, I dont understand why they need to release tens of hundreds of phones every year, literally for the sake of it.
What do you see as the main differences between various smartphone brands?
I mean, I dont really see a difference between those brands, except for different default operating systems and UIs, which I want to customize myself.
What is your opinion on the booming market of operating systems?
I think its all a commercial joke, this booming market of OS.
What was the cheapest price you were quoted for a phone at the reseller store?
Today I went into a phone reseller store and asked the price, and they said the cheapest is more than 1000 RMB.
What do you think about the price of the phone you're considering buying compared to other phones on the market?
Its so crazily expensive compared to other things, especially considering its a reseller. I mean, I can buy a goodend brandnew phone with 1000 RMB.
Which models of Samsung Galaxy phones did you find that Postmarket OS supports?

Then I went into Samsung Galaxy and asked them for these models that Postmarket OS supports Samsung Galaxy A5, Samsung Galaxy E7, Samsung Galaxy S III They were kind of surprised in finding I want so freaking old phones, and for a moment I couldnt help but burst out laughing.
Why do you find the need to constantly update and buy the newest phones so hilarious?
I mean, it was just hilarious. I seriously dont understand the need to buy the newest phones or update them like three times a year.
What are the main reasons you dislike using default software on phones?
I mainly dislike defaults because of a lack of support for personal customization and their bloatware properties.
What is your approach to customizing your Gnome desktop environment or writing Vim scripts?
Still, I am a lazy person, and I dont do extensive Gnome customization or vim scripting.
What is your stance on using optional and free software versus proprietary but free software?
If something is optional and free, actually chances are I would still like to use it. If something is free and proprietary I wouldnt have anything against it.
What is the main issue with using operating systems or software that have multiple bugs and are closed-source?
But the problem lies in the multiple bugs and closed source of the operating systems or software that theres just no way to fix for someone not in the company.
What do you sometimes do when you find a bug that you want to try to solve on your own?
Sometimes I find a bug I probably want to try to solve on my own.
What are some of the frustrations you've encountered when dealing with bugs and issues on iOS and Google devices?
But sometimes with iOS and Google Bugs like an app wont work, there are just no ways to find the solutions.
What was your view on smartphones during your teenage years?
Looking back into my teen years, literally, I have shown strong dislike for smartphones.
When did you first get a smartphone?
I didnt have a smartphone my entire middle school career, only inheriting one from my dad in the summer of 2020 when I was going to high school.
What was your initial perception of smartphones?
I hated the idea of a smartphone for as long as I could remember.
When did you start using computers?
I wasnt opposed to other tech stuff like, I used a computer long before that and had my own computer in the 6th grade.
What did you realize about your ignorance and arrogance towards WeChat when looking back on your phone usage?
I probably missed adding lots of people to WeChat contacts, looking back. Like literally, I was so ignorant of the existence of WeChat and so arrogant of the whole concept.
What has been the evolution of your preferences and how have they changed over time?

I can probably say that most of my new preferences today dont come from nowhere but are like this for many years, except previously either externally controlled, restricted, or just having some gaps that I couldnt cross with limited skills.
What is your perspective on diversity and individuality when it comes to personal preferences and abilities?
I was born different from many people, and I dont want to judge who is better. Different people can have different preferences, none more superior than the others.
What was your stance on using a smartphone, even after you had acquired one?
Yet, I am hoping to maintain mutual respect for people with different digital philosophies. Even after I had a smartphone, I was much against using it.
How did you manage your smartphone usage during the summer before starting university?

During the summer before I went to university, I limited my smartphone time to literally 10 minutes every day only scanning the code when entering a library and around 5 minutes checking my friends status on Weixin, although once or twice a week I would bypass that, but no more than 1 hour.
What made you decide to not use your phone for a whole semester after starting university?
After I entered university, I decided it was too distracting, and I didnt use my phone for a whole semester.
How long did you go without using the phone after finally booting LineageOS on it?
It was kind of amazing to believe in retrospect, but I really didnt use it for an entire three months at all.
What did you do to overcome the inconvenience you faced during your exploration of the smartphone?
I bore the inconvenience and utilized my computer to do all sorts of stuff.
What happened during the second semester that made you unable to continue your stance against using smartphones after the COVID-19 pandemic?
The second semester I continued my stance against using smartphones, and couldnt hold on after the COVID pandemic hit.
Why did you start using a smartphone more often during the COVID-19 pandemic?
To be honest, if it wasnt for COVID, I would probably keep on not using a smartphone, only there was mandatory testing to be done every day, which is awfully annoying.
Why would people be confused by your statement of not using smartphones?
People would usually be confused by my statement of not using smartphones, and few would think from my perspective.
What is the importance of having a smartphone with WeChat in China?

I can confidently say that not having a smartphone nowadays is just unbearable in China if you have no WeChat, you can do practically nothing and are no different than a dying old person in terms of living conveniences.
What experiment did you try and fail at during the time you memorized maps and bus routes, and later lost your bicycle?
I did that experiment myself and failed. During that time, I remembered the maps and bus routes by heart and went out riding my bicycle which I later lost.
What did you do for entertainment after losing your bicycle?
After losing my bicycle, I walked a lot. I watched many movies and YouTube on my computer indeed, YouTube was one of my main forms of entertainment at that time.
What was the last period you remembered enjoying literature?
I also read a lot, and that was the last period where I remembered myself actually enjoying literature. I can no longer dive into literature.
What steps did you take to ensure you were well-prepared and organized during your journey of exploring and setting up LineageOS on your phone?
I relied on my parents for much information and kept a daily track of everything to do, every single day.
What did you frequently do at the top of the school building at night?
I frequently climbed to the top of the school building to watch the city lights at night. I believed in all sorts of good things.
What kind of mentality did you sometimes long for, and how did it affect you?
Sometimes, I kind of longed for that kind of mentality at the time. It was actually very sad and had a reverse effect on me.
What unexpected behavior did you experience with your Android phone?
Also, there was one occasion when my Android phone started beeping for no reason, and then it stopped.
What do you think about the package manager in LineageOS and how does it affect your ability to use the phone for most tasks?
So LineageOS doesnt have a package manager, which I think is definitely not ideal. But I can use my computer for 90 of tasks.
What other mobile operating system are you interested in besides LineageOS?
The other OS that Im interested in is PostMarket OS or mobile Alpine. However, it doesnt seem to support WeChat.
What is the main reason you use your smartphone?
Thats frustrating for me because the main reason I use my smartphone is for WeChat.
What alternative messaging app would you likely use if you were to leave Mainland China?
So if someday, say, I leave Mainland China, then I will probably ditch WeChat and start using that distro. There is also GrapheneOS, which mainly supports Google Pixel.
What is your experience with using the PinePhone?
PinePhone has low specs, and I have had great trouble using it.
How did you set up your phone with LineageOS?
Other than that, its just a few clicks away with adb install for all essential software, and I set up my phone pretty quickly.
What is your stance on using WeChat?
Im not against WeChat, but if theres any chance, just any chance, I would probably ditch it.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about hongkong, titled 'Horrible Start of Summer'.

messages.content: What went wrong with the HKUST research program you were planning to join?
So following the horrible semester end came a horrible start of summer. I was gonna join the HKUST research program, but it started very wrong.
Why didn't you get an exit endorsement for study or a D visa when you arrived?
So I didnt get an exit endorsement for study, or a D visa when I got here.
Why do you prefer to use English for any kind of documentation and communication from now on?

Another reason not to use Chinese, it is simply too hard and too ambiguousor simply I am too bad at Chinese I would prefer to use English for any kind of documentation and communication from now on, I think.
What is the process for obtaining a student visa to study in Hong Kong?
Its sort of like this, you need to get a student visa from a Hong Kong universitylike HKUST, then go to the local office in Mainland China to get a stamp.
What happened when you arrived in Hong Kong and went through customs?
So I went here and got stuck in the customs.
Why were you not allowed to enter Hong Kong with your student visa?
I tried to go through the customs and showed the person my student visa but she wouldnt let me in, saying I could only go with a traveling visaneeding to exit for 7 days.
What time did you arrive at your destination on July 1st, and how did you feel during the early morning hours?
I arrived at around 030 on July 1st, and I was worried sick in the predawn hours.
Why did you think about calling your parents during your time in Hong Kong?
I thought about calling my parents but they were sound asleep and on their way to Northern Europe.
How long did you wait at the station before deciding to leave and take a bus to HKUST?
After 4 hours I finally decided to go out of the station and went on a bus to HKUST. I was really anxious and told to leave in 7 days.
What did you see on the bus?
I saw Dockers and Podman on the bus. I didnt take pictures of them.
What did you call the workers and cranes you saw on the dock when you arrived at HKUST around 7 am, and why did you give them those names?

Turned out the Dockers are actually cranes on a dock for handling containersso I gave them the name Docker, and the Podman are actually workers on a dock I gave it the name Podman, I blurted out the word without a second thought So I arrived at HKUST at around 7 am, and dude, was I tired?
What did you do with your schoolmates on that hot day?
It was so hot. I joined the flagraising ceremony that day with my schoolmates.
What was the event that involved singing the national anthems of both Hong Kong and China to celebrate a significant anniversary?
It was like singing Hong Kongs anthem and Chinas National Anthem celebrating Hong Kongs 27th anniversary of returning to China.
Who did the host say the Hong Kong police were from?
There were Hong Kong policethe host said they are from HKUST. They are a tall and handsome young man. It was raining hard.
How many police officers were raising flags during the ceremony, and what flags were they raising?

9 police were raising 3 flags, the Chinese National Flag, the Hong Kong Flag, and the HKUST flag, only the Chinese National Flag wouldnt raise, and they tried to raise it for some time, and it finally did.
What happened after the USTC schoolmates who joined the research program were taken to a room?
After that, weUSTC schoolmates who joined the research program were taken to a room and asked to introduce ourselves.
Who was the HKUST professor who chatted with you about AI, Physics, and research in general, and where did he do his undergraduate studies?
There was an alumnus I think a professor in HKUST who was also from USTC undergrad chatted with us for a while about AI, Physics, and research in general.
What did he praise Claude Sonnet 3.5 for, and how did your parents help and guide you?
He praised Claude Sonnet 3.5 for his extraordinary ability. My parents were helpful and provided guidance for me.
Where did you go after having lunch?
Anyway, after lunch, I got on a bus to go back to Hong Kong airportto go back to Shanghai.
Who are the only people that would support you in this scenario?
Well, my parents are the only people in this scenario that would support me though, so I guess I am very grateful.
How long did you stay in Shanghai waiting for your EEP (Employment Entry Permit) to be stamped?
I stayed in Shanghai for a week waiting for my EEP to be stamped.
How often did you go out to explore Shanghai, and what did you do during your other free time?
I got out every 2 days to go around Shanghai and played with NEXTJS and MongoDB the other times. I cycled 40 kilometers from 0 to 3 am.
Where did you walk around 20 kilometers in Nanjing and what landmarks did you visit?
The other day I walked around 20 kilometers around Nanjing Road and Peoples Square and back to Shibei Middle School in XiZang Road, ahh the old days.
What changes did you notice in the place you visited?
LIke the place changed a lot I would say but anyways, it was no longer relevant.
What happened on 7.8 regarding your visa and travel plans?
So on 7.8, I got my visa stamped, and I booked a plane ticket rat night right away.
What time did you decide to take the bus after staying at the airport for a few more hours?
It was past midnight when I got out so I decided to stay a few more hours at the airport and went on the bus at around 530 am.
What happened after you contacted your parents and stayed home from 7.27.8?
Everything turned out fine and the professor asked me to book a time to meet.
What made you feel so understood, despite your problematic behavior, that you felt lucky to have a single dorm room all to yourself?
I got so touched by understanding like literally, I didnt expect anyone to understand my problematic behavior I am so lucky to have a single dormstaying alone in a 2 person room.
What is the housing situation like for people in Hong Kong, and how did you manage to find a house there?
People say its insanely difficult to find a house in Hong Kong, so Im really lucky that I got a house in Hong Kong like the school provided one for me.
How can I obtain an Octopus Card and a power converter during my visit to Hong Kong?
Buy an Octopus Card at a subway station out of the airport. Need a converter Can get one at Seven Eleven. I cant speak Cantonese and I cant understand Cantonese.
What languages do you struggle to understand and what is the official language used in this location?
In fact, I struggle to understand Mandarin. Just use English as its also the official language here. There are all kinds of food here.
What food options were available and how could you pay for them during your stay in Hong Kong?
Theres some McDonalds and it was delicious. You can pay by both WeChat, Octopus, and a bank card like pay by both methods in China and the United States.
What is the cultural practice in Hong Kong that the author used to take advantage of when they arrived from mainland China?
Hong Kong has a queuing culture. I used to lurk around and jump to the start of the line at any opportunity, thats how it works in mainland China anyways.
What is the cultural difference in queuing behavior that you observed when taking the bus in mainland China compared to Hong Kong?
However here it was considered very rude and problematic behaviorI went on a bus like that and was frowned upon, people dont queue for a bus in mainland China, just rushes on at first opportunity.
What do you usually do when there are strict queuing rules in Hong Kong?
So in the end I usually just wait till everyone else finishes and quietly waits at the end of the line. Hong Kong has some very strict rules.
What was your reaction when you realized you could be sent to jail for shoplifting?
For example you get into jail for shoplifting. I was like what?
What is the usual procedure for dealing with this kind of issue in the US?
In US it seems like a fine and warning is just the usual procedure for dealing with this kind of stuff.
What is the penalty for smoking in Hong Kong?
Smoking gets fined for thousands of HK dollarslike several hundred USD it is that strict.
What is your opinion on the prevalence of smoking and littering in mainland China?
Of course I never smoke, just imagine those people who smoke literally everywhere in mainland China. Littering gets fined for a lot of dollars.
What did the narrator observe about the living conditions of homeless people in Berkeley?
Also partial culture shock since in Berkeley there was this place called peoples park where there are tents with groups of homeless people and trash and dirty smell everywhere.
What is the observation about the cleanliness and hygiene in Hefei based on the description?
In Hefei though there arent groups of homeless people you can see lots of stores with smelly garbage right in front of it. Also spitting is considered very bad.
What are some common behaviors or practices that are considered inappropriate or unacceptable in public spaces in Hong Kong?
Imagine those heavy smokers who spit regularly. Also you dont eat or drink in public transportations.
What is the city where both white-collar and blue-collar workers are known to diligently follow the rules?
Like following the rules isnt just limited to white collars here, but hard labor people also follow the rules, so its pretty amazing what this city is.
How does Hong Kong compare to Singapore, particularly in terms of conscription?
In many ways Hong Kong is akin to what I heard about Singapore, except good news you wont have to go through conscription, one of the worst nightmares in life.
What problematic behaviors should you be mindful of to avoid getting into trouble?
So in conclusion its best to mind my problematic behaviors and not get into trouble here .
What problems did you have to deal with last semester that you hope will not occur this semester?
I already had problems of a lifetime last semester, hopefully everything will go on smoothly. Its necessary to mind my behaviors .
What are some of the small troubles you regularly cause in your life, even though you have never caused any great troubles fortunately?
Like some people are just known to be smooth in life and not cause any troubles, while me on the other hand causes small troubles regularly. Although I never caused any great troubles fortunately.
What can happen if you daydream while out shopping and accidentally take something from the store without realizing it?

Also its not like you cant go off wandering in daydream cuz like you can basically end up in great trouble if you just go to a store then in daydream pick something and get out of it store with it with no bad intentions.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about journal, titled 'Not Gonna Use Windows Anymore'.

messages.content: Why don't you use Windows anymore?
Lets Go! Linux so cool I am still a noob I formatted Windows, so Windows dont exist on my computer anymore.
Why is being a person like Richard Stallman too much for you?
Being a person like Richard Stallman is too much for me. For instance, I need to use phones, or else I will have difficulty surviving in this world nowadays.
What prompted you to start transitioning your applications to open-source software on your ComputerArchLinux setup?
But anyway, I decided to take a small step towards Open Source Security. So basically almost all my applications on the computerarchlinux are open source now, I made this switch.
What are some of the software and services you have decided to use or avoid as alternatives to proprietary and mainstream options?
Google Chrome Chromium VS Code OSS Code Google DuckDuckGo YouTube Invidious MSOffice OnlyOffice Then I decided to almost completely stop using Twitter, Reddit, Discord, Telegram.
Why don't you use Twitter anymore?
The reason is that there are no healthy things on Twitter and no knowledge of all of them.
What is your opinion on the state of Twitter?
Twitter is just a toxic and malicious area filled with adult content and nothing useful.
What is your opinion on the state of popular social media platforms like Reddit, Telegram, and Discord?
Similarly Reddit and Telegram is filled with adult content, addictive and toxic, very unhealthy, and full of garbage. Discord is boring and full of gaming, like full of rubbish.
Why do you still use Instagram?
The only reason I am still using Instagram is because some people I follow are on Instagram, but then I decided to only use Instagram on my phone since I think it is more of a phone app.
Why do you think social media is bad for you, and why do you have to use Gmail despite it having no alternative?
Social media is just bad for me. Gmail has no alternative since it is the Berkeley mail and I must use that.
What crappy Chinese software can't you replace after going back to China?
Some very crappy Chinese software cannot be replaced after I go back to China. These days I value simplicity and practicality.
Why are you fine with using proprietary software?
I have no problems with proprietary software because they are unavoidable and many of them are superior, and avoiding them only makes my life harder.
What is the reasoning behind needing to respect users to a certain extent, even when using proprietary software like Google Chrome and social media platforms?
However those proprietary software still need to respect the user to a certain extent. There is no point in avoiding Google Chrome and established platforms like social media.
Why do companies sometimes hide certain aspects of their software code?
Besides companies need to earn money and it is reasonable if they are hiding some competitive edges in their code.
What are some examples of things that are more of a hobby than an actual daily use case for you?
Many of those things, e.g., device exploration, niche open source softwares, are more of a hobby than an actual daily use case.
What are some of the downsides of the alternatives you've considered to Windows?
Some of them have slow speeds, and not modern practices.
What is your opinion on hobbies that are not suited for daily usage?
They can be very interesting hobbies, however, most situations our times are more important and can be utilized to do other things, and they are mostly not suited for daily usage.
What can happen if you modify Linux too extensively?
For example, if you tinker with Linux too much, you may risk bricking the system.
What problems have you encountered when trying to maintain your Linux system?
I bricked my system at least 3 times, either when the boot partition got corrupted or the fstab got misconfigured. It is awfully frustrating and not constructive in daily life.
Why don't you care much about your security and privacy?
I realized I dont really care about my security and privacy that much.
Why is it important to prioritize practicality over intentionally avoiding certain online platforms?
There is no point in avoiding YouTube or Gmail intentionally as they are still the best platforms out there. Practicality, in fact, is a far more important concept.
Where is people's information readily available with just a few clicks, especially in the United States?
Peoples information is everywhere with a click, especially in the United States.
What is the concerning issue with the amount of personal information available on people search platforms?
Go to any peoples search platforms and you can see peoples addresses and phone numbers, it is just insane how much information is already leaked.
How can someone use a Python bot to extract personal information from websites, even if the data is hidden from public view?
Someone with a Python bot can crawl millions of people and addresses from these websites, and even if you take them down or hide them from public view, they are still there.
Why don't I use the same password across all my accounts?
Moreover, my passwords are already stored safely in KeePass, and one platform breaching them doesnt leak my other platforms randomly generated long unguessable passwords.
Why doesn't the person care if companies sell their data?
As for privacy or data, it doesnt matter if companies sell them or not because most of them are already available anyway, and for a person void on social media, I dont get a lot of advertising.
Why do you appreciate Google and YouTube?
I appreciate Google because it gives so much free space and YouTube is so free, not charging anything for its CDN costs.
Why would you be willing to pay for YouTube?
I would be willing to pay for YouTube for the CDN and bandwidth cost, though. That said, Google is also an optional platform and doesnt force everybody to use it.
What are some of the top companies that have contributed significantly to open-source projects, and how have they impacted your daily life?
These big companies are pioneers in opensource projectsexcept Apple it seems. Without these top companies designing excellent open source projects, my life would be a lot harder though.
What does the incident with DuckDuckGo's search results being affected by Bing's API problem suggest about DuckDuckGo's privacy claims?
So called private DuckDuckGo browser went down when Bings API had a problem, so it implies DuckDuckGo relies heavily on Bing for search results, and that implies it is not that private anyway.
What is your stance on using Google services, and how do you utilize their products like Google Docs and Slides in your daily workflow?
I dont blindly use any Google Service but it is a very great tool. Google Docs or Slides are the most convenient office suits out there. They can even be used offline in a browser.
Why does the author feel that strictly adhering to open source guidelines will not improve their overall technical skills and may further isolate them from society?
After all, sticking to strict open source guidelines wont improve my tech skills, just very niche things isolating me more from the society I am already isolated from.
Why is the author not concerned about companies selling their data in China?
Moreover, in China, the government knows all about your data. Companies selling my data dont endanger me in any way, as I am just a regular person.
What security practices would you recommend for protecting sensitive information like passwords and identification numbers?
I would, of course, avoid plainword passwords or plainword bank accounts or identification numbers. Maintaining a practical approach instead of debating about what is ideal is very beneficial.
Why don't you use some services?
I dont use some services not because they are proprietary. I was mistaken in my previous approach and I am now emphasizing the utility.
Why don't you use some social media services?
I am not using some services because of other reasons. I dont use some social media because they feel overwhelming not because they are proprietary.
Why did you quit using Mastodon and Pixelfed from the Fediverse?
Similarly, I also quit Mastodon and Pixelfed from Fediverse, as they contain views that are too polarizing and not constructive.
Why don't you use TikTok?
I dont like TikTok not because of privacy reasons but because I just dont like short videos, people can have choices and preferences.
What services are you still not completely satisfied with?
There are, however, still some services I might not be contented with.
What is an example of a cloud storage service that requires downloading a client and has an annoying floating icon?
For example, BaiduNetDisk requires downloading a client to download any fileswhich in turn not only bloats the system but always shows a floating icon, which I find annoying.
What are your main criticisms of the BaiduNetDisk cloud storage service?
It simply doesnt respect the user. BaiduNetDisk also restricts the free tier downloading speed to 50 KB per second, absolutely ridiculous and egregious behavior from the company.
What are your thoughts on the network speed and transparency of the company you're using?
I thought the network speed depends on my Internets bandwidth and the Companys servers bandwidth, and it lacks transparency and respect for its users.
Why do you dislike CSDN?
Similarly, I really dislike CSDN because it hides the copy paste functionality with some stupid Javascript intentionally, forcing users to log in.
What is your opinion on the company's actions that force users to pay or log in, and how do you feel about the ease of copying code from the browser's debug console?
These acts doesnt benefit the company but forces the users to pay or log in. Copying code can be done easily from the browser debug console anyways.
Why are you annoyed with some software companies?
They simply disregard the need to benefit the users, instead, focusing on maintaining a dictatorship and autonomy, without actual benefits or superior quality, which makes me annoyed.
Why did you stop using the Proton VPN service?
I dont use Proton anymore because the bridge is too hard to configure, forcing the user to stick to the Proton Mail Client when using it.
Why don't you use Proton as an alternative to Gmail?
Furthermore, Proton is also proprietary. While popular and overall a very good app, it provides no advantage over Gmail. I dont use windows not because it is proprietary.
What is your opinion on the Google Services on Android, given that they are proprietary?
I like the Google Services on Android though, which are proprietary too.
Why do you dislike using Windows as your primary operating system?
I dislike Windows because it isnt ideal for development and lacks a good package manager, hides too much things through GUI.
Why don't you use Windows anymore?
I dont know what is going on down inside it and using Ubuntu is just faster.
Why did you switch back to using Ubuntu instead of ArchLinux?

I went back to Ubuntu simply because the usage experience is almost the same for me as ArchLinux, I dont notice any difference except package management, in which case I add debs instead of using AUR.
Why did you choose to use Ubuntu primarily on your laptop?
I use Ubuntu primarily because most servers use Ubuntu, giving me a seamless transition between my laptop and servers, and in turn, making my life easier.
Why don't you like the idea of Microsoft Recall, which takes screenshots every few seconds?

I dont like the idea of Microsoft Recall which takes screenshots every few seconds, not because it is a leak of privacy or security breach, but because I find it unnecessary, and doing so probably makes my battery consume more power.
What are your thoughts on using the SnapDragon Elite Chip and running Linux on it?
That said, I am still very enthusiastic about the SnapDragon Elite Chip, and if I can run Linux on it seamless I would be willing to use that.
Why don't you use Apple?
I dont like Apple not because it is proprietary. In fact, I do like Apples interface. Apple has so called clean and minimalistic interface and style.
Why don't you like using Apple products?
I dont like Apple because it always create a mysterious or magical atmosphere with its products, usually causing confusion to me.
Why did you brick every Apple device you obtained?
Furthermore, I bricked every Apple device I got with either jailbreaking or removing the recovery shell.
Why do you prefer products that prioritize user freedom and flexibility over those that are more closed-off, like Apple's offerings?
I value utility, ease of use, and actual transparency, basically users freedom and flexibility, on the products I use, which Apple fails to addressbeing a walled garden.
Why is there often a toxic superiority in the open source community?

You cant even run MacOS on non Mac devicesor some people might but its not a wide practice There is often a toxic superiority in open source community that goes like I am superior than you because I use open source, but actually meaningless.
Why do some people believe they are superior for using ArchLinux?
Some people believe they are superior because they use ArchLinux, which isnt quite true.
What are the differences in the installation and customization process between ArchLinux and Ubuntu?
While ArchLinux usually requires some command line proficiency to install, Ubuntu can also be installed via command line and tinkered extensively.
What is your view on the relationship between different operating systems?
There is no superiority between operating systems and only utility and widespread usage.
What does the author mean when they say that the open source community is not toxic as a whole?
That said, these people neither represent the open source community nor does that implicate that open source community is toxic as a whole.
What has been your experience with the friendliness and constructiveness of people in the context of your decision to move away from Windows?
In fact, I find many people very friendly and constructive.
What sparked your initial interest in technology?
Open source community was the reason I got interested in technology, and I would be forever grateful for it leading me in the early days I studied computer.
What are some examples of Microsoft's contributions to the open source community?
In fact, Microsoft contributed so much to the open source community, including VSCode and Typescript, which are essential tools for todays developement.
What is your view on the contributions of big companies for niche applications?
Downplaying big companys contributions for niche applications is wrong. Basically these things are part of my guidelines at least for now In the end its all about personal choices.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about berkeley, titled 'Berkeley in My Eyes'.

messages.content: What is your impression of the downtown Berkeley area?
Downtown Berkeley is really ugly and there are many homeless people. They yell, beg for money, shout profanity, and sometimes run around nude.
What did you notice about the homeless people in the downtown Berkeley area?
I could smell the scent when walking past them, like they hadnt showered for months. Around Shattuck Avenue there are many homeless people, and sometimes they form groups.
What are some of the challenges with getting around certain parts of Berkeley?
There are also many construction sites that lasts for years, and block the road, so it is really hard to go through.
What is it like trying to navigate the streets in Berkeley?
The roads are dense, so I have to wait for traffic light after walking like 50 feet.
What is it like to walk around downtown Berkeley at night?
Downtown Berkeley at night is not the most pleasant place to walk around, as the roads are pretty much empty except for those homeless people walking around.
What time of day are most stores in Berkeley typically closed?
At about 910 pm most stores are closed. From 1012 am, many homeless people are walking around in Shattuck Street, and there are still some cars around.
What is the nighttime activity observed in different parts of Berkeley?
I think those homeless people are looking for places to sleep. There are still some small groups of students here and there.
What time do most stores typically close in the downtown area of Berkeley?
After 12, like in 1 am or 2 am in the mornings, all stores are gradually closed.
What food options are available in the area south of the UC Berkeley campus along Durant Street?
except for some fast food restaurants that sell hamburgers in south of campus at Durant Street.
What is the typical activity level on the streets of Berkeley after 2 am?
Then after 2 am, there are almost nobody on the streets, and most homeless people find a place to settle.
What can you observe in Berkeley in the early morning hours?
In 24 am in the morning, if you walk by some parks or grasses or benches you may spot some people lying and sleeping there, which is kind of scary to be honest.
What is the nighttime scene like in the city?
There are little cars driving by. The small roads are almost pitch dark. The big roads are dimly lighted.
What was the status of the stores and bakeries in the area during the late night hours?
Some stores and bakeries still have light on but there was definitely no one inside.
Where can one find a store open for food late at night in the South Berkeley area near the university?
If you want food at this time of the day, the only stores open is a seven eleven on College Avenue south of Berkeley, which is like 1.5 miles from the school.
What is the experience of visiting a location in Berkeley during the early morning hours?
When I walked there in 3 or 4 am it is locked to stop homeless people from entering, and you have to knock, and a person will come to the door. The roads was so quiet and calm.
What could you sometimes observe early in the morning in Berkeley?
After 4 am sometimes I could see one or two people walking their pets, and then the birds would start chirping marking the start of another day.
What was the scene like outside Trader Joe's in the early morning hours?
When you walk by Trader Joes there was light and you could see some workers shuffling the shelves, although it wont open for another 2 or 3 hours.
What was the transition from nighttime to morning like in East Berkeley?
Then after 5 am it gradually become light, and the eastside hills was covered with morning fog.
What was happening at the Berkeley High School during the construction?
In the school there was some construction going on and there was trucks driving by really fast.
What was the atmosphere like in the downtown area of Berkeley early in the morning?
From 68 am the street was still very quiet, and most stores still closed, with some people jogging in the early morning sun and the fog disappearing.
What is the comparison between the north side and Downtown in Berkeley?
Compared with Downtown, the north side is much better. There are no homeless people, and the houses are better constructed.
What are some of the challenges you face when getting around the hilly terrain of Berkeley while carrying a laptop or backpack?
But it is very hilly, and tiresome to walk around carrying a laptop. When I carry backpack to school, it gets so hot and I would be sweaty.
What is the elevation difference between the east and west sides of Berkeley?
The east side is much higher than the west side in elevation.
What area of Berkeley do you find to be better than downtown and not as hilly, where you often go running in the evenings?
The west side are mainly many small roads leading to the Bay, and it is better than downtown and not hilly. I would usually go running there at evenings.
What is your experience running down University Avenue in Berkeley?
It is smooth and quick to run down University Avenue, since it is a slight downhill, and I would usually go at a really fast pace, like under 4 min kilometer.
What was your experience with the roads in different parts of Berkeley?
But some roads are small and I bumped my feet once on Dwight Road.
What is a good hiking trail and park to visit in North Berkeley for stargazing?
The trail starting from Strawberry Creek Park north is good enough, and Cedar Rose Park is a good place to see stars at night.
How can one get to a particular location in Berkeley?
It is also convenient to take bus 51B to go there. Going westward, and there are two big roads, Sacramento and San Pablo Avenue.
What is the street layout like in the downtown area of Berkeley?
After that there is 10th Street, and the numbers start decreasing till 4th Street. There are many beautiful clothing shops on 4th Street, and some fancy restaurants.
What was your experience like when you went to that particular place in Berkeley?
I went in there, and the waitress were nice, but the clothes are too expensive and not suitable for me.
What other notable landmarks or attractions can be found after crossing the bridge over the railroad on University Avenue in Berkeley?
Then there is Aquatic Park after crossing the bridge over the railroad on University Avenue, and an outlook.
What hiking trail can be found along the coastline near Berkeley?
There is a hiking trail along the coastline and I hiked both ways. Northward along the coast line is Albany, and southward is Emeryville.
What is your opinion on the area of South Berkeley compared to the rest of the city?
Emeryville is cleaner and better than Berkeley, and not hilly. There isnt much to see on the south side. There is just some houses, bookstores, grocery stores.
Where did you remember going to in Downtown Ashby?
I remember going down to Downtown Ashby Bart Station, which is quite close.
What is the main drawback of going to areas like Oakland or Emeryville compared to staying in Berkeley?
But it takes more effort to go down to Oakland or Emeryville, and there isnt much to see or do anyways, except maybe a park on the way.
What is it like to travel in the eastern part of Berkeley?
It is hard to find grocery stores and restrooms on the way. East side are mountains, and there are a few trails going up, including Big C Hike.
What is the approximate student population in one grade at UC Berkeley, and how does it compare to another university?
There are about 30 thousand students in one grade in UC Berkeley, which is like 15 times USTC. Students are from all around the world.
What is the typical attendance pattern of classes at UC Berkeley over the course of a semester?
The classes are usually crowded at the beginning of the semester, but almost empty at the end of the semester, like only one fifth of the students are there.
What do you think is the main difference between the class sizes at USTC and the class sizes in the context being discussed?
This is very strange, since in USTC the class size are almost no different. Probably most students prefer remote learning.
What is challenging about getting around the UC Berkeley campus?
It is tiresome to get around the campus, as there are no west or east side of the campus, and walking around in classes takes some effort.
What is the availability of on-campus food and housing options at UC Berkeley?
There are no convenient stores or cafeteria or student dorms in campus, and there are only expensive cafes and cafeteria off campus.
How does the dining culture at UC Berkeley differ from your previous university experience?
I remember everyone heading to eat back in USTC after classes, but here people go in all different directions.
How many cafeterias are typically available for students in Berkeley, and how crowded are they?
There are only 4 cafeterias, and they are not usually full, so I figured that people find there own ways of eating.
What is the typical activity level on the UC Berkeley campus throughout the day?
Usually in the morning the campus is mostly empty, but in the afternoon it gets really crowded, and just people everywhere.
How do the weekends at UC Berkeley differ from the weekdays in terms of library hours and academic activities?
Also, at weekends most libraries are closed, and there are no recitation or discussion, which is quite different from USTC, where weekends look the same with weekdays.
What was your experience with joining clubs on campus during your first semester at UC Berkeley?
There are many clubs on campus, but I want in the mood of application in the first semester since I faced finals at the start of the first semester, so I didnt get into any clubs.
Where do you go to study on the weekends in Berkeley, even when it gets extremely hot?
It is good to be alone anyways. Hass Library is always open, even on weekends. But it always gets unbearably hot there, even when I took all clothes off.
What happened when you were locked out after going out to answer a phone call and your backpack was in the library?
Also once I was locked out after going out to answer a phone call, and my backpack was in the library but the door couldnt open somehow. Anyways the door opened after 1 hour strangely.
Where did you live during the first 4 months after arriving in Berkeley?
I lived right across Berkeley High school in the first 4 months here, and I would usually see groups of people going out to have lunch at noon.
What is it like to visit Berkeley High School?
Anybody can enter the high school, and it seems that the students are having fun. I once went inside and stayed for half a day.
How do students typically move around the Berkeley campus between classes?
Students go around between classes, and they usually walk in groups, chatting as they walk.
What is the typical school schedule like for students in Berkeley?
School usually ends at 2 or 3, and students didnt seem cram or having to study 15 hours a day or something.
What is the typical classroom experience like at Berkeley High School?
Classes are discussion, and students sit in strange positions or walk around, but teachers dont really mind.
What kinds of sports events do you usually spectate on weekends or encounter randomly?
There are many sport events, including soccer, basketball, volleyball, and I usually spectate on weekends or just randomly encountering some.
Who wrote the book A Wizard of Earthsea that was recommended by your English teacher in middle school?
Ursula Le Guin went to the high school, who wrote A Wizard of Earthsea, a book recommended by my English teacher in middle school.
How do weekends in Berkeley differ from those in other cities like Shanghai or Hefei?
Unlike Shanghai or Hefei, weekend here is also different, since some stores are closed and the school is half shut down.
How long does it typically take to travel to and from San Francisco when using the BART system?
San Francisco Since the Bart is slow, going to San Francisco and back takes quite a few hours.
How does the city of San Francisco compare to the city of Berkeley in terms of density, buildings, and the proximity of downtown areas?
San Francisco is much crowded than Berkeley, and there are tall buildings and large shopping malls, and in downtown things are close to each other, just like in Peoples Square.
What did you do when you went to watch a musical in the area?
I went there once to watch a musical. Many people take the Bart in the morning.
How much does it typically cost to rent a single-bedroom housing unit in the Berkeley area?
It is extremely expensive to rent a house here, and a single bedroom would cost more than 1500 dollars.
How does the cost of renting a studio in Berkeley compare to the cost in Hefei?
I figured that it is about 7 times more expensive than Hefei, where I found a studio only 1700 rmb a month, but here the cheapest studio are like 1700 dollars a month.
What was your initial living arrangement when you first moved to Berkeley?
I first rent a bedroom, and the bedroom was small but everything was furnished.
What happened when your previous lease ended and you needed to find a new place to rent?
Then the lease ended and they said they will only continue if I continued to rent for 1 year, so I went on zillow and rent a studio.
What was the condition of the studio when you first moved in?
The studio was unprepared when I moved in, with no bed, no dishes, no table, no chair. So I had to buy a bed frame and buy mattress myself.
What are the rent prices like for shared living arrangements in Berkeley?
Furthermore, the rent prices are strange, where double or triple rooms cost as expensive as 1000 dollars, with the same size shared by 2.
What is the estimated cost of renting a room in Berkeley with 2 or 3 people?
So I figured that if 2 people live in a single room it would only be like 800 dollars, or around 550 dollars for 3 people to live in a room.
What do you find so expensive in the different areas of Berkeley?
I dont understand why they are so strangely curved. Anyways, everything is very expensive.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about middle-school, titled 'My Sixthgrade Life'.

messages.content: What motivated you to write a memoir about your life experiences?
Ive always wanted to write a memoir. There are no better ways to record your life, the ups and downs, and what was worth remembering.
What happened to your time after eighth grade?
But after eighth grade scarce was my time. So I procrastinated for a long time. This is the memoir of sixth grade.
What did you admit about your feelings, despite how childish or naive it may have seemed?
It may be childish and naive but it was how I really felt.
Where did you go after returning to China with an excellent memory of your year and summer?
After I returned to China with an excellent memory of my year and summer, I went to Shibei Middle School.
How has your life changed since transitioning from elementary school to middle school?
Things had been harder and different between middle school and elementary school. Life now isnt as good as my previous life.
What did you do when you returned from America?
And I am going to tell you about my life here. When I came back from America, I rested for two days.
When did you get home and how were you feeling?
I came home at midnight and was not tired at all because I slept a lot on the plane.
What did you do in your new busy life after turning on the lights?
I turned on the lights and read a book by Ann M Martin.
What happened when you were reading and studying for a long time?
I didnt look up for three hours when reading and realized that it is morning by the time I finished. I played for two days.
When did your family decide to move to a nearer house?
On the third day, which is pretty hot, we moved. We lived far from my middle school, so my family and I decided to move to a nearer house.
What floor is your new house on?
The new house is on the twentyninth floor. Then I went to the military training in our school. Its so boring that I didnt want to do it.
What kinds of activities does the teacher make the students do in your sixth-grade class?
The teacher makes us do things like calling numbers one by one and standing. It is so stupid and dumb.
What did you learn about the military training requirements in America compared to your home country?
Later I read in a newspaper that Americans dont have to do military training. I kind of wished I was born in America so that I could skip military training.
What was the final event that concluded the training period for the students?
Then finally the last day arrived. We had a competition between classes to see which class does the best in the training.
What was the outcome of the class competition your class participated in during the previous semester?
To my surprise, our class won out of nine classes and got a prize. Then the new semester started. There are many differences.
What time did you typically finish your homework in primary school?

I used to finish my homework at five or six oclock in the evening in primary school, I usually do some math problems late in the evening and often finish them and start playing at seven or eight oclock.
What was your daily routine like on the first Monday of your sixth-grade year?
Now it had been so different. The first Monday, I went to a geometry class. It was already eightthirty when I was home.
What time did you finish your homework on a typical school day?
Then I did all my homework until ten. We have three math classes every day.
What do the math teachers in your sixth-grade class do differently from using the original textbook?
The teachers dont use the original math textbook but give us tests, which were much harder. We have two math teachers. Mr. Chen taught the extra class Monday and Tuesday.
What classes did Mr. Xu teach, and how often did he give math tests?
Mr. Xu taught the extra class Wednesday and Thursday and the normal math class. He is very strict. We had a math test every two days.
What was the performance of your middle school in math competitions in Shanghai?
And this was just the beginning. Our middle school is so good at math that every year we got the most prizes in math competitions in Shanghai.
What change did you notice in your reading habits during your busier sixth-grade life?
I used to read an English book a day, which I now tried to do, but couldnt bear it with the homework.
How has your workload and the difficulty of your reading material changed since the start of the school year?
I had more and more and more homework than before and the English books I read are harder.
How many books do you think you would need to read this year to match the number of days in the year, given the amount of homework your teachers assign?
So far, I couldnt read 366 books, the same amount of days this year, if the teachers keep the homework like that.
What goal did you set for yourself regarding your daily reading habits, and what strategy did you employ to achieve that goal?
I wanted the average amount to reach one book a day. And there was another solution to this problem, work until ten or eleven every day.
What was another serious problem you faced during your sixth-grade life?
There was another serious problem. I wasted too much time on the computer.
How do you find out the details of your homework assignments?
The teachers always put the details of homework online, and I have to find it using the computer. Pressure began to rise in my heart.
How did you manage your time spent on the computer depending on the amount of homework you had?
And, as I found out, that if one day there was not much homework, I will never waste time on the computer, but if there was too much of them, I would waste a lot of time on screen.
What was one of your habits that you sometimes struggled with during your sixth-grade year?
I hate to admit it, but I was sometimes a procrastinator and would postpone work.
What was your emotional state like in the days after a certain event occurred?
After that, I became angry at myself and was often not in a very good mood many days. How I am jealous of the elementary school students!
What middle school did you originally want to attend?
I also wanted to be in Smic Middle School. I thought I did the wrong choice for middle school.
What is your current situation regarding your academic workload and future expectations?
I got myself in here and will never get out, homework and pressure will only increase in the following years.
What are some of the differences between your school's schedule and the schedule of Smic Middle School?
Then look at Smic Middle School, they went home by four while we went home by six. They finish homework by six or seven while we do it by nine.
How often do the students in your sixth-grade class have math tests?
They have an easy math test once a week or less.
How many math tests per week does your teacher say you will have later on?
We have four hard math tests or more a week and the teacher said that we are going to have eight tests a week later on.
What subject did you struggle with when writing compositions in middle school?
I had a hard time writing Chinese compositions, not English, of course. I am good at English, especially after reading so many books.
What did you write essays about in your Chinese class during your sixth-grade year?
But I had read little Chinese books, and our teacher let us write an essay every day in Chinese.
What do you tend to do that causes you to complete your homework so late?
I always waste time on it, so thats why I did the homework so late. We have an English song every week. I like what makes you beautiful best.
What class song competition did your class participate in and what song did you choose?
I also like one direction. We had a class song competition. Our class chose roar. We practiced hard but only got third prize.
What was the outcome of your participation in the Intermediate Interpretation contest?
I didnt pass the Intermediate Interpretation contest, which is of course hard. I didnt get a prize in either English or Chinese, and I felt bad.
What happened during the final exams period at your school?
Luckily, I got a good score on the midterm examination. One of our students got chickenpox, and our class gets separated. Our autumn outing was canceled.
How do your classmates feel about the upcoming autumn outing?
Most of my classmates are happy to hear it, but I am not. I still want to go to the autumn outing.
How does your teacher handle the results of quizzes and tests in your class?
In my class, it is so hard to be the highest score on quizzes. After every test, the teacher writes our rank in a corner of the test paper.
What is the academic competition like in your current grade compared to your primary school years?
It is a real keen competition in my class. There was a stark contrast in primary school, but theres isnt much difference between the best and the worst one now.
How many students are in your class, and what was your score on the math test compared to the class?
There are thirtytwo students in my class. In the math test, I went from the first one except that many students are also my score to the twentiethfirst.
What did you like about your sixth-grade life?
But I liked one thing, which is there is little math homework.
What does Mr. Xu think about the two best classes in sixth grade at your school?
Mr. Xu thinks that our class and class sixthe best two classes in sixth grade in our schoolshould be divided into two classes to separate the good ones and the nottoogood ones.
What happened to the good thing that turned into the worst idea ever invented, leading to an increase in math homework?
This good thing turned upside down when we started to divide into two classes, which is definitely the worst idea ever invented. We started to have much math homework since then.
How were the students divided into classes based on their performance?
I was divided into the fast class, and Mr. Xu said that the worst one in the last class will go to the slow class.
What subject do you struggle with the most in your sixth-grade classes?
I am likely the worst in geometry, while the fast classes teaching about lines and angels and all that.
What did Mr. Xu say we would be learning about in class, and what happened to the speaker shortly after?
Later, Mr. Xu said that we would be learning about congruent triangles and similar triangles. I was about to be kicked out.
How did you feel when Mr. Xu entered the room?
Theres a sick feeling in my stomach every time Mr. Xu walked in. I felt nervous talking to him because he talks with a blaming tone.
What two things does the protagonist dislike the most?
He hates two things, cram class and feeling too well. Thats right in some ways, but he kind of goes too far.
What happened in Mr. Xu's math class that made it your worst class ever?
Thats math class becomes my worst class ever since. When someone laughed Mr.Xu would say, Whats funny?
What was the teacher's approach to calling on students during class?
He would then let that person stand up and ask them questions, even if that person didnt do anything. He thought that when any of us smiling, we didnt focus.
What was the challenge students faced during the final exam in your sixth-grade math class?
But how would a person focus so long under great pressure? We had a test. It is about parallel lines and equivalent angles.
What did Mr. Xu threaten would happen to students who performed poorly on the test?
Mr. Xu threatened us that whoever gets too low in the test will go to the slow class. I think I did really badly on the test.
Why does Mr. Chen not want the score to be announced?
I hope the score will never be announced. Mr. Chen never goes too far. I dont know why. Maybe he just dont like dealing with people.
How did you feel when the final exam scores were announced?
The score was finally announced and it looks like a nightmare. I kind of shivered all through it.
What was your score on the final exam in your sixth-grade class?
Finally, my score was announced and I got the lowest scorethe teacher announces the worst score at last. I got 25.
What was the performance on your latest test compared to your time at Shibei Middle School?
That was the worst test I took since I went to Shibei Middle School. I am lucky. The teacher didnt write my real rank.
What subjects are typically taught in primary school?
Its time to leave the division and the math classes to come back to final exams. In primary school, there are just three subjects Chinese, Math, and English.
What subjects have you been taking on top of your usual responsibilities, and how has that affected your life?
But now, there are also Geography, Computer, and Science. I am also finishing my 366 books. I was not just busy, I was restless and frustrated.
What did you find difficult about adjusting to your new life at your new school?
Though I kind of adjusted my life here, I couldnt bear it.
What were the reasons you had to prepare for the various academic tasks in your busy sixth-grade life?

I needed to prepare for the expository and narrative writings review the ordinary math, cause we are too fast and I got less than eighty on the mock test and I was not satisfied with the result do the computer homework go over geography, and science.
What changes have you made to your daily routine in order to improve your academic performance, especially in Chinese and other minor subjects?
Moreover, I need to spend another half hour every day reading a book. In the last, I got a bad score in Chinese and the minor subjects.
What was the main challenge you faced when transitioning to your new school's curriculum?
I just wasnt accustomed to so many subjects. Many of my classmates studied physics early and they knew all about science.
How does time seem to pass differently when you're eagerly anticipating or dreading an event?
Time is really slow when you want it to be fast, and really fast when you want it to be slow.
What marked the end of one-eighth of your middle school life?
The first semester of sixth grade ended just like that, marking the end of oneeighth of my middle school life.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about alaska, titled 'Visiting Fairbanks'.

messages.content: What are some of the key characteristics of the state of Alaska?
Alaska, the last frontier, where winters are freezing cold, and summers are short and cool, where wildlife and breathtaking nature and everywhere.
What are some popular destinations to visit in Alaska besides Fairbanks?

Some destinations include Seward and Homer, the seaside towns, Denali, the tallest mountain in North America, Gates of the Arctic, national park of untouched nature, Prudhoe Bay and Utqiagvik, to see the Arctic Oceans.
What personal qualities or experiences did solo traveling in Alaska help you develop?
I learned to be fearless, to have trust in myself, do the challenge without turning back, to face loneliness bravelysolo traveling gave me courage.
What did you see and experience during your visit to Alaska?

I saw the broadness of nature, the beauty of glacier and huge snowy mountains, melting ice and waterfalls and sliding rocks, the blueness of ocean and coastlines and rocky beaches, more than 30 degrees north in latitude from California, and the wildlife, bears, orcas, seals, and many more, that I hadnt seen much before in life.
How did the scenery and attractions in Fairbanks appear to you as the day came to an end?
Now in the evening sun everything looked glamorous, and the all the places and sceneries I was once amazed at became dwarfed and not that interesting anymore.
What activities did you experience during your visit to Fairbanks?
I flew in a helicopter, went on a boat cruise of 110 miles, hiked solo on the mountains, went on ATV and Jeep tours, saw the kindness of strangers.
What did you learn to do in preparation for your trip to the Fairbanks area?
I learned to be wellprepared, to plan a trip carefully, to get a car in the future to be ready for the roads and mountains.
What are some of the unique experiences you had during your trip to Alaska?
There are many firsttimes for me on this trip. One trip is hardly enough, and I quickly fell in love with Alaska, onesixth the size of Europe.
What are your plans after visiting Fairbanks?
After this trip I will return one day, and perhaps even choose to live here.
What are some of the future places you plan to visit in Alaska, and how did you try to find affordable hotel options?

Future places to go Prudhoe Bay, Gates of the Arctic, Utqiagvik, Juneau, Ketchikan, Wasilla, Alyeska, Talkeetna, Harding Iceberg Trail, Lost Lake I tried to book the cheapest hotels, but they are still expensive.
Why do you prefer to stay in Fairbanks rather than travel further away?
The reasons are because I travel solo while most hotel rooms are for 2 people and I do not have a car, so I cannot go very far and only have limited selections, and couldnt sleep in a car.
What was the most expensive accommodation option you booked during your visit to Anchorage?
The most expensive one is airbnb in Anchorage, which was actually designed for more than 1 person but since I was staying only 1 night, with the cleaning fee it became expensive.
What is your current location and stage of your trip in Alaska?
Today is 521. I am just leaving Denali, and going to fairbanks. My trip is almost coming to and end with the final destination.
Where are you currently located and what have you done today?
I am on the train, and feeling quite sleepy. Today I first went on a Jeep tour.
What time was the Jeep tour scheduled to pick you up from the Princess Hotel?
The Jeep tour was to pick me up at Princess Hotel and 7 am.
What time did you have to get up in the morning to finish packing and hurry to your destination?
It was freaking early and so hard to get up and I got up at like 659 and then hurried to finish packing my things.
What happened when you were supposed to check out of the hotel and prepare for your Jeep tour in Fairbanks?
I went to the hotel lobby and I could hear the tour guide calling my name, and I didnt even check out or drop luggage, which I had planned to do, before leaving and going on a Jeep tour.
How much did the Jeep tour cost?
Fortunately, though, te checkout went successful. The Jeep tour is extremely expensive, like 184 dollars.
What happened during the Jeep tour at the park?
Everybody got to drive a Jeep of their own, and those couples usually sit together, except for me, as I had to sit in the tour guide Myriams car. Then we got off to the park road.
What did the tour guide explain about the rivers in the area?

Then the tour guide explained how the rivers were all formed by glaciers, and salmons will die in those rivers so inland, since the rivers are rich with silt, which comes from glaciers, and we can judge how the river flows from how brown the color is.
What was the route of the highway that went along the Nenana River near the Princess Hotel?
The Park Highway went like along Nenana River, the one just down Princess Hotel.
What happened during your trip that caused you to get your first picture of a moose?
Then someone saw a moose and we all slowed down, and I managed to get my first picture of a moose here.
What animals did you see during your Jeep tour in Fairbanks?
Then we went to see some caribou, which is like reindeers. I saw those caribou from a binocular provided in the Jeeps, and there were 3 of them, eating grass.
What did you do during your visit to Fairbanks that involved driving on a dirt road and visiting a camp settlement?
We drove on Denali Highway, where it turned out to be a dirt road, and to camp settlement and had a stop there, it seems as an entry to the mountains. Then we had snacks provided by the tours.
What did the tour guide tell you about the height and growth of Denali (Mount McKinley) during your visit?

It was a spot to overlook spot where I could see those snowy mountains, and the tour guide explained Denali is like 18000 ft from base camp to the top, very impressive, still growing at .5 mm everywhere becuase of those plates clashing together.
What did you see on the way back from your activities in Fairbanks?
On the way back we passed some RVs, a crazy motorbiker, ATVs, and some normal cars. Then I got very sleepy and slept for half an hour.
What did you see when you woke up during your visit to Fairbanks?
When I woke up there was 2 caribous in sight. Then we went back to the highway.
How much did you end up paying for your drive during your visit to Fairbanks?
It just seemed like a normal drive, and I ended up paying so much.
What did you do after storing your luggage at the hotel?
Then I went back to the hotel and stored my luggage, then headed to the horseshoe lake trail.
What was your experience like on the trail in Fairbanks?
The trail was a piece of cake for me and I ran first half. Then I saw a beavers dam, and I crossed it, getting my shoes wet.
What is the ease of crossing through the vegetation in Fairbanks?
It isnt hard to cross it, though, the trees and leaves are all loose.
What did you attempt to climb near the lake in Fairbanks?
Then there was a rock cliff like in the side of the lake, and I attemped it twice.
What happened when you tried to explore the area on foot in Fairbanks?
However, everything was loose and I couldnt even get past like 30 feet before feeling too dangerous to go on.
What is your age and why are you hesitant to participate in certain activities during your visit to Fairbanks?
Anyways, I am like 18 years old and dont want to risk losing my life.
What was your experience like when you explored the tundras around Fairbanks?
Then I saw some road in the tundras and attemped it, and it seems smooth at first.
What challenges did you encounter while hiking through the forest in Fairbanks?
However, there are too many dead trees falling down on the way and those branches got in my face.
What was your experience trying to cross the park road in Fairbanks?
I tried very hard to reach the other side of the park road, but it was a steep climb and there was just too much tree branches, so I ended up quitting it anyways.
How did you navigate the terrain while descending from the tundra?
The way down is no easier than the way up, and I crawled on all fours and tried to slide down the tundra.
What were some of the challenges you faced during your outdoor activities in Fairbanks?
But there are so many dead trees and branches and mosquitos, and they always flew around me. It was annoying but I managed to go down safely.
Where did you eat while visiting Fairbanks?
Then I ate some food in the restaurant Morina Grill and then went back to pick up my luggage.
What types of jobs do people have in Fairbanks?
People here kind of work in all different states, and many come here only for the summer, which is cool.
What did you consider doing in different places each year before deciding to take the train to Fairbanks?
I thought about finding jobs every year in different places and it seems tough but fun at the same time. Then I boarded the train to Fairbanks.
What is the highest mountain in North America that you have not yet explored before leaving?
Denali is the highest mountain in North America, and I havent explored much of this place yet before leaving it.
What activities did you miss out on during your visit to Fairbanks?
I hadnt even gone on the denali bus tour or the savage river shuttle. But anyways things went fine. I slept half of the journey.
What did you notice about the landscape as you traveled northward during the summer in Alaska?
I found that the land became greener and grenner as I was going northsummer was coming there first.
What did you notice about the changes in the snow and vegetation as you traveled from Seward to Fairbanks on the train?

In Seward after 500 ft or so everything was covered with snow, and in Denali there was only little snow on top of the mountain, then as we are going to Fairbanks on this train everything seemed so green, that it didnt look like 67 degree north latitude at all.
What was the weather like during your visit to Fairbanks?
Trees are growing just everywhere, and no trace of snow could be seen by eyes.
What was your initial impression of the transportation and accommodations when traveling from Shanghai to Hefei?
I thought that on the train from Shanghai to Hefei it was more bare than this. Then I arrived and called the hotel and they came pick me up.
Who was staying at the Golden North Inn and what was the relationship between the person and the hotel staff?
There was only me staying in Golden North Inn and the man picking me up was a fourth year student in University of Alaska Fairbanks, who is working in the hotel.
What did you notice about the person's attire while visiting Fairbanks?
He is kind of dressed in womans clothes and is very nice.
What did the person say about their academic performance and attempt to study computer science?
He talked about how he had only C grades and had attempted computer but failed, and I thought I was fortunate not having to work while studying.
What did you do after settling into the hotel in Fairbanks?
After settling into the hotel I grabbed a map and went right out to hike. I planned to go downtown and went along Cheny River.
What happened when you were visiting Fairbanks and interacting with people there?
I saw a group of people who thought I was Japanese, and a woman acting very strange and talking to me in words I cant understand.
What time did you go downtown and what was the area like?
Anyways, I left and went for downtown. It was pretty late at about 10 pm at night, and it is quite empty. I kept along Cheny River.
What did you observe at Pioneer Park during your visit to Fairbanks?
I went to Pioneer Park, which seems like a childrens playground, and there are some women doing bike flips, which seems very interesting.
Where did you go after your visit?
Then I went to Growden Park, and there are a group of people, mostly kids and teenagers, playing volleyball.
What were the people doing during the activities in Fairbanks?
Some of them are half naked and barefoot they were having so much fun that I wished I could join.
What else did you observe happening at the park in Fairbanks at night?
There are also some other people skateboarding there in the park. It was beautiful there at night.
What is the difference in the types of activities and lifestyles observed in Denali, Seward, and Fairbanks?
In Denali and Seward most people are tourists hiking around while in Fairbanks they seem to be living normal lives. Also, the more north I traveled the hotter it gets.
What were the approximate temperatures in different Alaskan cities during early May, and how does the current environment contrast with typical Arctic weather?

In early May, it was like 510 C in Seward, in Anchorage it was like 1015 C, while in Fairbanks it was like 1520 C. Now as I look around the trees and mountains are deep green, and there are no signs of Arctic weather or coldness, just spring and life everywhere.
What was it like exploring Fairbanks in the evenings?
There are few people on the streets in the evening and it did get lonely, then I thought like hiking with another person.
Is hiking alone in Alaska as safe as hiking with a partner?

But then again, like 2 people arent necessarily safer, if a wolf or bear comes out and attack no one can escape, and I think it is just as safe hiking alone as 2 people because I tend to be more careful when I am alone.
What was your reasoning for traveling in groups instead of wandering alone during your trip to Fairbanks?
Anyways, I figured it was mostly mental support, and maybe by traveling in groups makes the trip sounds more reasonable, instead of like mindlessly wandering, which was what I had done.
Where did you take so many good photos that you had a hard time deleting the mediocre ones, and where did you then go that was more deserted?
I gotten so much good photos that I had a hard time deleting the mediocre ones. Then I went to Kiwanis Park, which is much more deserted.
What did you do after walking around in the park in Fairbanks?
I walked around then quickly went out of the park to downtown.
What did you notice about the activity in the area near your hotel in Fairbanks late at night?
There is an elementary school and I could hear people playing in the school, and it was like 1030 pm.
What time did you typically go to bed when you were in elementary school compared to now?
I thought I had gone to bed earlier than this in elementary school before becoming half a night owl now.
What was the experience like during your hike in Fairbanks?
Anyways, it was a hard walk and my legs are beginning to feel sore.
What did you see from your vantage point in Fairbanks as the day was coming to an end?
I could see the mountains and a red sun just setting down, and it looked so beautiful.
What was the general condition of downtown Fairbanks during your visit?
Downtown Fairbanks looked very worn down, and there are merely a few buildings, and few people.
What did you notice about the houses and people while visiting Fairbanks?
It was actually a little bit creepy, and those people doesnt seem to look very decent. There was just old houses on either side of the street.
What did you do when you visited City Hall in Fairbanks late at night?
I walked to City Hall, and there wasnt much to see. Anyways, it was like 11 pm, and I was getting tired, and the wind was becoming cold.
What did you do after visiting the Cheny River?
I walked around a little bit more, and up to Cheny River again.
