What did you see and photograph during your visit to the Fairbanks area?
In the red setting sun the bridge was so beautiful, and I took some pictures, and there was a statue about WW2, and there was a polaris sculpture.
What happened when you were visiting Fairbanks and saw some people sitting outside that you believed to be homeless?
I saw some people sitting outside, and they are probably homeless, so I wanted to go back as soon as possible, and I called a Lyft, and it came after 20 mintues.
What was the next step in your activities after visiting Fairbanks?
I then went back to the hotel. Fairbanks is much smaller than Anchorage in both population and size.
What is your impression of Fairbanks, the northernmost city you visited in Alaska?
It is very beautiful, and a quite populated city as north as I could get.
How long did you estimate it would take you to return to Berkeley after your luxurious trip?
In less than like 40 hours I would be in Berkeley again, and my luxurious trip is coming to an end. I totally enjoy this trip.
What did you do on your second day in Fairbanks, Alaska?
Horseshoe Lake Growden Park Chena River Midnight Today is 522 and I am leaving Alaska. I slept all morning and got up and ate breakfast at the hotel.
What did you do after visiting the Fairbanks area?
Then I took a lyft taxi to North Pole, and there was a big statue of Santa Claus, and the driver even helped shoot a photo of me with Santa Claus.
What did you experience when you visited the town near the North Pole?
Then I walked around North Pole, and it seemed a small and old town. I could hear a few dogs barking so I was scared.
What did you observe about the infrastructure while exploring Fairbanks?
I walked around and there were some parks, but the roads arent well constructed.
Where did you end up going, even though you didn't realize it was a school?
Then I went to the North Pole elementary school, and I didnt even realize I went into a school.
How many kids did you estimate were in one grade at the North Pole based on the total population?
I saw many kids, while the whole population of North Pole is like less than 3000, so I figured that there are less than 50 kids in one grade.
Where did you find the location of the elementary school?
Then I looked it up in the map and there was the elementary school.
What did you observe while visiting a school in Fairbanks?
Children are climbing up and down and swinging, and seemed to have fun, which made me want to have fun with them, but I walked away. No one stopped me from entering the school though.
What did you do after visiting the shopping mart in Fairbanks?
Then I went to a shopping mart, and rested a while, and walked to a bus stop, and took the bus back to Fairbanks, then took a Lyft to the hotel, then took the shuttle to the airport.
What happened after you went to the airport on your trip to Fairbanks?
Then I went into the airport and my trip ended. Santa Claus Statue stylewidth40.0 Santa Claus Store stylewidth40.0

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about ustc, titled 'Start of a New Semester'.

messages.content: What were you thinking about as you returned to USTC for a new semester?
So I am back in USTC for a new semester. So I tried thinking about meaningful things to do.
What should a meaningful thing or activity be like, according to the passage?
I mean, for a thing to be meaningful, it better be cumulative.
Why do you believe that gaming is not a meaningful activity?
For example, gaming isnt meaningful because gaming today doesnt make your next day better at all, and the skill of a human being in gaming is limited, meaning AI is far superior.
What are some debatable topics that could be considered when pursuing further education, such as a PhD?
Other things are debatable, in my opinion. For example, it is debatable whether learning extensively about a new subject like pursuing a PhD is meaningful or not.
What is one of the key benefits of deeply studying a particular field?
For one, it is cumulative and after studying that deeply enriches your knowledge of that field.
What is your perspective on the value of knowledge if it is not applied to a job?
However, on the other hand, maybe like the new knowledge studied, if not applied to a job, isnt even worth the pain of studying them.
What challenges might an expert in a niche field face in terms of showcasing their skills and finding meaningful work?
If you are an expert in some not so popular fields, there might be no opportunities for showing off even, and the goal at the end isnt meaningful.
What do you think would be devastating if you didn't know it?
I do think language learning is a meaningful thing, though. So like imagine if I dont know English, that would be devastating.
What would be the drawbacks of not knowing the local language when immersing yourself in a new culture?
Or if I dont know Chinese, ahh, I would probably lose firsthand engagement in the culture and couldnt even communicate with people around me.
What role does language play in your life and how important do you consider it to be?
Language is pretty much base to all the things in my life, and it is largely underestimated in terms of importance.
How does the significance of learning a third language compare to the first two languages you know?
But learning a third language is not as significant as the first two, one of which is my mother tongue, the other being the de facto language in the world.
What are some of the languages you are interested in learning, even if they may not be as significant to your goals?
Still, even if it is not as significant, its still a reasonably fulfilling thing to do. Mainly I want to learn languages like Japanese, Russian, French, German, etc.
How difficult is it to learn 4 or 5 languages while maintaining a regular schedule, dealing with schoolwork, or having a demanding job?
But like learning 4 or 5 languages is close to impossible with a regular schedule or hard schoolwork or demanding job.
How satisfied are you with the idea of learning only one more language?
Maybe like learning only one more language is quite satisfying for me.
What do you consider to be the most important activities for a student to pursue in their free time?
Other meaningful things include sports and musical instruments, but they are not as important as learning a language, in my opinion.
What hourly rate have you found to be achievable as a fullstack developer when taking on freelancing jobs?
I feel like I want to take on a freelancing job. I found that for a fullstack developer, actually earning 20 dollars an hour is pretty easy.
What amount of monthly earnings would you consider sufficient for a decent life in Hefei?
So I tried to do the math and calculated that for a decent life in Hefei, like 700 dollars a month should be sufficient, which equates to about around 150200 dollars earnings a week.
What is your freelancing schedule like, where you work one day a week and have the rest of the week off while still maintaining a comfortable lifestyle in Hefei?
So like I can only work one day freelancing for web dev or operating system or anything, then having 6 days off, while still maintaining pretty welloff lives here in Hefei.
What is the main challenge you are facing with your current financial situation?
The main thing isnt about the earnings, its like currently I am still using my parents money, meaning that they constantly try to monitor and censor my activities, which is really annoying.
What do you think about the clients you're working with for your freelancing projects?
I mean I cant really complain too much since its their money, but they are seriously annoying to me.
What are your hopes and plans for becoming self-sufficient and independent from your parents?
I hope for the day that I can become selfsufficient to come sooner. If I am selfsufficient probably I wont need my parents anymore.
At what age do you plan to start taking care of or provide support for your aging parents?

However, logically speaking I shall still pay back in return to my parents, since they brought me up, but this is probably something I shall do like after the age of 35 or 40 years old, when my parents got very old, to care for them or hire an aunt to care for them or whatever.
What is troubling you about your current financial situation, and how do you hope to address it in the future?

The fact that I am not selfsufficient is deeply troubling, and maybe, like after I go to grad school, hopefully as there are salaries or whatever, and I work parttime as a freelancer, then I can stop requesting any money from parents, hooray!
What is the financial status of the author's parents in Shanghai?
Its not like my parents dont have much money, in fact, they are pretty welloff among their peers and in Shanghai, having 2 apartments in Zhangjiang Hightech Park, each one worth millions of dollars.
What are the potential drawbacks of relying on others that could lead someone to consider dropping out of school and pursuing freelancing instead?
But reliance brings unfreedom. So if I drop school right now, and go off freelancing here in Hefei, working 1 day a week, hopefully selfsufficient with my MERN stack skills.
How many days off do you have during this new semester at USTC?
I have six days off, which is practically all the time.
Where would you consider working if you decide to go freelancing?
In fact, if I go freelancing it doesnt matter where I work, and Shanghai definitely isnt a good choice because of its relatively high living standards in China.
What city would you recommend for living comfortably on a 5000 RMB monthly budget?
Maybe some smaller cities will do. Hefei is not a bad choice anyways, living here on 5000 RMB a month is more than enough.
How long do you think you can continue to work as a full-stack developer?
I dont really worry about stability, since I think I can code fullstack for at least 30 years.
What kind of employee or freelancer would you be, considering your willingness to learn, work, and accept lower pay, as well as your ability to work from home or in isolation?
I mean, I am willing to learn and work, and I dont demand lots of money. Moreover, I can stay home all the time, and I can go isolated.
How has your approach to going out and playing changed now that you're back at USTC?
I mean, I can still go out and play if I want, only its not necessary, which is awesome.
When can you still go out a few times a year?
I can still go out a few times a year, and probably at dawn, where there are no people outside.
What are some of the benefits you have now that you can start learning new languages more frequently?
I also have the whole day off to me, and I can start learning new languages 247. I can probably pick up one language every half year.
What languages do you think you will be able to work with in the next 3 years if you continue your current work approach?
So if I work like this, then I will probably be equipped with 6 more of the worlds most popular languages in like 3 years, which is so intriguing.
What regions or countries are you most interested in studying languages from?
I am mainly interested in studying languages of developed regions like Europe and Japan, or special countries like Russia, and not that much of Africa or Southern Asia.
What kind of personal decision experiences have you not had that would be beyond the social norm?
That does sound interesting and alluring but of course, I wont do that, since that is far beyond the social norm, and I havent had such personal decision experiences.
When do you think you'll have more personal freedom to make decisions?
Maybe like when I am 35 or 40 years old I can have more freedom in personal decisions. It is too risky, like dropping out of school.
What is your current educational status, given that you don't have a high school diploma?
I still need my college degree, else since I dont have a high school diploma, I will probably be a middle school grad, lol.
What is your relationship with your parents like?
Anyways, literally speaking, my parents dont know what is best for me. They are very misleading in terms of judgment, and often control my mind to do things. I dont blame them though.
What were the life experiences of your parents that allowed them to achieve a high social status in Shanghai?

My parents are awesome people, and worked extremely hard to gain a social status like this through the poverty years 30 years ago in China, climbing up the social ladder from a poor workers family in remote rural towns, to having 2 apartments in the tech hub of Shanghai.
What kinds of achievements do you feel you could never match, even if you were a billionaire in Silicon Valley?
They are definitely more impressive than I ever could be. For me to match their achievements I probably have to be a billionaire in Silicon Valley.
What was your experience like when you returned to USTC after a break?
I walked back to USTC. It seemed awfully weird here, with so many students around, that I felt a sense of nervousness even. I feared school, and I feared socializing.
Do your parents often comment on your behavior being perceived as arrogant by others?
My parents also say I am quite arrogant in the eyes of other people. No. This is wrong.
What makes you a FOSS and Linux fanatic, and how do you want to express your personality and uniqueness when socializing?
I mean, I am a FOSS and Linux fanatic, but thats who I am. There is no changing that. I want to show my personality and uniqueness in socializing, right?
What do you want to do instead of pretending to be someone you dislike?
I want to show the true self instead of pretending to be someone whom I hate, right?
What did you feel you didn't want to be demanded to do?
I mean, I felt like I dont want to be demanded to do something.
What do you feel you have the right to do, and who do you feel you owe, if anyone?
I have the right and I dont owe any people, well, maybe except for my parents, since they brought me up for the first 18 years.
What was one of the reasons your mom worked a light job when you were thinking about parenting?
Thinking about parenting, it is extremely time and energyconsuming, which is part of the reason my mom worked a light job.
What does the responsibility of freelancing involve in terms of financial and emotional demands?
Just in terms of money spending and emotional support, that is more than a fulltime job.
What experiences have you had that demonstrate your mother's selfless care and concern for your well-being, even when she was tired?
I remembered countless times when my mom was tired yet still tries to think about me first, and try to make me happy and well cared for.
What was really touching about your academic journey?
I remembered my mom trying to find resources for me in every part of my academic journey, and that was really touching.
What decision have you made about your life that may not be the best for you, but you feel you need to make on your own as a legal adult?
However, I am a legal adult now, and I know better for myself. It is maybe not the best for me, but I need to make my own decisions.
What is your perspective on making new friends and interacting with strangers?
Also, I dont owe any unknown people anything. My parents always say I need friends, and I shall treat strangers with enthusiasm and contact them to make friends.
How do you treat strangers and decide who to contact in your freelancing life?
However, I definitely disagree. I treat strangers with respect, and other than that I treat them the way I want. I decide who to contact and which person to.
What should an individual's right be regarding their choice to be alone or with others, as long as it doesn't negatively impact others?
It is my right to decide I want isolation, or my right to decide to be in a crowd, long as it doesnt affect other people negatively.
What are your thoughts on maintaining a healthy sleep schedule and personal well-being, even as an independent freelancer?
It is my right to stay up all night and sleep all day, although putting my own health at risk, but I assume that it is my own decision, right? I was, and still am, an extremely cautious person.
How cautious are you compared to your Chinese student peers when it comes to forming opinions on certain topics?
Well, maybe not as cautious as some Chinese students around me, but still, I am easily brainwashed with fear and hatred about something.
What safety precautions did you learn from your parents that you still follow today when cooking?
When my parents taught me fire and knife was dangerous, I refuse to use them even today, relying on a kettle pot to cook noodles and rice porridge.
What is your opinion on teachers, especially those you had in high school?
I always feared teachers, even though sometimes they know no better than me, especially those in high school.
Why didn't you argue back with the teachers, even though you had your own standpoint?
However, because of the fear I didnt argue back one word at any teacher as long as I could remember, only occasionally trying to explain my own standpoint.
What aspect of your freelancing life do you deeply want to get rid of, even though you acknowledge the value it provides?
Its the amount of mind control that they have on me, that I deeply want to get rid of, even though most times they are correct.
What is your current level of motivation as you begin this new semester at USTC?
As I begin this new semester I have probably the lowest motivation in the history of my life. I couldnt think about a reason to push forward.
What course are you planning to take this semester?
For example, there is this operating system and database course.
What database technologies have you already gained experience with?
I am already pretty much experienced in MongoDB and Sqlite and have used PostgreSQL for Invidious and Peertube and MediaCMS hosting.
What are some meaningful things you would like to do as part of a new semester at USTC?
All I want to do is try to read the source code and understand the main parts of the database, for example, reading Sqlite or BerkeleyDB shall be interesting practice for such a course.
What are some examples of databases that are not capturing the essentials of a database, not having much data structures?
There is also tinydb and smalldb, but thats not capturing the essentials of a database, not having much data structures.
What would you like the teacher to cover in this course?
Anyways, I hope the teacher just walks through the main source code of a popular database, and that shall be sufficient for this course.
What operating system would you expect to develop interesting programs on as a freelancer?
As of operating systems, I would expect to develop all kinds of interesting programs on ArchLinux.
Why are you finding the course on this subject extremely boring?
Its just I am really interested in this subject itself, but the course makes it extremely boring for me.
What is your perspective on the value of completing your current course and preparing for the associated test?
Finishing studying this course doesnt enhance my skills anyways, only preparing for a crappy test. I dont think studying such stuff is more meaningful than gaming.
What distracted you from your studies and academics when you returned to USTC?
Also along came procrastination, as anything I saw seemed to me more interesting than studying and academics, particularly social media.
What are your thoughts on the role of social media in your freelancing and academic life?

Sometimes I would want to be popular on social media, yet still rejecting the idea since social media is proprietary and censored by the government, and not DIY. My own instance gets no attention among people, though.
What aspects of society were you more curious about, beyond the obvious and surface-level trends?
But I was just far more curious about society, and particularly the trends of things that are not obvious, and thoughts not written, and things not seen from the surface.
What helped you stay motivated during the week you tried to avoid everything?
Social medias give me far more stamina than raw studying. I stayed at home for a whole week, trying to evade everything.
How long was your most recent extended stay at home, and when did it occur?
This is the longest time I stayed at home as long as I could remember, the last time being the covid quarantine, 7.14 to 7.21.
What is the longest period of time you have stayed at home since 2019 until mid-2023, excluding the quarantine period?
I didnt remember staying at home for one day since 2019 to mid2023, other than that quarantine.
How did your lifestyle and habits change during the COVID-19 pandemic?
Even during covid, I would go restless at home and try every means to go out and run and breathe fresh air. I just, well, changed.
How often were you going out before the one whole week at home?
Before that one whole week at home, I went out like only once every 3 days or so, mostly late at night for walking and stretching my legs, and shopping the necessary things and cleaning the trash.
What did you want to do to find peace and quiet?
I dont want to face anything, and wanted to go alone for peace and quietness.
What is your long-term aspiration regarding your digital lifestyle?
I actually quite enjoy being immersed in my own digital world, and hope to do this forever.
What is your perspective on the practice of avoiding or distancing oneself from real-life situations?
People say evading and shying off from real life is a bad idea, yet it helps. Evading makes my emotions more controllable and myself feel more comfortable.
What is the best approach to dealing with difficult or unpleasant situations?
Facing everything directly is a bad idea because it just makes things worse and unbearable. Anyway, this is supposed to be my own choice, the same as procrastinating.
What right do I have to do as I please?
If I want to do so, nobody has the right to tell me not.
How did your running performance change compared to half a year ago?
I tried running and it turned out I had been much slower than I previously was just half a year ago.
What happened to your running endurance after staying home for an extended period?
I could go sub 400 for several kilometers without being too tired, but now I ran like 300 yards and was out of breath, probably as a result of staying home too long.
Why do you feel it is your own choice to stay at home, and not anyone else's duty to command you to go out?
Anyways, staying at home is also my own choice, and it is not anyone elses duty to command me to go out.
What is your current view on running and its impact on your appearance?
I decided running makes the person look older and uglier these last few months, and it is still a topic I am debating whether or not to do.
What is the strange desire that some people have, which is downright stupid to act upon?
Then there is the strange desire to show off. I mean it is downright stupid to do so.
What is the effect of showing off?
Showing off brings nothing but a sense of fake pride, and perhaps some dopamine.
What did you try to do to demonstrate your technical skills, but instead ended up making a fool of yourself?
I wanted to use every means to show how technically advanced I am, only trying to make a big fool out of myself.
What was your view on the desire to show off over the past several years?
I really dont understand the desire to show off, but I remembered this as a need for several years.
What was your motivation for being active on social media as an anonymous person?
I wanted people to notice me, even as an anonymous person on social media, to acknowledge my skills and whatsoever.
Why do you want to try to get your skills verified for another way, perhaps because you are facing such a difficult time at school and losing all your confidence academically?
It is weird, perhaps because I am facing such a difficult time at school, and losing all my confidence academically that I want to try to get my skills verified for another way.
What is your opinion on showing off your skills as a freelancer?
It is still so stupid, I mean, showing off doesnt increase my skills, it only makes me a clown.
How have you grown mentally over the past few months?
Anyways, time shall pass, and I did grow a lot mentally these past few months.
What is the best mindset to have when facing changes or uncertainty in life?
Sometimes time is magical and changes everything, so its best to keep on and try to figure out what to do for the day.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about ustc, titled 'Addressing the Problems Lately'.

messages.content: What has been the state of your mental health lately?
I am dealing with depression. I am not kidding. I had this anxiety and stress for at least 4 years, and its getting worse and worse.
What situations are you suggesting are not as serious as the examples you provided?
Obviously, I am not in a situation as serious as a minor being abused, people facing domestic violence, workers being exploited, working in hardlabour lowpaying jobs for long hours.
What is the purpose of documenting your personal experiences on your personal blog?
But anyway it is still a valid personal experiences, and since this is my personal blog I am documenting it here.
What concerns did you express about work-life balance that were dismissed?

I always expressed concerns about worklife balances, and they were always dismissed for reasons like However, these claims are total invalid and wrong, and a great misunderstanding, I want to clarify.
What is your view on the differences in learning capacities and the need for moderate hours in school?
1. The hating for school have nothing to do with me being superior. People have different learning capacities, and need moderate hours, it isnt targeted to school.
Why do you feel burned out by overworking and not intentionally being superior?
I am also not intentionally being superior or whatsoever when I feel burned out by overworking. 2.
Why do you feel like you are already trying your best and overworking, even though it might not seem that way to others?

Everyone has their limits, and I am alreay trying my best and overworking, while it might be perceived as not working as much I should, actually I am really trying but sometimes people just get tired 3. Things were never fine.
How long have you been having thoughts like the ones you described, and how have they affected you over time?
I had thoughts like this over the past 4 or 5 years, and that thought kept me going for some time, however, things only got worse and worse. I am truly worn out now. 4.
What are the drawbacks of the high academic pressure and demands faced by Chinese students, according to your perspective?

While it is true for cultural norms to neglect these concerns, especially in China where every student overwork, I dont find my situation meaningless or not valid, in fact, while Chinese students can certainly handle large amounts of pressure and demand academically, it usually comes at a cost for enthusiasim, lack of creativity and self motivation, which I think are more crucial than studying itself.
What is your stance on the social trends that you find problematic, and why do you believe that the prevalence of a practice in a culture does not justify it?
The whole social trend is hugely problematic and I am not going into that any more, and the fact something is a norm in a culture doesnt justify it.
What do you find frustrating when you express that you are not feeling okay?
People frequently undermine my claims, when I say I am not ok, nobody cares.
Why do you feel that people often misunderstand and judge your thoughts when you try to articulate them?
People pay no attention to me when I articulate my thoughts, frequently misunderstanding and judging me in their biased views.
What does your parents repeatedly tell you about your performance in high school compared to now?
My parents say to me almost on all our coversations and this is so annoying, You are better off here than in high school, you were fine in high school, you are fine now.
What challenges did you face in high school and during your freshman year that were overlooked and not addressed?
I wasnt fine in high school, nor was I fine in freshman year. In fact, I had significant challenges that they overlooked and didnt pay attention too.
What is your perspective on the current situation compared to your high school experience?
The fact high school was worse off than the situation I am in right now doesnt mean the situation I am in now is fine.
What do your parents and others think about your social abilities and status?
They also downplay my social abilities and misjudge my social status.
What led to your social isolation?
While it is true I am socially isolated, I did this because of the intense pressure of academics, which I cannot cope with continously.
What have you struggled with in balancing your social life and academic responsibilities?
Socially I am actually a fine person. Never once did I find a situation where I could find a study life balance, and all my energies were constrained by school. I struggled so hard.
What is your tendency when you feel overwhelmed as an introvert?
I am an introvert and when I struggle I tend to go more isolated, and its not like I am nonsocial or lacks the skill the deal with peopleits just an effect of being overwhelmed.
What are some ways that introverts can excel at socializing despite their preference for alone time?
Introvert can be perfectly good at socializing, its just they are defined to cope with struggles by spending time alone.
What have you noticed about your ability to connect with people, especially when facing significant imbalances in your life?
I showed remarkable social skills, being able to connect with lots of people repeatedly, but when I face huge imbalances in life I cant help but seem isolated.
What issues are you facing with your parents regarding your situation and the pressures they are placing on you?

My parents were not empathizing with my situation, they are downplaying it and mocking me, not realizing the root causes and keep putting even greater pressure, driving me into those hugely competitive environments in hope for better results, regarding me as a machine rather than a human being in need for balance and mental care.
Why do you feel your parents did not adequately understand and have compassion for your circumstances?
My parents did not pay much care, or they are simply confined in their own circumstances, to adequate understand and compassionate with me.
How did your parents react to the challenges you faced during your freshman year?
My parents regarding my freshman year, a very very challenging year, as perfectly fine was really demeaning to me.
What caused your current depression and led to the worst start of a semester you've ever had?
I wasnt fine that year and that year directly caused my current depression. The start of this semester is inarguably the worst start I ever had.
What was your experience like during the week when you had no motivation to go out or do anything?
I stayed at home for a whole week without any motivation to go out and meet any people at all. I didnt want to do anything, didnt want to work.
What kind of problem were you facing that was similar to taking regular breaks on a long journey?
It was a seroius problem. Sort of like when you are on a long journey, obviously you are taking regular breaks on the road.
What happened when you tried to get back on track after a regular break during that period?
I thought it was a regular break back then, like sit for a while then get going again. Except when I tried to get back on track, I couldnt.
What happened during the three months of March, April, and May when you tried to get yourself back to working in school?
The following three months, March, April, May, I tried really hard to get myself back to working in school, but my efforts always lead to failure and continued disengagement.
Why did you end up taking 10 courses this semester despite knowing things were terribly wrong at the start?
I should have known things were terribly wrong at the start of the semester, I did wrote about it, but people dont care and I ended up selecting 10 courses anyways, just trying to get things done.
Why did you neglect your well-being and the consequences of your actions?
I didnt thought about the consequence and my well being because they were always neglected and disregarded.
What has been the main challenge you've faced lately with your academic performance and personal experiences?
With the increasing bias and polarizing opinions, and me not achieving any success at all in school.
What led you to realize that you were going to break from overworking in China one day?
It became a norm and de facto for overworking in China, and thus, I didnt realize that I was going to break from overworking one day until it happened, which is now.
What factors contributed to your emotional breakdown?
My parents disregarded my wellbeing and the school disregarded my wellbeing. Essentially with huge expectations and a lack of motivation, I fell apart.
What was your experience in the years leading up to this semester, and how did you find the balance between your studies and other aspects of your life during that time?
Recapping those years before not one year is fine, nor did I find any balance in studying.
What emotional difficulties have you been experiencing lately that have been impacting your productivity and well-being?
I have frequent emotional problems usually causing me sleepless nights and making me sad for days. I feel guilty for not performing well. I feel imposter syndrome.
What has been your sleep schedule like lately?
These days, or pretty much all this semester, I slept at daytime and spend half, or all nights up, not being able to fall asleep.
What happened that made you no longer find school interesting?
I cannot get engaged anymore with school, it became very uninteresting.
What do people often say about the transition from middle school to high school?
In middle school, people say just a few more months left of hard work studying and you become happy in high school.
What were your expectations and hopes for your high school experience, and how did the reality compare to what you had envisioned?
I believed in them and worked hard, hoping for a better high school experience, a more balanced and happier teenage years. Instead, it was a total opposite.
What was your high school experience like, and how did it impact your personal growth and development?

The high school I attended was like a prison with dictators and censorship, forcing students to stop using phones and computers, demanding and rigorous schoolwork of over 15 hours a day, frequent gaslighting and brainswashing propagandas you get better person by studying hard, promoting sacrificing sleep, eating times for studying and overly promoting academic role models.
What did your parents do in relation to the school's policies and your desire for a balanced teenage life?
My parents were also in line with the school policy, coercing me to Try hard, and regarding my appeal for a balanced teen life with ridiculous and lack of obvious effort.
What were your experiences like growing up, where you felt you had no choice but to listen to your parents despite the terrible memories it created?
Since I was young, there was no option but to listen, and they remained terrible memories.
What led to you not improving in academics despite working hard, and your parents' perception of you as stupid and problematic?

After working immensely hard, however, I didnt get better in academics because it was a rat race between classmates, and I could never get an ideal score. My parents regarded me as stupid and problematic behavior.
What did you tell your parents when you felt your dormmates' behavior was too overwhelming and unbearable to live with in the dorm?

In university, when I said my dormmates overly problematic behavior was too overwhelming for me and it was no longer bearable to live in the dorm, my parents also claimed it as nonsense and lack of endurance.
What happened when you moved out of your parents' place?

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about alaska, titled 'Visiting Denali'.

messages.content: What day of your trip to Denali National Park was it when you stayed up late because you were too tired to sleep at night?
Today is 519. I stayed up very late because I was too tired I didnt feel like sleeping at night.

I watched a few YouTube videso and organized the photos I took on the previous days.

But I had to get up super early, like 7 am in the morning, to catch the train.

I did see some homeless across the street, where the house owner Rob wrote on a paper saying the Alaskan government released 300 homeless on the streets, and how it had hurt his business.

The cottage was so comfortable and nice that I didnt want to leave. It was so big, like 2 times the normal size, and I really really loved it.

I felt like I could stay there for years. It was kind of tearful goodbye, and I left Anchorage while feeling so sleepy.

Then I got on the train to Denali. The train is very slow, but there are few people on board.

Some people around me talked, and there is a solo traveler who would be spending 8 weeks here and 2 nights in Talkeetna, and there was a midaged couple who is spending 7 weeks here and then going to Vancover and Seattle.

I kind of liked that idea but I got many things to do.

The tour guide talked about the scenic places all along, and also said that they hired high school seniors on a 11 week program to be tour guides. I wondered how much they can earn.

An old man said to a young worker on the train that he would gladly take the job had he been 50 years younger because the view is so fantastic.

We got to Nancy Lake and tour guide said how people would choose to retire here. And most towns on the way doesnt even have electricity.

Anyways, I ended up sleeping all the way to nearly Talkeetna, and missed much of the views, but I was in a better form.

The train is like 8 hours, but actually it only takes 4 hours to go by car.

When we arrived at Talkeetna two Taiwanese, brother and sister, both kind of old, got on the train, and they were speaking in mandarin so I went over and said hi, and we chatted in Chinese.

They had no cars and they also took the flight yesterday, and did a glacier landing.

I talked about how I came from Shanghai, and I went from Seward to here, to which they replied, intersting. They were going to Seward after Denali.

The woman was always taking photos of the beautiful view outside, and exclaiming, beautiful, beautiful, in mandarin with a strong taiwan accent.

They were also going to take the boat cruise, and wanted to walk in downtown, but couldnt go on any hikes because they are not strong enough.

Then they asked what I was studying and stuff, and how computer science degree is good.

Then we passed a beautiful bridge about 900 feet long and the tree opened, and there was a big gorge.

Then I took a picture of them and they took a picture of me, and in the part of the train there was only us 3 people.

The train slowed down at some points to very spectacular views of the whole mountain, but most times there are so many trees.

We even got close to the tree line, where outside everywhere higher than the train there was just snow and rock and bushes, no trees anymore.

We passed some interesting lakes. Then I fell asleep again.

Anyways we arrived at Denali at 4 pm, and I got in the shuttle to the hotel, and ate at a subway.

I went across the street to book an ATV tour and a Jeep tour, then I ate at a subway.

Then I got a stomachache and felt bad for 3 hours.
How did your computer security grade turn out?
Then the grade for computer security was released, and it turns out wasnt good, but wasnt as bad as I expected.

I wondered how I managed to get above average scores on those hard classes even after doing almost nothing for a whole semester, and how I constantly struggled with my coursework even after studying really hard.

Sometimes it seems like working hard at all from the perspective of grades or results, that everything is just the way it is.

If I feel like doing something I accomplish it, no matter if I actually put in effort or not, while if I dont I just cant, and no matter how hard I worked the result doesnt change at all.

Only thing I can do is choose what to do, for example, choose which course to study, choose between going on a trip or studying or watching YouTube.

However, I looked up University of Alaska Anchorages computer science and it didnt appear in csrankings, and turned out to be like number 249, which is like pretty bad.

That was so unfortunate for me. Then I decided to call it a day since it was pretty late, and I am tired and cant do anything else.

Denali looked like a tourism destination while Seward is like normal town, where there are actually people living there. Everywhere in Denali there is just tours, hotels, restaurants, etc.

AnchorageDenali Gorge Me on the Train Mirror Lake Today is 520, and it is already a week since I arrived in Alaska, how time flies! I slept all morning.

Then I went for a hike, but I didnt know where to hike.

My stomach hurt yesterday so I didnt have lunch and breakfast, and I went hiking without like anyfood, but it felt fine anyways.

Then the road became steeper, and the view opened up, and I could see mountains, but there are snows only on top.

Denali melts faster than Seward, where above like 500 ft everything was covered with snow.

The mud is wet everywhere, and I reckoned it is the melting snow, but I dont see any snow until to the very top.

The wind is very strong, and it got quite dangerous after the end of mount healy trail. I was also almost out of water so I turned back.

I felt quite energetic at the top of the mountain, then run down the mountain.

There are two women who was also running, and they passed me as they were running even faster.

I walked very quickly, and went to Denali Park headquarters. But there are few people, so I turned back.

I decide to go back to hotel since it became late, and my legs are a little sore. I think if I had woken up earlier I couldve hiked more.

Then I thought that the mountains in Hefei are a piece of cake, and how well constructed the roads were. I could go up and down 3 times easily now.

The driver said he was from Colorado, and went to all states except Hawaii, which he hopes to make it in his 50th birthday, and that it was his 2nd year in Alaska.

Anyways, he is very humorous and interesting. I thought what a life that would be.

system: You are talking to Jim Chen about journal, titled 'The Painful Journey of Battling Gaming Addiction'.

messages.content: What is the disclaimer or caveat about the personal views expressed in this essay on gaming addiction?
This essay contains some extreme personal views and shouldnt be taken objectively. I am addicted to gaming.
What is your perspective on your gaming addiction and your feelings about it?
I hate to admit it but I was, and I am still very much addicted. I consider my preference for gaming strange.
What types of mainstream games do you dislike playing, unlike your classmates?
I do not like the mainstream games like Clash Royale or Honor of Kings which my classmates play.
What games were you addicted to during the time period from 3rd grade to 7th grade, and what measures have you taken to prevent yourself from gaming since then?
Instead, here is a list of games I remember being addicted to from time order 3rd grade7th grade I have taken multiple measures to prevent myself from gaming, with some success and failure.
What measures did you take to prevent yourself from gaming in the second semester?
second semester I told myself that every time I play I would write it on a notebook. In the end I controlled it.
What game did you play for 8 hours one day, leading you to delete it shortly after in an effort to stop gaming addiction?
and carrot fantasy, and I wanted to stop gaming. One day I played carrot fantasy 8 hours. Shortly after, I deleted carrot fantasy.
What game were you addicted to for about a month before deleting it?
Then I was addicted to plants vs zombies 2, after about a month, I deleted plants vs zombies 2.
What game did you download again after deleting it a second time, and how addicted did you become to it?
Then I downloaded plants vs zombies 2 and was very much addicted again, then I deleted plants vs zombies 2 a second time.
What game did you start playing that you couldn't stop playing, and how did you feel that the gaming itself was not meaningful?
Then I started playing plants vs zombies ol, and couldnt stop playing it.doing something in its backend gaming is not meaningful.
What was your experience like in the second semester when you tried to overcome your gaming addiction?
It was painful and in the second semester I remembered trying so hard. I tried to shift my attention to long walks and outdoor activities.
How often did you play video games during the second semester and summer months?
In the second semester I played roughly once or twice a week, or once two weeks. In the summer I played less afer shifting my attention completely to outdoor activities.
How often did the person play games in the first semester before COVID-19 disrupted their gaming habits?
played only once in September 13rd the first semester. In the second semester covid came.
What made you decide to spend so much time outdoors during the COVID-19 pandemic?
I liked going outdoors so much at that time that even during covid I was out walking 2 hours every day.
How often did you play video games during the second semester, and when did you play the most?
I played less than 5 times the second semester, only before exams when I felt too much pressure. anymore.
What was the result of your intense studying efforts that semester?
However, later that semester I suffered great disappointment, since I tried really hard studyingthe hardest I ever tried so far as I could remember, but still got a really low score.
What happened in the second semester that led you to start playing generals.io twice a week?
As a result, I began to feel depression and became easily irritated. In the second semester, I began to play generals.io sometimes, like about twice a week.
What were the negative impacts of your gaming addiction on your life and studies?
addicted to gaming, to the point I felt sick and hated the dorm. I hated school very much but couldnt do anything since I live far from my parents.
What game did you code in the C Programming course?
I played generals.io sometimes, like less than 1 hour a day. In the C Programming course I coded generals.io single player in C language myself.
What were you doing on January 1st, 2022, that you distinctly remember?
I couldnt do anything to stop it, but it wasnt that serious at that time. I distinctly remember in Janurary 1st 2022 I was playing generals.io as the clock turned.
What caused you to experience great emotional distress during the second semester of your time in the dorm?
In the second semester, however, I grew more frustrated and hated the dorm even more, to the point where I suffered great emotional distress.
What measures have you taken to prevent yourself from gaming?
I tried to control gaming by writing on my notebook before using computer, that this time I use computer only for purpose, not for gaming.
How often did you monitor your computer usage to control your gaming addiction?
I checked my computer time usage every week. In the end I played for some time but it was under control. just got worse.
What did you write an essay about before you started playing zombsroyale.io?
I wrote an essay myself on why gaming is bad, listing all pros and cons. However, it all got worse when I began playing zombsroyale.io.
How did you first get introduced to the game that led to your gaming addiction?
It all started when I accidentally came across the game one afternoon and couldnt stop playing for 2 hours straight.
What was your experience during the first semester of the pandemic, and how did it impact your gaming habits?
In the first semester there was massive covid lockdowns, and I felt bored and depressed being locked down, and couldnt control myself from playing zombsroyale anymore.
What happened during your second semester that led to your gaming addiction getting even worse?
In the second semester I got on the exchange program to UC Berkeley. Then things got even worse.
How much time did you spend playing the game zombsroyale this year, and what were the effects on your motivation and well-being?
In the US, I was very lonely and unmotivated, and I completely lost control of playing zombsroyale. I played for more than 600 hours this year. I did try to stop playing, without any success.
What motivated you to stop gaming for a week straight during the school lockdown?
In October I stopped gaming for a week straight, motivated to do work when the school was locked down, destroying my motivation.
What project did you face in April that led you to procrastinate and cheat?
In April I faced a challenging project, and started procrastinating, playing zombsroyale nearly all day long. I ended up cheating in that project.
When did you decide to end gaming, and how long were you successful in doing so?
In May I decided to end gaming, and succeeded for a week.
What events led to you feeling very sad and fully embarrassed about yourself, causing you to fall back into emotional distress you had suffered for a long time?
However, in June I was caught for the previous cheating, and I got very sad and fully embarrassed of myself, pulling myself back into emotional distress I suffered for long.
What led you to drop one of your summer classes and spend a week playing Zombsroyale extensively?
In early August I felt completely out of motivation and dropped one of the summer classes, playing zombsroyale all day long for a week.
What motivated you to stop gaming, and what was the outcome when you tried to do so?
Then I decided to stop gaming once and for all, but in the test I got really low scores, making me disappointed once again and lost motivation.
What measures did you take to try to stop gaming on the website zombsroyale?
Then in late August I tried to stop gaming by disabling zombsroyale etchosts, rewriting the etchosts every few seconds in systemctl service, and dropping the ip address of zombsroyale in iptables.
